text: The Indians just crossed midfield for the first time, and they have some momentum. Senior RB Xavian King had 34 rushing yards this quarter.
End 1: Hickory leads 10-0. St. Stephens had just 22 yards of offense in the opening quarter. #PrepBlitz
TD Hickory! Izaak Milsaps gets the 2-yard score. He's had 2 carries this season, both for touchdowns. 10-0 Hickory, Q1 0:45. #PrepBlitz
A pair of penalties derail the Indians and they will have to punt it back to Hickory.
St. Stephens will start its first drive of the night at its own 26.
The Red Tornadoes take a 3-0 lead on a 23-yard field goal from Harrison Boston. Good stop for the Indians in the red zone. #PrepBlitz
Senior QB Derrien Phillips is 3-for-3 so far as Hickory has moved into the red zone.
Kevin Shuford returns the kick to the Hickory 30 and we are underway in the final game of the regular season. #PrepBlitz
St. Stephens has won the toss and deferred to the second half. Hickory will receive the opening kickoff.

Pregame read: Last year's meeting between these two came down to the wire, with Hickory pulling out a late win: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/sports/phillip s-scores-go-ahead-td-makes-late-pick-as-hhs/article_96b1313e-92a0-11e6-9ff3-87c3d7f0de2e.html …

Pregame read: SSHS also comes into tonight riding the waves of a huge victory last week: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/prep-blit z-review-st-stephens-rolls-over-south-caldwell/article_50acb2ab-b17e-5e91-b434-9bbb46c70162.html …

Pregame read: Hickory pulled off a huge upset of ACHS last week to set up the Red Tornadoes for a playoff spot: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/sports/high_sc hool/football/prep-blitz-review-seniors-come-up-huge-in-hickory-s/article_f73defa2-5be4-5f58-8af1-10aa894f3d08.html …
I'm at St. Stephens tonight for a big cross-town rivalry game between @hickory_high and @ststephensath . #PrepBlitz
I'm fully onboard for this.
They let your boy get away with quoting The Waterboy in a story. Check it out! https:// twitter.com/hickoryrecord/ status/926552062371905536 …
Oh, and food & beverages will be provided as well! Sounds like a can't-miss event.
Speakers will include new Crawdads President Neil Leibman, Hickory Mayor Jeff Cline and City Manager Warren Wood. Gates open at 10:30 a.m.
The @HickoryCrawdads and @Rangers will host a public event at L.P. Frans Stadium on Nov. 14 at 11:15 a.m. to announce team purchase.

Last game of the year, Brent. Can't hold anything back now." My #PrepBlitz story on final week of regular season: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/prep-blit z-hickory-area-high-school-football-teams-prep-to/article_49a6ca3c-add1-5ba9-a88e-2761a7e2d3d3.html …"

Woke up to a world where the Cubs are no longer the World Series champs. I think I’ll sleep much easier tonight.

Here's my recap from a first-round win for @hickory_high tonight against Jay M. Robinson: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/sports/high_sc hool/hickory-soccer-cruises-past-robinson-in-state-tourney/article_26ded718-bf62-11e7-a0e0-4f25ec4a9b95.html …
Final: Hickory advances with a 4-0 victory! Second-round game will Be Saturday, but opponent/time TBD.
Rowland gets his second of the night off a rebounded shot to put Hickory ahead 4-0 with a half hour to play!
Halftime: The Red Tornadoes take that 3-0 lead into the break. Just 40 minutes separate them from the second round of the 3A playoffs.
3-0 Hickory! That was a play from the training ground. Free kick to the wall, where Jaryd Stillwell played to Nick Sadowski for the goal.
Hickory scores again! Brayden Rowland beats the keeper on the breakaway and Hickory is up 2-0 inside the opening 10 minutes.
Goal Hickory just 11 seconds into the match! Wow that was fast. Santiago Betancourt puts the Red Tornadoes in front off the kickoff.
Switching gears from Champions League: @hickory_high just kicked off its first-round 3A state playoff game against J. M. Robinson. pic.twitter.com/LCMqC2Qzkg
Solid (and expected) result today. On to the next one. #YNWA https:// twitter.com/lfc/status/925 838664281870336 …
. @FOXSports please tell your commentator for Liverpool-Maribor that there is no H in Firmino’s name. #PivotToCorrectPronunciation
Someone has to grab the rebound and start the fast break, so it might as well be me. #PressOn https:// twitter.com/HDRmaxseng/sta tus/925756686899597314 …
Well the day is finally here... https:// twitter.com/hickoryrecord/ status/925732377116241920 …
One more day of baseball. #WorldSeries

Here's my recap from the Bears getting upset in the first round of the South Atlantic Conference postseason tourney: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/sports/college /lenoir-rhyne/lru-men-s-soccer-upset-in-sac-tourney/article_54972190-beab-11e7-91d1-9f56a52dea06.html …
Final: No. 6 Anderson upsets No. 3 Lenoir-Rhyne with 3 goals in the second half to win 3-2.
Bears down to their final three minutes to find another equalizer and send this to extra time...
73' - Anderson retakes the lead on a penalty. Bears keeper Zach King felled an Anderson player diving for a loose ball; Lars Kaula converts.
66' - LR goal! Ignacio de Goya earns a penalty; Florian Simon sends the keeper the wrong way for the equalizer! Action is picking up here!
And four minutes later, Anderson is ahead. It's another header, this one from Josh Calabria, and the Bears trail 2-1.
Anderson just scored through a corner, with Colin Burris heading home the equalizer. Bears have 28 minutes to find a winner.
Also a huge half from Bears keeper Zach King, who made five saves in the opening 45 minutes.
Half: Fernandez's goal (which might have been an own goal) is the difference at the break as the Bears lead 1-0. 45 minutes away from semis!
26' - LR goal! It's Marc Fernandez who puts the Bears in front midway through the first half.
Quarterfinal action between No. 3 @LRUMSOC and No. 6 Anderson is underway. Winner advances to Friday’s semifinal in Rock Hill. pic.twitter.com/eTauLi7MZo
Bro let me know when you get settled so I can come visit!
Bears begin their postseason run at home against Anderson, who they drew 1-1 against earlier this month. I'll have live coverage tonight. https:// twitter.com/BearsSports/st atus/925461105715154945 …
I learned so much while interning here last fall. Hoping for the best for all the great reporters at the Statesman. #SupportLocalJournalism https:// twitter.com/statesman/stat us/925355821587927040 …

Bears pull it off! Awana posts a double-double as Lenoir-Rhyne beats The Citadel 97-83!
Upset brewing in Hickory! Bears hold a 10-point lead with less than four minutes to play. https:// twitter.com/BearsSports/st atus/924740595964289024 …
LR closes on a 10-2 run over the final 2 minutes to trail The Citadel 39-36 at half. Bertrand Awana leads the Bears with 7 pts and 7 boards.
Decent crowd at Shuford Gym today for @LRU_Basketball exhibition against The Citadel. Bears down 20-14 midway through the 1st half. pic.twitter.com/WdL3U5PT4D
D1 basketball comes to Hickory today. https:// twitter.com/bearssports/st atus/924644110111248385 …
My recap from a thrilling 4-3 senior day win for @LRUMSOC : http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/lru-men-s -soccer-holds-off-newberry-on-senior-day/article_0aae135e-bc3a-11e7-8f35-27725ca6dbcb.html …
Road trip proves unsuccessful as Lenoir-Rhyne falls to 3-5 this season. https:// twitter.com/bearssports/st atus/924410024969072640 …
Final: Bears win a thrilling 4-3 game on senior day!

Here's my quick recap from a 2-0 loss on senior day for Lenoir-Rhyne women's soccer: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/townnews/sport /newberry-spoils-senior-day-for-lru-women-s-soccer/article_b65233b4-bc23-11e7-b252-ffcfe9d3c9c8.html …

Final: Newberry scores on either side of halftime to spoil senior day for the Bears, 2-0.
Halftime: The Bears had a handful of good looks, but trail Newberry 1-0 at the break.
Storm clouds hanging over the Moretz Sports - Athletic Complex as @LRUWSOC hosts Newberry for senior day today. Kickoff is moments away. pic.twitter.com/v3nk2EiToE

Lenoir-Rhyne football travels to UNC Pembroke today. Read my preview story on the Bears' punter and oldest freshman: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/lenoir-rh yne-university-finds-veteran-presence-from-unlikely-source/article_c12da695-769e-5263-9799-05aceddcf6c2.html …
Good response after a goalless first half. #YNWA https:// twitter.com/lfcusa/status/ 924302732122558470 …

My quick recap from a huge @hickory_high upset of Alexander Central on senior night: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/prep-blit z-hickory-knocks-off-previously-unbeaten-alexander-central/article_4b88267c-bb8f-11e7-9cde-03342741357c.html …
Final: Hickory knocks off previously unbeaten Alexander Central 38-28! What a huge win for the Red Tornadoes on senior night! #PrepBlitz
TD Hickory! Phillips keeps it from 14 yards and this should be over! Hickory leads 38-28 with 1:26 to play! #PrepBlitz
Cougars get a first down but then turn it over on downs! Hickory has the ball back with 2:27 to play!
Alexander Central takes over at its own 20 after the kickoff lands in the end zone.
TD Hickory! Phillips hits Antonio Parks for a 32-yard score and the lead! Red Tornadoes up 31-28 with 3:56 to play. #PrepBlitz
Both offenses have gone cold in the fourth. After trading punts, Hickory takes over at its own 38 with 5:21 to play.
End 3: Alexander Central takes a 28-24 lead into the final 12 minutes. Still plenty to play for here. #PrepBlitz
Hickory goes three and out again. Tough quarter for the Red Tornadoes. They'll need a big defensive stop here.
TD Cougars! Tevin Clark scores from 2 yards and Alexander Central leads for the first time tonight. 28-24 Cougars, 2:46 3rd. #PrepBlitz
Hickory responds by going three and out. Boston comes out for his first punt of the night.
TD Cougars! Weiss scores his third tonight and Anderson converts the 2-point run. Hickory leads 24-21, 7:53 left in the third. #PrepBlitz
Alexander Central returns the kickoff to its own 19 and the third quarter is officially underway.
The band has performed, the teams are back on the field and the fan field goal contest (yes, really) is finally over. Let's play football.
Halftime: Hickory holds 24-13 lead at the break. Cougars coach Butch Carter had some words for the refs on his way off the field. #PrepBlitz
The Red Tornadoes now lead 24-13 with just 1:06 left in the first half. #PrepBlitz
It's a fake and it's a Hickory TD! Phillips takes the snap and stands up to find Kasy Hardin for a 24-yard TD! What a play call!
Hickory calls its second timeout of the quarter, facing 4th and 12 from the Cougar 24. Looks like a 41-yard FG attempt is the choice.
Phillips goes for the end zone, but it's picked off! Cougars now have it at their own 20.
TD Cougars! It's Weiss with his 2nd, as he breaks tackles on a 17-yard score. AC trails 17-13 after failed PAT. 9:44 to halftime. #PrepBlitz
Alexander Central converts on 4th and 1 at the Hickory 27 to keep this drive alive.
End 1: Hickory leads undefeated Alexander Central 17-7 after 12 minutes of play. #PrepBlitz
Hickory extends its lead to 17-7 with a 26-yard field goal from Harrison Boston just before the end of the quarter. #PrepBlitz
Cougars answer back on a 4-yard run from senior Devon Weiss. Cuts the Hickory lead to 14-7 with 4:28 left in the 1st. #PrepBlitz
TD Hickory! Phillips hits Staton on a quick screen and he sprints 20 yards untouched for the score! 14-0 Hickory, 6:40 Q1. #PrepBlitz
The Cougars start with a 39-yard pass from Gunnar Anderson to Kendall Flowers, but the drive stalls. Hickory takes over at its own 14.
TD Hickory! Senior QB Derrien Phillips runs in from 11 yards for the opening score. 7-0 Hickory in less than two minutes. #PrepBlitz
Three runs from seniors - two by Jaelin Byrd and one from Jaekwon Staton - move Hickory into the red zone.
Red Tornadoes start at their own 45 thanks to an illegal block in the back on the Cougars kickoff.
Hickory wins the pregame toss and has elected to receive. Red Tornadoes gonna try to get an early jump on the Cougars.
I had pizza, wings and cookies, so I can't complain.

The Red Tornadoes are still in the playoff hunt, but needed a miracle last week to avoid an upset at South Caldwell: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/prep-blit z-review-patriots-yards-and-one-improbable-hickory-win/article_16e53cb5-4e46-52c5-904e-adbfddac1df8.html …

Hickory celebrates its graduating class tonight for senior night, which was the focus of my game of the week story: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/prep-blit z-hickory-to-crown-senior-class-against-alexander-central/article_28f8ad31-cde1-5587-b810-d1cc17538d15.html …

Lenoir-Rhyne football has the weekend off, but I wrote some words anyway: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/the-final -push-lenoir-rhyne-university-football-takes-a-week/article_1546916a-7cda-534f-a549-79d8b189a3c4.html …

My recap from a wild walk-off win for @hickory_high tonight at South Caldwell: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/prep-blit z-hickory-wins-at-the-death-to-survive-south/article_1aae6f80-b60c-11e7-b280-6feda9c59de8.html …
Ball was tipped at the goal line and Staton comes up with it somehow, some way! 27-23 final! #PrepBlitz
TD HICKORY!!!! WALK OFF WIN RED TORNADOES!!!
Shuford has one deep... but he's out of bounds. This is it. Fourth down, 7 seconds, 38 yards to the end zone.
Staton catches a 3-yard pass and Hickory calls timeout. Then Parks drops a 15-yard gain. 14 seconds left...
Staton returns the kickoff to the Spartans 41... 28 seconds remaining and Hickory has all three timeouts.
Here we go. 43 seconds left and South Caldwell is attempting a 31-yard field goal... and it's good! Spartans lead 23-21! #PrepBlitz
Hickory forces the Spartans to punt, but Kasy Hardin can't hold onto the ball and South Caldwell recovers at the Hickory 41!
Hickory back in front! Phillips runs in a keeper from 9 yards to give Red Tornadoes a 21-20 lead with 6:15 to play. Buckle up. #PrepBlitz
Spartans lead! Aaron Kirby picks a Phillips pass and returns it 89 yards for a score! South Caldwell up 20-14 after 2pt conv. #PrepBlitz
TD Spartans! Harley Sullivan pounds it in from 8 yards to bring South Caldwell within 14-12 after failed 2pt conv. 11:55 left. #PrepBlitz
Red Tornadoes ran just seven plays in the third quarter.
End 3: Hickory still leads 14-6, but the Spartans have a big third and 4 from the Hickory 8 coming out of the break. #PrepBlitz
Hickory blocks a punt on South Caldwell's opening drive, but Phillips throws an interception two plays later to give it right back.
Half: Hickory leads South Caldwell 14-6 after 24 minutes of play. #PrepBlitz
TD Spartans! Deep pass from Jason Martin to Austin Raynor results in 40-yard score. HHS leads 14-6 after missed XP, 0:21 2nd. #PrepBlitz
Grant Amos gets Hickory's fifth sack of the half and the Red Tornadoes call their second timeout. Under 30 seconds left in the half now.
Second timeout called for Spartans with 44 seconds before halftime. Ball is at the Hickory 34.
Hickory punts from its own 6 and Harrison Boston does a great job to handle the low snap and get rid of the kick.
South Caldwell punts for the first time tonight and it's downed at the Hickory 4. Red Tornadoes lead 14-0 with 3:38 left in the half.
Spartans attempt a 35-yard FG but are tackled before the kick. Hickory then loses a fumble two plays later to give it right back.
TD Hickory! Jaelin Byrd opens the 2nd with a 30-yard run to paydirt. Red Tornadoes lead 14-0 with 11:51 to halftime. #PrepBlitz
End 1: Hickory leads South Caldwell 7-0. Red Tornadoes have the ball at the Spartans 30 after the break. #PrepBlitz
On their next drives, Hickory punts and South Caldwell again turns it over on a 4th down inside Red Tornadoes territory.
South Caldwell drives into Hickory territory on its first drive, but the Spartans turn it over after a failed 4th down attempt.
TD Hickory! Derrien Philips hits a quick slant to Antonio Parks, who takes it 34 yards to the end zone! 7-0 Hickory, 10:18 1st. #PrepBlitz
Hickory starts the opening drive from its own 27 on a crisp Friday night.
Hickory wins the toss and has elected to receive. Red Tornadoes gonna look to strike first tonight.
Hickory is in 3-way tie with St. Stephens, West Caldwell for 3rd in conference. A win tonight moves Red Tornadoes a step closer to playoffs.

Meanwhile, South Caldwell (1-7, 1-3) couldn't slow down Freedom in a 28-3 loss: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/prep-blit z-review-freedom-s-aerial-attack-flattens-spartans/article_c8a375f2-a252-588f-9428-081fcc496bc9.html …

My recap from @hickory_high tonight, where the Red Tornadoes were 5-2 winners: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/players-s core-in-hickory-soccer-win-over-south-caldwell/article_80d9174a-b465-11e7-aa3a-5b485a7a9fd0.html …
Final: Five @hickory_high players score in a 5-2 win against South Caldwell. Hickory is now 10-1 in conference play with three games to go.
South Caldwell adds another one on what looks like a Hickory own goal. Score is now 5-2 Red Tornadoes with 10 minutes remaining.
Hickory goal! Brayden Rowland has a 40-yard breakaway and forces the SC keeper to commit before shooting. Make it 5-1 Red Tornadoes.
South Caldwell gets one back through Jonathan Bonet, who heads home a cross to cut Hickory's lead to 4-1 with a half hour remaining.
Hickory goal! The rout is on as Jaryd Stillwell taps home a low cross from Nick Sadowski for a 4-0 lead.
Halftime: Goals from Alex Pleasant, Ayden Kelly and Isaiah Bradley have @hickory_high ahead 3-0 at the break.
Hickory is rolling, just scored a third goal to catch the South Caldwell defense unaware.
And the Red Tornadoes have a second goal not even halfway though the first!
Hickory earns a penalty! And it's an opening goal for the Red Tornadoes!

Here's my recap from tonight's @bearssports win at Limestone, with quotes from @coach_kellar and Landon Scott: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/opportuni stic-defense-leads-bears-to---road-win/article_b8da04e4-b139-11e7-9557-77d0d74fad63.html …
Final: Lenoir-Rhyne 35, Limestone 7. Huge road win for the Bears!
Kyle Dugger adds his name to the INT total! He catches the fourth one for the Bears tonight. L-R just needs to see out final 1:55.
Grayson Willingham is in at QB for the third game this year. I assume it's to get him some reps, but Kellar hasn't looked great tonight.
Instead, the Saints punt it back to L-R. Bears take over at their own 18 with 6:12 to play.
Vyncint Smith just made an incredible 52-yard TD catch for Limestone, but a holding penalty wipes that off the board. Big break for Bears.
Just learned from the L-R radio crew that Scott broke a school record for total INT return yards in a game. Previous record was 100 yards.
TD Bears! Huff splits through the line and sprints 39 yards to the end zone for his second score of the year! 35-7 L-R, 9:06 to play.
The Bears can't get anything on this drive and will punt it away. Clock ticks under 12 minutes.
Landon Scott gets his second interception of the game! Caught a tipped pass at the goal line and returned it to the Bears 42!
End 3: Lenoir-Rhyne leads 28-7. Fifteen minutes separate the Bears from their second conference win of the season.
Kellar throws to the end zone but he's picked off for a second time tonight.
Lenoir-Rhyne defense is just stifling tonight. Saints have punted on two straight drives. Bears take over here at LC 37 up three scores.
TD Bears! It’s Brown with his second of the game and now it’s a 28-7 lead just a few minutes into the third!
Saints’ first drive of the third ends in an interception! Quentin Hayes hangs on to the tipped pass. What a start for the Bears!
Patton had 58 yards on eight carries, but 38 of those came on his lone TD run. Averaging less than 3 ypc otherwise.
Lenoir-Rhyne ran for 92 of its 135 yards in the half, led by Brown's 53 and a score. Huff had 37 on six carries as well.
Got the #RedRiverShowdown game on in the press box here. These are the moments that make legends.
Halftime: Lenoir-Rhyne leads Limestone 21-7 after a half of play. Bears defense has done great to contain SAC's third-leading rusher.
Bears D comes up with a big fourth-down stop as Jaquan Artis gets a sack! L-R takes over at its own 39 with 54 seconds left in the half.
That's a team-leading fifth TD catch for Camargo.
TD Bears! It's a 16-yard play-action pass from Kellar to Sam Camargo for a 21-7 lead! 4:25 remaining before halftime.
Bears went for it again on 4th and the pass is incomplete, but a Limestone pass interfence call moves the chains for L-R.
Limestone cuts the deficit to 14-7 on a 38-yard scamper from Patton. Man, he's quick. Just under 13 minutes to halftime.
End 1: Bears remain ahead 14-0 thanks to Nelson Brown and their first defensive touchdown of the season.
Lenoir-Rhyne now leads 14-0 with 27 seconds left in the first. Defense has come up huge so far.
And two plays after that, Landon Scott picks off the Saints QB and returns it 95 yards for a TD!! What a sequence!
Next play, Jarrod Kellar throws an interception to give it right back to Limestone.
Saints drive ends with a strip and fumble recovery by Bears freshman Quentin Hayes!
TD Bears! Nelson Brown runs his 5th score of the season on a 7-yard plunge and dive across the line. 7-0 Lenoir-Rhyne, 4:07 1st.
Bears are moving. Just converted on 4th and 5 from the LC 34 to keep the drive alive.
Huff picks up the first Lenoir-Rhyne first down of the game on his second carry. He only had one last week against Newberry.
Limestone picks up a first down, but has to punt soon after. Bears take over at their own 32 for this second drive.
Lenoir-Rhyne starts with a three-and-out, bringing Hayden Burgiel out for a punt.
Limestone wins the toss and defers. Xzavion Huff returns the opening kick to the Bears 23 and we are underway in Gaffney!
Patton averages 100 rushing yards per game, second in the conference to L-R's Nelson Brown (118 ypg).
The Saints (3-3, 2-1 SAC) fell to Carson-Newman last week by a score of 31-20. Freshman RB Jerko'ya Patton ran for 135 yards and a TD.

Dula scores again on a 2-yard carry, then runs in the conversion. Hickory leads 59-49, 5:52 to play. This might never end. #PrepBlitz

Boston is just wide left on a 32-yard field goal with 9 minutes to play. Warriors take over at their own 20.

Hickory can only manage 3 yards on its opening drive of the quarter. First three-and-out for either team tonight.
Warriors get a 17-yard TD pass from Dula to James Coburn on 4th down to cut deficit to 38-27. 8:42 left here in the 3rd. #PrepBlitz
Taye Dula takes the kickoff 99 yards to the end zone, but there's a facemask flag on West Caldwell. Warriors will still start at Hickory 28.

West Caldwell answers with a 2-yard run from Jeremy Boyce, cutting the Hickory lead to 31-14 with 2:35 before halftime. #PrepBlitz

WCHS fumble! Hickory's Antwan Shuford stripped Dula and returned it 49 yards to the Warrior 4!

Jeremy Boyce takes the kickoff all the way to the Hickory 20, where the Warriors will start the drive.

End 1: Hickory leads 7-0 in a quick first quarter. Red Tornadoes facing 3rd and 3 from WCHS 9 after the break. #PrepBlitz
A pair of Hickory defenders sack Warriors QB Kaleb Dula on third down and West Caldwell has to punt.

Here's my recap of @LRUWSOC 2-1 win against Saint Leo earlier today: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/lru-women -s-soccer-beats-saint-leo-in-midweek-tilt/article_8cfcb5fc-adfa-11e7-bae1-4f91d3aa669e.html …
Final: Bears win 2-1! Lenoir-Rhyne is now 8-3-1 this season, returns to action Saturday at UNC Pembroke.
Saint Leo has really increased the pressure since its goal, but so far the Bears defense has held firm. Two minutes to go...
72' - Saint Leo is on the board. Sophia Kenny heads in after the Lions had a free kick from 20 yards out. Bears now lead 2-1.
62' - Lenoir-Rhyne commits a handball in the box, but Alayna Morris guesses right on the penalty and makes the big save! Bears still up 2-0.
Half: Lenoir-Rhyne takes a 2-0 lead into the break thanks to goals inside the opening 15 minutes.
13' - Goal LR! Claire Niebergall gets her first of the season! Saint Leo tried to clear a corner but the junior defender put it away!
7' - Goal LR! Brown plays a low cross along the face of goal and Madi Kyle poked it home! Second of the year for the sophomore midfielder.
Bears having early success up the left flank. Abbie Brown has beat her defender twice in the opening five minutes. Still scoreless.
Looks like the sun is starting to break through for this non-conference match between @LRUWSOC and Saint Leo. Kickoff is a few minutes away. pic.twitter.com/tFlP1xeZ6x
This has been the highlight of my day so far.

My recap from a disappointing @LRBearsFootball homecoming loss: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/newberry- spoils-lenoir-rhyne-s-homecoming-game/article_799bed42-abb7-11e7-b4a7-eb292a414303.html …
Final: Newberry spoils L-R's homecoming with a 34-7 victory. Bears fall to 2-4 (1-3 SAC) with a trip to Limestone next week.
Well that didn't matter. Bears go three and out. Just 2:15 left before this is mercifully over.
Bears have put Grayson Willingham in at QB with 4 minutes to play. Redshirt freshman hasn't played since the season opener.
Crowd has mostly thinned out and I can't say I blame them.
Ruff to Castle for the third time today, this one a 60-yard go route, puts Newberry ahead 34-7 after failed conversion. 12:45 left to play.
The Bears get inside the Newberry 35, but Kellar is picked off for the second time today. Pass went right to the DB...
End 3: Lenoir-Rhyne still trails 28-7. Newberry will punt from its own 14 once play resumes. Can Bears find a few miracles?
Well the Bears got out of the shadow of their goal at least. But here comes Burgiel for another punt.
Another break for the Bears: Newberry commits a face mask and a late hit on the same play. L-R out to its own 39 now.
Instead Newberry goes for it and the Bears hold the line! Huge, huge stop there. L-R takes over at its own 1, though.
An L-R offside blows another big defensive play. Ivan Milliken had blocked a 21-yard field goal.
It had been misting off and on for the past two hours, but now rain is steadily falling at Moretz Stadium.
Newberry calls its first timeout of the half facing third and goal at the 5. Bears would love to hold the Wolves to a field goal attempt.
Fumble recovery TD Bears!! Wait... nope that's coming back. An L-R player jumped offside. That could have been a huge momentum swing.
And on 3rd and 17, Ruff scrambles for 22. That's a killer.
Quentin Hayes gets his first sack of the year! Huge play to force Newberry into a 2nd and 17.
Newberry starts at its own 35 after the kickoff goes out of bounds at the 1. Let's see if some rest does the Bears defense good.
TD Bears! Kellar to T.J. Smith on a 6-yard slant gets L-R on the board. It's now 28-7 Newberry with 8:56 left in the third.
Jarrod Kellar's pass is picked off by Anfernee Moffett, who returns it 45 yards for a TD. 28-0 Newberry just a minute into the third.
Newberry's kick goes into the end zone, so Lenoir-Rhyne will start the third quarter from its own 25.
At least the band is playing Roxanne at halftime. I can fully get behind this.
L-R defense started well, but lack of offensive production (104 total yards in the half) kept the defense on the field an extra 7 minutes.
Half: Newberry leads Lenoir-Rhyne 21-0. Bears need to make serious adjustments to prevent a third straight homecoming loss.
And on the next play, Ruff fakes the jet sweep and keeps it himself for the score. Lenoir-Rhyne now trails 21-0 with 1:43 before halftime.
Wolves take their first timeout of the half with 1:49 remaining, facing 2nd and 9 at the L-R 10.
Hayden Burgiel comes out for his fourth punt of the game. Newberry takes over at its own 41.
The defense holds Newberry to a punt, but a block in the back means L-R starts this drive at its own 7. There's 8 minutes left in the half.
From bad to worse... Kenny Carter loses a fumble on his first carry of the season. Bears had moved into Newberry territory.
The Bears punt again, and Newberry capitalized with a 26-yard connection between Ruff and Castle. 14-0 Wolves, 10:47 to half.
Newberry strikes first. Ruff to Markell Castle for 13 yards on third down. Wolves lead 7-0, 14:51 left before halftime.
End 1: Neither team finds the end zone in a scoreless opening quarter. The Wolves face 3rd and 7 at the L-R 12 out of the break.
Wolves pick up 5 yards on 4th and 2 from the LR 36 to keep this drive alive.
Newberry has picked up three first downs on this drive so far. Wolves switched from Nick Jones to Greg Ruff at QB and it's working.
And the Bears will punt for the second time as well. Newberry D line is causing fits so far. L-R had two holding penalties on that drive.
Jaquan Artis and Amari Houston combine on a big third-down sack to force Newberry to punt for the second time today.
First play for Lenoir-Rhyne's offense is a 21-yard run for freshman Lorenzo Gist. But two incompletions and an 11-yard loss lead to a punt.
Three run plays net Newberry three yards and an upcoming punt. Great start for the Bears defense!
The Wolves start the first drive of the game at their own 28.
Lenoir-Rhyne has won the toss and deferred to the second half. Newberry will receive the opening kick.
Overcast skies as some light rain starts to fall at Moretz Stadium as the Bears take the field. Hopefully it gets no worse than this.
A win today would give Lenoir-Rhyne a winning streak for the first time since '15 and also end a two-year losing streak in homecoming games.

Final: Watauga beats Hickory 49-42. Red Tornadoes fall to 3-4 overall and 1-2 in Northwestern 3A/4A play. #PrepBlitz
Watauga recovers the onside kick and that should do it.
TD Hickory! Byrd runs in from 4 yards. Hickory trails 49-42 with 16 seconds left and 2 timeouts. Onside upcoming... #PrepBlitz
Phillips to Staton on the fade route and he catches it! But the refs say he's out of bounds. Brings up third down.
Watauga fumbles at its own 5 and Izaak Milsaps recovers! 39 seconds to play and Hickory has 3 timeouts...
TD Hickory! It's a consolation 4-yard run for Phillips. Hickory trails 49-35 with 48 seconds left. #PrepBlitz
Castle runs in for his 3rd TD on a 7-yard keeper. Watauga leads 49-28 with 1:22 to play. #PrepBlitz
TD Hickory! Byrd takes the pitch and scores from 4 yards. Hickory trails 42-28 with 6:48 to play. Lot of work still to do... #PrepBlitz
Satterfield scores his 3rd TD tonight, this time from 10 yards, to put Watauga ahead 42-21 with 9:52 to play. #PrepBlitz
End 3: Watauga leads Hickory 35-21. Pioneers held the ball for 10 minutes that quarter. #PrepBlitz
Hickory's drive stalls at midfield and the Red Tornadoes punt for just the second time tonight. Watauga takes over at its own 20.
Castle scores on a 2-yard keeper to push Watauga's lead to 35-21. Pioneers ate 6.5 minutes of clock. 5:30 left in the 3rd. #PrepBlitz
Harrison Boston's kickoff goes for a touchback, and Watauga will start the third quarter from its own 20.
Halftime: Watauga leads 28-21 at the break. Quite an exciting half and everything is still to play for. #PrepBlitz
TD Hickory! Phillips scrambles 13 yards, gets his feet inside the pylon. Pass to Jaylin Harper for 2 is good. 28-21 WHS, 0:31 2nd #PrepBlitz
Watauga scores on a 59-yard pass (1st throw of the game) from Castle to Philip Shukis. Pioneers lead 28-13, 3:57 before halftime. #PrepBlitz
Wild sequence set that up. Phillips threw an INT inside the red zone, but Castle lost a fumble on the very next play.
TD Hickory! Jaelin Byrd runs in from a yard out to cut Watauga's lead to 21-13. 4:41 left in the opening half. #PrepBlitz
Watauga scores on the first play to take a 21-7 lead. Castle faked a handoff and ran 64 yards to the house. 7:24 left to half. #PrepBlitz
TD Hickory! Quintavious Saddler punches in from 2 yards to pull the Red Tornadoes within 14-7. 7:45 left in the half. #PrepBlitz
Watauga drives 97 yards in 10 plays as Satterfield runs in for his 2nd 1-yard TD. Pioneers lead 14-0 after conversion, 10:30 2nd. #PrepBlitz
End 1: Watauga leads 6-0. Satterfield had 84 rushing yards in that opening quarter. #PrepBlitz
Hickory converts a 4th and 3 inside the WHS 35, but a holding call negates that. Penalties have been a problem all year.
Watauga takes a 6-0 lead after Isaac Satterfield's 1-yard run. Pioneers ran on all eight plays. 6:32 left in the first. #PrepBlitz
After a 10-yard run, Hickory QB Derrien Phillips overthrows a receiver and is intercepted. Watauga takes over at its own 31.
Hickory starts from its own 35 after the kickoff.
Hickory has won the toss and will receive the opening kick. Watauga is celebrating homecoming; can the Red Tornadoes spoil the party?

My recap of a big win for @LRBearsFootball and even bigger night for @Nelmoney_5 (more pics coming soon): http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/brown-s-r ushing-yards-carry-lenoir-rhyne-over-tusculum/article_a3a2a95a-a61c-11e7-b197-f72fa8937bea.html …
Final: Lenoir-Rhyne gets back in the win column with a 23-7 win against Tusculum. Brown finished with 256 yards, 5 shy of his career best.
Should add that the TD was set up by Duane Bland, who picked off the Tusculum QB inside the Pioneers 20.
TD Bears! Nelson Brown scores his 2nd tonight, a 19-yard stretch play to extend L-R's lead to 23-7 with 9:40 to play.
Third quarter is a scoreless one. Kyle Dugger blocked a 20-yd FG attempt to keep the Bears up 16-7.
Brown's 91-yard run is the longest non-scoring run in L-R history. Previous record belonged to Wayne Bell (78 yards) in 1959.
Halftime: Lenoir-Rhyne leads 16-7 at the break. Nelson Brown has been the big difference for the Bears, running for 163 yards and a score.
Pioneers score with 11 seconds before half on a 17-yard slant from Alex Ogle to Evan Gates.
TD Bears! Brown needs two more carries, but he finishes what he started with a 3-yard plunge. The XP is missed, so L-R leads 16-0, 2:38 2nd.
Word in the press box is that was the longest offensive play in the history of Pioneer Field. Brown up to 158 yards on just eight carries.
Tusculum punts, pins the Bears at own 4. But Nelson Brown has other plans! He finds a hole and goes 91 yards to be dragged down at the 5!
That's Camargo's fourth TD catch of the season, more than any other Bears receiver.
TD Bears! Kellar fakes a handoff to Huff and finds Sam Camargo open for the 15-yard score. L-R leads 10-0 with 6:58 left in the half.
Look who finally woke up! Nelson Brown breaks a 46-yard run, followed by 8 for Huff and 5 more for Brown. Bears are in the red zone again.
Pioneers pick up a first down, but Max Boyd's first sack of the year forces Tusculum to punt. Bears take over at their own 20, 8:30 to half.
After the FG on the opening drive, Bears have thrown an INT and punted twice. Tusculum takes over at its own 30 with 12 minutes to halftime.
End 1: Bears lead Tusculum 3-0 after 15 minutes. Gotta think they could have had more than the field goal, but a lead is a lead.
Stop me if you've heard this before. Dugger runs the punt 89 yards for a TD, but it's wiped by a penalty. Third time this yr that happened.
Bears D holds firm. Sloan gets his first sack of the season, and Tusculum punts again.
That was Alford's seventh takeaway of the year, and the 15th for the Pioneers. They take over at their own 41.
The offense is still struggling though. Kellar had two guys open deep, but underthrew both of them for an INT. Dee Alford came down w/ ball.
This Bears D is looking good early. Just forced the Pioneers to go three-and-out and punt it back to L-R, who starts this drive at own 31.
Kellar picks up a first down on the next drive, but nothing else doing. Hayden Burgiel's punt pins Tusculum inside its own 15.
Bears D gets another big stop as Tusculum kicker Jose Esparza misses a 41-yard FG. Lenoir-Rhyne still leads 3-0, 7:40 1st.
Lenoir-Rhyne turns the fumble into three points as freshman Chase Allbaugh makes a 37-yard FG, his second this year. 3-0 Bears, 12:46 1st.
Tusculum fumbles on its first play and Sherrod Williams comes up with it for the Bears! What a dream start for L-R!
The Bears won the opening toss and have deferred to the second half. Jefferson Norwood is set to kickoff and get this game underway.
Tonight's captains: QB Jarrod Kellar, DT Paul Sloan, S Marcus Kincaid and S Kyle Dugger. Kincaid, in sweats, is out for the year.
Tusculum is welcoming its new college president in a pregame ceremony. No word about any postgame fireworks, though.

Speaking of impact freshmen for the Bears, my pregame story highlighted Huff and a few others having early success: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/freshmen- impact-all-football-facets-for-lenoir-rhyne-university/article_23643d46-a1de-5283-8b5b-abdb8c08c55f.html …
Coach Mike Kellar has said he wants to get the ball to Huff more. The Maiden grad has just 18 carries but has fielded nine kickoffs as well.
Interesting pregame note: the L-R depth chart lists the starting running back as sophomore Nelson Brown *or* freshman Xzavion Huff.
Obviously ball security will be huge. Lenoir-Rhyne has thrown two interceptions and lost five fumbles already this year.
Tusculum (2-2, 0-1 SAC) forced 5 turnovers last week in 33-10 win at UNC Pembroke. Pioneers lead D2 in TO margin (+10), fumb recoveries (9).

Lenoir-Rhyne (1-3, 0-2 SAC) struggled offensively in a 22-14 loss to Wingate last week. My recap from that game: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/defense-g rows-offense-slows-as-lenoir-rhyne-loses-nd-straight/article_30c5e608-0e62-585e-bfbc-5e5abc8b95a4.html …

I'm on my way to Tennessee for the @LRBearsFootball game so check out my preview for tonight's matchup against Tusculum: https:// twitter.com/hickoryrecord/ status/914175146407194625 …
My recap from a tough @hickory_high loss: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/prep-blit z-somerville-s-tds-lead-freedom-past-hickory/article_ba2d9dee-a589-11e7-b03f-fb4ba59a98e0.html …
Final: Freedom beats @hickory_high 35-30 to snap the Red Tornadoes' three-game winning streak. #prepblitz
Here comes the onside... and Freedom recovers. That should do it.
TD Hickory! Not over yet... Phillips to Staton for 39 yards. Two-point run is short so Hickory trails 35-30, 36 secs left. #prepblitz
Somerville scores his fifth TD tonight, a 12-yard run that puts Freedom ahead 35-24 with just 1:12 remaining. #prepblitz
Phillips is stripped on a keeper and Freedom will take over at the Hickory 32 with 3:24 left.
Freedom takes a 28-24 lead on Somerville's fourth rushing TD, this one from 3 yards. Hickory has 4:44 to find a winner. #prepblitz
FG Hickory! Harrison Boston nails a 35-yarder to put the Red Tornadoes ahead 24-21 with 9:59 to play. #prepblitz
End 3: Hickory and Freedom are still tied at 21. Everything to play for over these final 12 minutes. #prepblitz
TD Hickory! Phillips scrambles up the gut for 10 yards and we're tied again! 21-21, 3:45 left in the third. #prepblitz
Freedom takes a 21-14 lead on Somerville's third TD run, this time from 1 yard out. 7:36 left in the third. #prepblitz
Hickory's kickoff goes into the end zone for a touchback and Freedom will start the third quarter from its own 20.
Hickory's big problem all season has been penalties. Red Tornadoes already flagged 11 times for 94 yards tonight.
Hickory outgained Freedom 219-186 in the half. Both teams lost a fumble, though only Hickory threw an interception.
Halftime: @hickory_high and Freedom are tied at 14. #prepblitz
Hickory sophomore Tristan Rankin was just ejected. Got into a scuffle after making a tackle and it looked like he threw a punch.
TD Hickory! Phillips finds Kevin Shuford on a 27-yard pass to tie the game at 14 with 1:50 to half. #prepblitz
Hickory marched into the red zone, but Phillips underthrew his pass and was picked off at the Freedom 12.
A 79-yard screen pass from Jayden Birchfield to Jax McMahon set up that Freedom touchdown.
Freedom retakes the lead in 3 plays. Somerville scores his second TD tonight on a 7-yard run. 14-7 Patriots, 7:08 2nd. #prepblitz
TD Hickory! The turnover leads to Staton's first rushing score of the year on a 6-yard sweep. 7-7, 8:12 2nd. #prepblitz
Hickory punts on its third drive, but the Freedom returner muffs the catch and Hickory's Deandre Carlton recovers at the Patriots 13!
End 1: the hosts trail Freedom 7-0. Hickory had six penalties for 39 yards in the opening quarter. #prepblitz
Now Staton tries a pass, but he crosses the line of scrimmage before he throws. Hickory winds up punting on its second drive.
Two big Hickory plays wiped by penalties. First a huge pass to Kevin Shuford, then an equally huge reverse to Jaekwon Staton.
Hickory QB Derrien Phillips gains 10 yds on a run, then finds Antonio Parks on a 28-yd catch. Parks is slow to get up after the hit though.
Freedom capitalizes on the turnover with a 6-yard run from Tristan Somerville. Patriots lead 7-0, 7:03 1st. #prepblitz
Red Tornadoes get a delay penalty to start their drive, and Jaelin Byrd loses a fumble a few plays later. Tough start for Hickory.
The anthem has been played, the players are on the field and we are ready to get underway at Frank Barger Stadium. Hickory will receive.
With both of these teams still having to face Watauga and Alexander Central, a win tonight will go a long way toward playing into November.

Looking forward to another great night of high school football coverage to close out September!

Here's my recap and photos from tonight's @LRUVB match: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/lenoir-rh yne-volleyball-swept-by-undefeated-wingate/article_60f68338-a4af-11e7-9002-bfac40cd4b21.html …
Final: Lenoir-Rhyne is swept for just the third time this season, losing to undefeated Wingate 25-20, 25-19, 25-21.
Another Lenoir-Rhyne timeout. The Bears had cut the deficit to 13-12, but three straight Wingate points prompted the timeout.
Lenoir-Rhyne just called its first timeout of the third set, trailing Wingate 11-8.
Ada Thompson is long on her serve to give Wingate the second set, 25-19. Bears need this next set to avoid their third sweep of the season.
Redmond's kill just ended a run of seven straight points for Wingate. The Bears trail 17-11 right now.
No but only cause you're not here!
Senior defensive specialist Ashley Markland just had a kill for the Bears to tie the second set at 10.
Wingate closed on a 15-6 run to win the opening set 25-20. Prall leads the Bears with four kills so far.
Lenoir-Rhyne just called timeout to end a four-point run by the Bulldogs. Bears still lead 14-13.
Freshman outside hitter Taylor Prall just crushed a kill to give Lenoir-Rhyne an early 9-6 lead in the first set.
After a long rally, Wingate takes the opening point and this match is underway.

And my recap from tonight's 2-1 victory for @LRUWSOC over Lees-McRae: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/first-hal f-goals-see-lenoir-rhyne-women-s-soccer-to/article_cba6fcde-a3fc-11e7-8e18-a738ae4838d7.html …
My recap from tonight's 1-1 draw between @LRUMSOC and Lees-McRae: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/lenoir-rh yne-men-s-soccer-earns---draw-after/article_0fb49a02-a3ef-11e7-891b-fb0abfebd90d.html …
Best news of the night indeed. https:// twitter.com/lrumsoc/status /913223289602019329 …
Final: @lruwsoc sees out the final 20 minutes to pick up a 2-1 victory against Lees-McRae.
70' - Lees-McRae pulls one back after Riley Neese breaks through on goal and beats Bears keeper Loren Sterling. L-R still leads 2-1.
Halftime: Lenoir-Rhyne dominates the first half and carries a 2-0 lead into the break.
31' - the Bears score again! This time it's Abbie Brown cleanly finishing a low cross from Christina Shimshock for a 2-0 lead.
10' - goal Bears! Hannah Van Eerden cleans up a shot off the bar with a headed goal, her second of the season.
More than an hour and a half after it was originally scheduled, @lruwsoc match against Lees-McRae is finally underway.
Spoke with coach Jack Winter after the match. He said Morillas had a bad gash on his forehead and was likely concussed, but should be OK.
Final: The Bears draw their first game of the season with a 1-1 double-overtime finish against Lees-McRae.
2OT 6' - Eric Elder has a good look at goal for the Bears, but his shot is wide right.
2OT 2' - Lees-McRae is in on goal, but the shot somehow goes wide. Bears still have life.
End OT 1 - Both teams had chances, but this match is still tied at 1. On to a second OT period.
OT 3' - Bobcats keeper just made a HUGE save of a Marc Fernandez shot. Bears almost scored on a 2v5.
End regulation: Teams are still tied at 1 as we head into an overtime period.
80' - King makes a great save to deny Lees-McRae a goal and the rebound effort goes over the bar.
66' - LR keeper Zach King is down again after colliding with a Bobcats attacker to beat him to the ball. Looks like he can continue though.
59' - LR right back Emil Tansinda sparks a counter attack and manages to score, but he's ruled just offside
Halftime: Lenoir-Rhyne and Lees-McRae are tied at 1.
After about a 15-minute delay, play has resumed. Bears tied at 1 and down a man via red card. Nine minutes left to halftime.
Never a sight anyone wants to see at a sporting event. pic.twitter.com/z1524lTrjo
Sercan Cihan is up and walking, but Ruben Morillas is still down. Trainers have brought out a neck brace and an ambulance just pulled in.
36' - Stop in play after two LR players violently collide while going for the same ball. Heads smacked and the ref immediately stopped play.
34' - Lees-McRae ties the match at 1 after Pol Vassart scores on a counter attack.
32' - LR's Kevin Nadeau sees straight red after a poor tackle on a clear breakaway opportunity. Bears have to see out final hour down a man.
20' - stoppage in play as the LR keeper Zach King is down after taking a free kick. He appeared to slip but he's back in goal now.
3' - goal LR! Ignacio de Goya scored his team-leading fourth of the season on a low cross from Marc Fernandez. Great top-shelf finish.
Lees-McRae also enters on a two-game losing streak, both 3-2 defeats. This non-conference matchup is almost ready to kick off.
Today's DII soccer poll saw the Bears fall from No. 5 to out of the top 25, though they are still receiving votes.
The Bears are looking to snap a two-game losing streak, having been shut out in both matches. But they are 3-0 at home this year.

My recap from a closer-than-expected 22-14 Bears loss: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/lenoir-rh yne-falls-short-in---loss-to-wingate/article_fb2da0de-a0cd-11e7-8a8c-b742719bb44c.html …
Final: Wingate beats @LRBearsFootball 22-14. Bears let too much time bleed off the clock at the end to fall to 1-3, 0-2 SAC.
First down and the Bears get out of bounds to stop the clock. Then a deep shot to the end zone! But Dareke Young drops the diving attempt.
Another interception, another Wingate penalty. This time defensive PI keeps the Bears alive. Ball at Eagles 45, 1:10 to play.
Kellar is picked off on 3rd and 2, but Wingate jumped offside. Bears still have life. Ball at the L-R 40 with 1:38 to play.
Bears start at their own 16 after a holding penalty on the kickoff return.
This next drive feels like it could be significant beyond tonight. Can Bears prove to themselves that they can hang in this conference?
Wingate stays conservative and gets nothing on third down. The 31-yd FG is good, so Bears trail 22-14 with 3:12 to play.
L-R just called its final timeout with 3:56 to play. Wingate has 3rd and 9 from the Bears 14. A field goal here keeps it a one-score game.
Wingate is moving the ball and chewing up clock. Eagles have it at the Bears 26 as the clock goes under 5 minutes.
TD Bears! The call is Nelson Brown up the gut, and he keeps his feet moving until he's in. L-R trails 19-14 with 7:49 to play.
L-R facing third and goal from the 1 and coach Mike Kellar calls a timeout. Crucial to get the right play here.
Bears are inside the red zone. Been aided by three Wingate penalties, two of those personal fouls.
To make matters worse, Bears are flagged for unsportsmanlike conduct after the kickoff. L-R starts from its own 17.
Huge play coming here. Wingate had 3rd and 1 from the 3... and the Eagles punch it in for a TD. A failed conversion makes it 19-7, 11:12 4th
Eagles score on the next play, but that is wiped out on a holding penalty. Bears defense is starting to look tired.
Wingate converts on 4th and 1 to keep its drive alive. Next carry goes for 16 yards down to the L-R 12.
End 3: Wingate still leads 13-7. Defense will be called upon to get another big stop to keep this a one-score game.
Wingate must have watched the L-R tape from last week. Just ran a double reverse that gained 30 yards and moved the Eagles past midfield.
Bears come up short on third down and will punt for the second time this quarter. Wingate takes over from its own 17.
Jackson just trucked a pair of Wingate defenders to end a 16-yard run. That brought out a big cheer from a sleepy home crowd.
Much like last week, Bears have a huge punt return negated by penalty. Went from inside the Wingate 35 to starting at their own 8.
Eagles pick up a first down, but an Amari Houston sack and a holding call have pushed Wingate into a 2nd and 28 at its own 44.
And the call is a draw to Darnell Jackson, who loses 2 yards. After the punt, Wingate takes over at the L-R 49 w/a chance to bust this open.
Bears start at their own 24. Kellar finds Nelson Brown for a big third-down gain, but a hold wipes that away. Third and 16 now.
Another great goal-line stand by the Bears limits Wingate to a 21-yard McCollum FG. Eagles lead 13-7 with 11:36 left in the third.
Wingate gets a 44-yard pass pickup on third and 14 to move into the red zone.
Bears go with a short kickoff to open the third, so Wingate will start the drive at its own 41.
Here are halftime stats. Wingate is 7/10 on third down, but five of those came in opening quarter. pic.twitter.com/r1YNbmvqVw
Halftime: Wingate leads Lenoir-Rhyne 10-7. Bears are hanging in this one so far.
Wingate takes a 10-7 lead on a 16-yard pass from James Whitaker to Malik Bledsoe. Still 1:10 left before halftime.
Touchdown Bears! It's Huff with his first collegiate TD, coming on a 9-yard jet sweep. Man he's fast! Bears lead 7-3, 3:55 left in 2nd.
And the Bears are in the red zone! A huge 56-yard pass from Kellar to T.J. Smith puts L-R at the Wingate 18.
Interception! L-R's Denzal Gilmore comes up with the pick and returns it 17 yards to the Bears 32.
Two L-R drives, two L-R punts. This one at least pins Wingate inside its own 20. Bears offense struggling early though.
Twice a Wingate drive has stalled just yards from the goal. McCollum's second FG is wide right though. Bears still trail 3-0, 12:24 2nd.
Wingate goes for it on 4th and 1 at the Bears 7. L-R D thought they stopped the QB keeper short, but chains come out and give Wingate a 1st.
End 1: Bears trail Eagles 3-0. But Wingate has first and 10 at L-R 16. Eagles were 5/6 on third down in the opening quarter.
So much for taking pressure off the D. The resulting 14-yard punt gives Wingate the ball at the Bears 43.
Here's something new: just witnessed a delay of game on the defense. But the Bears are stuffed on third and 1 and will have to punt.
Hampton's return brings the ball out to the Bears 27. L-R could use some points here to ease pressure on the D.
Wingate drives the length of the field, but gets stopped at the 2. Freddy McCollum's 18-yd FG gives Eagles 3-0 lead with 4:24 left in first.
But Texas IS back!! I've been hearing it every week!
Ahh the classic Poke Choke. Let me be the first to say I'm not surprised. I'm just glad we got this out of the way before Bedlam.
L-R picks up a couple 1sts, but Jarrod Kellar's deep throw from midfield was underthrown. Wingate's Tim Longmire gets the pick at Eagles 16.
Demarius Hampton brings the opening kickoff from the goal line to the Bears 22. Let's see what L-R can do on this first drive.
Wingate wins the toss and has elected to defer to the second half. Kickoff is 90 seconds away on a beautiful Saturday evening.
L-R holds a 19-12 edge against Wingate all-time. But the Eagles have won two straight in this matchup, including a 49-6 beatdown last year.
A strong start will be crucial for the Bears, who have allowed 10.3 points per first quarter in three games this season.
Wingate (3-0, 1-0 SAC) beat Carson-Newman 31-27 last week and is receiving votes in latest DII Top 25 poll. Eagles average 33.3 ppg.

My recap from a big Hickory win on the road: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/prep-blit z-hickory-spoils-mcdowell-s-homecoming-with-road-win/article_27e290bc-a010-11e7-95de-6bd0355ea485.html …
Final: @hickory_high beats McDowell 36-13! Red Tornadoes move to 3-2, 1-0 in Northwestern 3A/4A play. #prepblitz
Boston misses a field goal from 30 yards, so Hickory still leads 36-13 with 7:45 left to play.
End 3: Red Tornadoes are rolling up 36-13. Hickory is 12 minutes away from ruining McDowell's homecoming. #prepblitz
TD Hickory and it's deja vu! Phillips to Staton on a 25-yard deep ball for a 36-13 Red Tornado lead! #prepblitz
Deandre Carlton picks off the McDowell QB! And a personal foul after the play gives Hickory the ball at the Titans 25.
TD Hickory! It's Phillips to Staton again, this time for 39 yards on a deep route. Red Tornadoes lead 29-13, 7:47 3rd. #prepblitz
AJ Chisholm has been having himself one hell of a game. Also has two sacks to go with blocked punt.
Red Tornadoes lead 22-13 after the big special teams play. 8:22 left here in the third. #prepblitz
Hickory defense holds Titans to a three and out. And AJ Chisholm blocks the punt!! The ball rolls out of the end zone for a safety!
The Red Tornadoes are forced to punt, and Boston pins McDowell inside its own 10.
Hickory will start from its own 24 to begin the third quarter.
What kind of concession stand runs out of popcorn before the end of halftime...?
Hickory only ran the ball 12 times, but averaged 10.9 yards per carry (131 yards). Byrd 6-55, Phillips 4-76, both with a rushing TD.
McDowell ran 39 plays for 203 yards; Hickory just 21 for 183. Red Tornadoes had 75 penalty yards that half.
Halftime: Hickory leads 20-13 after McDowell makes a 39-yard FG at the buzzer. Hickory receives to start second half. #prepblitz
Kevin Shuford returns the kick to the Titans 43, but three incompletions mean Hickory punts it away. Titans backed up to their own 4.
McDowell responds with an 80-yard drive capped by a 32-yard passing TD on 3rd and 21. Hickory leads 20-10, 1:29 to the half. #prepblitz
TD Hickory again! Jaelin Byrd takes the option pitch and skirts the left side for a 22-yard score! Hickory leads 20-3, 6:24 2nd. #prepblitz
TD Hickory! Phillips does it with his arm this time, on a 32-yard bomb to Staton on 3rd & 24! Hickory leads 14-3, 9:41 2nd. #prepblitz
End 1: Hickory leads McDowell 7-3 after the opening period thanks to the legs of Phillips. #prepblitz
Hickory takes the lead! Phillips picks up where he left off last week, scores option keeper from 18 yards. Hickory 7-3, 0:44 1st. #prepblitz
McDowell takes advantage of the short field with a 24-yard field goal. Titans lead 3-0, 2:20 left in the opening quarter. #prepblitz
Red Tornadoes wind up punting from their own 7 on their first drive. McDowell takes over at the Hickory 42.
Hickory runs a sweep with Jaekwon Staton, who stops to throw to an open man downfield! But a flag negates the big gain.
McDowell picks up three first downs on its opening drive, but the offense stalls at midfield and punts. Hickory will start from its own 12.
Harrison Boston kicks off for Hickory and we are underway! Titans start from their own 20.
Hickory, McDowell met for 18 straight years, but the two haven't faced each other since 1992. Conf. realignment brings them together again.
For the Hickory fans who didn't make the drive, listen along on 102.3 FM or http:// whky.com . I'll try not to yell in Jason's mic. https:// twitter.com/WHKYSavage/sta tus/911346380924379137 …
Oh gum is a necessity. I go through a pack or two a week.
The only thing normal about my sleep schedule is the lack of normalcy. Coincidentally, I've learned to enjoy coffee more.

My recap from tonight's @nchs_soccer1 win: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/newton-co nover-soccer-continues-unbeaten-season-with-lincolnton-win/article_554ef4ea-9f3f-11e7-98c9-7f98d02a4471.html …
Final: @nchs_soccer1 wins 3-2! The Red Devils keep their unbeaten run (11-0-1) alive with Fong's winner.
72' - The Lincolnton keeper makes a pair of good saves - the second with his feet - to keep the Wolves down by just one.
60' - action has been back and forth past 10 minutes, but lacking in final third. Red Devils have 20 minutes to see out a victory.
50' - another @nchs_soccer1 goal! Noel Fong scores on a beautiful diving header from about 13 yards. Red Devils lead 3-2!
44' - @nchssoccer_1 answers right back! Jason Mejia laced a deflection into the back of the net to tie this match at 2. Lively stuff so far.
43' - goal Lincolnton! It's Sedano again, who turns from 20 yards out and sneaks a shot underneath the diving keeper.
Red Devils with a good look on a corner, but no one can latch on to the in-swinger and that'll end the first 40 with the teams tied at 1.
Stoppage in play with 2 minutes to half. Lincolnton player has been down for a few minutes, though he's walking off under his own power now.
35' - goal @nchs_soccer1 ! Jason Agreda cleaned up a loose ball with a powerful shot that deflected past the keeper. Big goal for Red Devils.
28' - Referee just sprinted a good 40 yards to show a yellow card to a Lincolnton coach. Something must have been said, but I didn't hear.
13' - goal Lincolnton! Brian Sedano found himself in the right spot to clean up a Jon Joplin save. Red Devils trail here early.

ICYMI, my longer dive into @hickory_high 's dominant performance Friday from its defense and quarterback: #prepblitz http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/prep-blit z-review-stout-defense-phillips-touchdowns-lead-hickory-over/article_9826d142-3c7a-58d6-97b6-9a2841994773.html …
Look at you killin it!
Here's my recap with quotes from coach Mike Kellar: http:// bit.ly/2fsq99t
Final: Mars Hill 43, Lenoir-Rhyne 28. Lions offense proved too much for the Bears to stop in the second half. LR falls to 1-2 this year.
Kellar's pass is tipped at the line and the Bears turn the ball over on downs. LR is 2:27 away from losing conference opener.
Well here we go. 4th and 6 at the MH 15 and the Bears are going for it...
Bears get the ball back after a Mars Hill punt. They start at their own 16 with 5:47 left, trailing by 15.
And LR goes three and out on the next drive. Gonna take something miraculous for the Bears at this point.
After a failed onside kick, Bears give up another TD. Prescott goes 17 yards to put Lions back up by 15. MH leads 43-28, 9:55 in the 4th.
TD Bears! Kellar to Camargo for 2nd time today, this one for 7 yards. Demarius Hampton drops the 2-pt play, so Bears trail 37-28, 12:33 4th.
Bears are driving to start the 4th. A pair of first downs followed by a defensive PI has LR in Lions territory.
End 3: Mars Hill 37, Lenoir-Rhyne 22. Two big trick plays busted the game open for the Lions at the end of the quarter.
Lions run the reverse to Taylor again, but this time he throws to a wide open Rucker for a 44-yard score. Missed XP makes it 37-22 MH.
Jackson fumbles the ball at the LR 44 and the Bears recover. Complete opposite of what LR needed.
Bears will start this drive from their own 30. Really need to get some points on this one before the game slips away.
One play, 12 seconds, seven points. Keshaun Taylor takes a reverse 48 yards to the house. Mars Hill leads 31-22 with 1:38 left in the third.
Another penalty, this one a hold, kills the Bears drive. 12-yard punt gives the Lions the ball just past midfield.
Mars Hill punts on its next drive. Bears offense will start from its own 19 with a chance to take back the lead.
This one counts though! Kellar to Sam Camargo for a 13-yard score. 2-point try is incomplete, so Bears trail 24-22 with 5:37 left in third.
Bears find the end zone on a 4-yard carry from Darnell Jackson, but it's erased on a holding penalty. Flags are killing LR today.
Salmon and Rucker connect on another huge TD pass. This one goes for 67 yards. Lions lead 24-16, 9:33 left in the third.
Bears pick up a first but nothing else doing. Both teams open up the third quarter with punts.
The ensuing punt lands in the end zone, so the Bears will start from their own 20.
Mars Hill burns its first timeout. Punt team ran out on fourth down, except the punter didn't get the memo.
Lions go 3 and out and punt. Deja vu, Kyle Dugger runs it to the house (76 yards) but roughing the kicker erases that. Second time today.
Mars Hill will start the third quarter with the ball at its own 35.
Halftime: Lions 17, Bears 16. Mars Hill retakes the lead with a 21-yard FG from Stewart right before the half.
Quentin Hayes was just ejected on a targeting call. It'll be reviewed at halftime, but I think that will stand. He was slow to get up also.
Mars Hill just called its final timeout with 29.7 seconds left. Lions have 1st and 10 at the LR 20.
Salmon fires incomplete three times and Mars Hill will punt it back to LR... well roughing the punter gives the Lions a first down instead.
Burgiel flips the field well. Lions take over from their own 29.
Well a holding penalty kills this drive before it can get going. Bears will punt from their own 32. Defense has to hold over final 2:12.
LR defense comes up big again and forces a punt. Offense takes the field at its own 34 looking to stretch its lead before halftime.
Bears back on top! Kellar hits Brown on a screen to beat the blitz, and the sophomore RB dives for the end zone! LR up 16-14, 5:35 to half.
Bears start at their own 30, and Nelson Brown carries for 27 yards on the first play to move past midfield.
Mars Hill responds in kind. A 70-yard pass from Salmon to Craig Rucker puts the Lions back on top 14-9 with 7:33 to half.
Touchdown Bears! Kellar has been tryin the deep ball all half, and this one is on the money to T.J. Smith for 35 yards! 9-7 Bears, 8:33 2nd.
A pair of big third-down pickups through the air has the Bears at the Mars Hill 35. Break in play for an injured Lion.
So L-R will start this drive from its own 9 still trailing 7-2. 11 minutes to halftime.
The Bears D holds and forces a punt. Kyle Dugger takes it back 78 yards to the end zone, but a few different blocks in the back erase that.
Walker Harrison comes in for the 33-yd FG attempt after Chase Allbaugh missed the 52-yarder. But the kick is blocked by Mars Hill.
The ensuing 52-yard FG is short... but roughing the kicker gives the Bears new life! 1st and 10 at the 20 now.
LR touchdown! Wait... a very late flag - offensive PI - erases that score. Then Kellar earns another 15-yard penalty for arguing.
Bears will go for it on 4th and 3... but Mars Hill calls timeout to think about it. Huge play coming up for Lenoir-Rhyne.
End 1st: Mars Hill leads 7-2. Bears are knocking on the door though. They'll start the quarter with a 3rd and 3 from the MH 5.
Bears start at their own 46, but a defensive hold on the first play moves the ball past midfield.
Safety Bears! Freshman linebacker Quentin Hayes hits the Lions RB right at the line and Lenoir-Rhyne is on the board!
At least freshman punter Hayden Burgiel has done his job. Mars Hill will start second drive at its own 5.
LR gonna punt again. Picked up a 1st on a Lions PI, but Kellar got sacked near midfield. Bradley Jones was slow to get up on 3rd down run.
That was a 9-play, 90-yard drive aided by an LR face mask penalty. Bears will start their 2nd drive from their own 30.
Lions strike first. QB David Salmon finds TE Kedar Bryant on a 18-yard screen for a 7-0 lead. 7:35 left in the opening quarter.
Add Kincaid to the list of injuries that includes Cliff Barrett and Paul Sloan. All three are seniors.
Defense is without second-leading tackler Marcus Kincaid today. Mike Kellar told me Wed. he needed an MRI, prognosis didn't look good.
Bears pick up another first down, but the drive stalls at the Lions 39 and the punt team comes on the field. Fair catch at the MH 10.
Kellar hits T.J. Smith on a short drag that goes for 12 yards and the first down! Ball up to midfield.
Jarrod Kellar takes a deep shot on the first play from scrimmage and it's inches out of the reach of Saaehim Brooks!
Xzavion Huff returns the opening kick to the Bears 30, and the offense takes the field.
L-R is going to receive to start the game. Time to see if this is the Bears team of last week or two weeks ago.
Made it to Meares Stadium, where @LRBearsFootball and @mhulions are set to begin @SAC_Athletics play. Kickoff is a half hour away. pic.twitter.com/86KT3GZk80

Final: Hickory 33, Bandys 10. @hickory_high moves to 2-2 on the year with the big road win! #prepblitz
Bandys finds the end zone with 22 seconds left. Jacob Ellis hits JaTay Culliver on a 33-yard pass to make it 33-10 Hickory. #prepblitz
Hickory's Quintavious Saddler scores from 2 yards out to put the Red Tornadoes up 33-3 with 3:18 to play. #prepblitz
End 3: Hickory 26, Bandys 3. Phillips has been the difference as Red Tornadoes are 12 minutes away from 2nd win. #prepblitz
TD Hickory! Deja vu, it's Phillips again! His 23-yard run - 4th TD run of the game - makes it 26-3 Hickory, 3:02 3rd. #prepblitz
Bandys goes three and out, but a block in the back will start Hickory at its own 22.
TD Hickory! It's Phillips with his third rushing TD of the game. Bad snap leads to missed XP, so Hickory leads 19-3, 5:24 3rd. #prepblitz
Trojans try a fake punt, but Hickory is having none of it. Red Tornadoes take over at the Bandys 42.
Bandys receives the opening kickoff of the second and will start from its own 23.
Halftime: Hickory leads Bandys 13-3. Two Phillips TDs and a Joseph FG provide the first-half points. #prepblitz
A great return and big pass pick up moves Hickory into Trojan territory, but Phillips throws a pick at the BHS 3. Coby Morgan with the INT.
Trojans are on the board! An 8-minute drive ends with a 35-yard Ben Joseph field goal. Hickory leads 13-3, 1:31 2nd. #prepblitz
Hickory pinned Bandys deep in their own territory, but 12 straight runs have Trojans in the red zone. Ethan Howard has 4 firsts on drive.
Bandys tries the double reverse pass, but it's batted incomplete at the goal line for a turnover on downs.
End 1st: Hickory leads 13-0 after two Phillips TDs. Bandys facing 4th and 24 from Hickory 33 out of the break. #prepblitz
Phillips with a 17-yd run up the gut for his second TD of the quarter! Bad snap on the PAT, so Red Tornadoes lead 13-0, 5:09 1st. #prepblitz
Bandys gets a first down on its opening drive, but no more. Trojans will punt it away.
Derrien Phillips with a 47-yard rushing TD just two plays in! He broke a tackle and took off. 7-0 Hickory, 11:28 1st. #prepblitz
Anthem played, teams are on their sidelines... let's play some football!
Hickory wins the toss and has elected to receive. Red Tornadoes looking to make a statement from the start.
Tonight wraps up non-conference play for teams in the region, so a win tonight will be crucial to carry momentum into conference play.
Bandys, meanwhile, picked up a 33-7 victory last week against winless Bunker Hill. Trojans are 2-1, but lone loss came at home to Foard.

Numerous unforced errors for Surry has put the Red Hawks ahead 14-3 in what is looking like the deciding game.
A big block from Leslie Leonard gives CVCC a 6-1 advantage in the third.
Game No. 2 goes to CVCC 25-14. Red Hawks one game away from a clean sweep.
Surry started to build some momentum, but CVCC stretched its lead back to 20-11. Timeout Knights.
A monstrous kill from Karsyn Mundy puts CVCC ahead 14-5 in the second.
Surry gets its first point from an Emilee Webber service error, but not before CVCC took the first eight in the second game.
Red Hawks take the first five points in the second game, which prompts a Surry timeout.
CVCC takes the first game 25-22! Emily Williams' serve prevented Surry from setting up a play, and the ball came back over for an easy kill.
Surry has pulled to within 21-20 and now CVCC will call a timeout.
This game was back and forth until CVCC went on a 5-point run to force a Surry timeout. Red Hawks lead 18-13 in the first.
Red Hawks lost five of the first six points in the opening game, but have fought back to tie it at 7-all after a Mikayla Creswell kill.

How did Hickory turn around a 19-0 deficit Friday against Huss? It began with a quick-strike offense. #prepblitz http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/friday-ni ght-review-hickory-offense-speeds-up-holds-on-for/article_5cee6e38-ed16-5c0a-9ca4-eeda1e6e35b7.html …
Here's my recap from tonight's game: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/lenoir-rh yne-dominates-crusaders-for-first-win/article_b1f43986-95d4-11e7-bcb6-dbac129aed01.html …
Final: Lenoir-Rhyne 22, North Greenville 10. Bears avenge last year's 45-0 drubbing with a dominant performance for first win of the year!
Bears force a turnover on downs thanks to a pair of sacks, and take over at the Greenville 36 with 2:25 to play. Victory is imminent.
A nine-minute, 18-play drive results in a 39-yard field goal for Chase Allbaugh, who pushes the Bears lead to 22-10 with 4:15 to play.
End 3rd: Lenoir-Rhyne holding onto a 19-10 lead. Bears are 15 minutes away from first win of the season.
Matt Gravely nails a 52-yard FG (with room to spare, I might add) to cut Greenville's deficit to 19-10 with 2:12 left in the 3rd.
After an intentional grounding call that produced a 2nd and 30, the Bears wind up punting again. Greenville starts from its own 10.
Bears go for it on 4th and 1 from the Greenville 43. Brown picks up about a yard, and here comes the chain gain... first down!
Crusaders will also punt on their opening possession of the half. LR will start from just shy of midfield.
Greenville finds a receiver open behind the LR defense for a 70-yard TD, but a hold in the backfield erases that score.
Kellar takes a 10-yard sack on third down and the Bears will punt for real this time.
First drive of the second half results in a punt for LR... until Greenville jumps offside. Bears offense comes back onto the field.
Here are the halftime stats. Big edge for the Bears on the ground. Going 6-of-9 on third down never hurts either. pic.twitter.com/hJqnPDu2FS
Halftime: Lenoir-Rhyne 19, North Greenville 7. Bears were the more dominant team in that half, and the fans are showing their appreciation.
Lenoir-Rhyne punts and it's downed at the 1! Crusaders have 24 seconds to halftime.
Greenville's Ken Drummond picked up both PFs, so he was ejected.
Getting chippy real quick here. LR had two personal fouls after the INT return. Now two on Greenville and one on LR.
Bears will start from their own 41 with 1:34 before halftime and no timeouts.
Interception!! Greenville QB Donny Baker throws it right into the hands of Trevon Tapp!
Crusaders just converted a 3rd and 21 from its own 9 to keep a drive alive. They are at midfield with 2 minutes until halftime.
That was a 15-play drive that started from the shadow of the Bears end zone. LR is rolling right now.
Touchdown Bears! Brown powers through two Crusaders at the line for the 5-yard score! It's now 19-7 LR, 4:05 to halftime.
Greenville forces a stop on 3rd and 7 at its own 9, but a roughing the passer penalty will extend the Bears drive.
And now Bradley Jones slips through some defenders for a 33-yard gain on 3rd and 14. Bears are into Greenville territory.
Freshman RB Zxavion Huff is something special, man. Broke a tackle in the backfield and ripped off a 19-yard run to get the Bears a 1st.
LR forces a punt, but its downed at its own 2. Let's see what the Bears can do on this drive.
End 1st: Lenoir-Rhyne 12, North Greenville 7. Bears offense looked much improved from last week in that opening quarter.
Kyle Dugger just misses an INT! He jumped the route perfectly and couldn't hold on. Would have been a sure pick-six.
LR takes back the lead three plays later! Kellar finds Jaquay Mitchell on a 5-yard slant, and the Bears are up 12-7 after a failed 2-pt.
Nelson Brown gets 2 yards to convert, 1st and goal Bears!
4th and 1 at the NG 9 and the Bears are going for it... and LR burns a timeout before a delay of game penalty. That's the second TO already.
Crusaders respond with a 10-play drive, taking a 7-6 lead after Ashton Heard punches it in from 4 yards. 8:41 left in the opening quarter.
And LR has its first lead of the season! Kellar passes to freshman DT Jordan Mann (not a typo) for a 4-yard TD! XP missed, 6-0, 13:00 1st.
North Greenville fumbles the kickoff but recovers. Not as lucky on the first play, as Sherrod Williams comes up with the ball for the Bears!
L-R runs into the field and we're ready to get started! North Greenville will receive the opening kick. pic.twitter.com/au5EWfIJjy
Another senior, DT Paul Sloan, has his left arm in a sling and is in his jersey top and gym shorts. Another big loss for the Bears tonight.
Senior cornerback Cliff Barrett will miss the rest of the season, however, due to a lower-leg injury in that same game.
Bears QB Jarrod Kellar is expected to start tonight after being concussed in the first half against West Alabama.

Still plenty of mistakes to clean up, but really feels like kids are buying into Stone and the staff. Could be a program-changing win. (5/5)
Thought the Huss 66-yarder would have been it. Same momentum swing to N-C KO return Monday. But there was more fight in them tonight. (4/x)
But the kids kept fighting, didn't let mistakes get them down. Rattled off 20 straight points to take a lead. (3/x)
The response from Hickory in the 2nd half was incredible. After past few years and down 19-0 tonight, would have been easy to quit. (2/x)
Some postgame thoughts as I make my way back to the office: (1/x)
Fantastic win for the Red Tornadoes. Really felt like it was coming, and the players responded extremely well in the second half. #prepblitz
BALLGAME HICKORY WINS 28-27!! #prepblitz
There are 45 seconds left and Huss still has two timeouts, so Hickory will need to pick up a first down.
INTERCEPTION! Jump ball is thrown to the end zone and Hickory's Elijah Milsaps comes up with it!
Under a minute to play and Huss is in the red zone...
Hickory retakes the lead again! Phillips to Staton for 15 yards, and then Phillips runs in a fake XP! 28-27 Hickory, 3:46 4th. #prepblitz
And on the first play, Huss responds with a 66-yard run to retake the lead. Two-pointer is good, so it's 27-20 with 5:47 left. #prepblitz
The two-point conversion fails, so Hickory leads 20-19 with 6:12 remaining in the 4th. Visiting fans are pumped. #prepblitz
Hickory takes the lead!! On 4th and 2 at the 12, Phillips hits a quick strike to Jaekwon Staton, who pulls two defenders into the end zone!
End of the 3rd: Hickory trails 19-14, but has all the momentum heading into the final 12 minutes. #prepblitz
Hickory strikes again, we have a game! Phillips to Parks on a screen, he breaks for 28 yards and a score! 19-14 Huss, 1:32 3rd. #prepblitz
Hickory is on the board! Red Tornadoes needed 37 seconds, Quintavious Saddler punches in from a yard out. 19-6 Huss, 4:38 3rd. #prepblitz
Huss makes it 19-0 on a 16-yard run from Jahaad Wilson. 5:55 left in the third. #prepblitz
Red Tornadoes force a punt on the opening drive, but then have to punt themselves.
Huss will receive to start the second half. Hickory needs a few quick stops to stay in this game.
Red Tornadoes abandoned the run in the 2nd. Phillips attempted 16 passes, completing just five of them. He's 11/25 for 126 yards so far.
Hickory drove the length of the field, but a 25-yd FG was blocked as time expired. 13-0 Huss at the half. #prepblitz
Derrien Phillips just threw an INT that was returned 70 yards for a TD. Huss now leads 13-0 with 1:00 to play before the half. #prepblitz
Getting caught up on stats, but Huss leads 6-0 w/ 7:54 before half. Hickory has missed a FG and has a T.O.D. in the red zone. #prepblitz
Hickory won the toss and chose to receive. We're about to get underway here at Hickory Huss. #prepblitz

Final: Newton-Conover (2-0) 45, Hickory (0-2) 26. Red Devils are 4-0 in this rivalry since Matt Beam took over. #prepblitz
Hickory adds another scoring drive, capped by a 1-yd run from Phillips. N-C leads 45-26 with 1:26 to play. #prepblitz
Hickory answers back with a 9-yd pass from Phillips to AJ Chisholm, but Red Tornadoes trail 45-20 with 8:10 to play. #prepblitz
Phillips loses another fumble, this one at his own 5, and Jordan Thompson scoops and scores for N-C. It's 45-13 now, 8:50 4th. #prepblitz
End of the third: the teams traded fumbles, but Newton-Conover still leads 38-13. And it has the ball at the HHS 18. #prepblitz
Red Devils stretch their lead to 38-13 on a 23-yd Stinson run. 6:37 left to play in the 3rd. #prepblitz
Now N-C loses a fumble, and Jacob Surbaugh recovers for Hickory at their own 21.
And on the first play of the next drive, Phillips fumbles and Squarles recovers for N-C. That could be the dagger in this one.
N-C adds to its lead with a 25-yd run from Tylor Stinson. Red Devils now lead 30-13 with 9:54 left in the third. #prepblitz
Hickory narrowly avoids losing a fumble on a bad option pitch, and the Red Tornadoes will punt to start the second half.
Take away the kickoff return TD and add a FG instead of Phillips' 4th down red zone INT and the Red Tornadoes could have led 16-15.
We had 39 combined points in a breathless second quarter after a scoreless opening period. Hickory may rue not having a halftime lead.
Correction: This pass went to Jaheim Mullen, not Wells.
Halftime: Myles Baker takes the kickoff 90 yards untouched to give N-C a 22-13 lead. Huge momentum swing heading to the lockers. #prepblitz
Phillips redeems himself, goes 4-4 on next drive and runs in from 2 yards with 8 seconds in the half. 15-13 N-C just before half. #prepblitz
Phillips throws a 4th down INT in the red zone, and N-C converts with a 53-yd TD pass from Baker to Tony Wells. 15-6, 1:39 2nd. #prepblitz
Hickory answers with its own TD! Derrien Phillips to Antonio Parks for a 15-yd pass. 8-6 N-C after failed 2pt conv, 9:29 2nd. #prepblitz
TD Red Devils! Shamar Baker finds Ernie Squarles on 4th & goal from the 18 for the first points of the game. 8-0 N-C, 11:55 2nd. #prepblitz
End of the first and we're scoreless here. Hickory ran just four plays in the quarter. #prepblitz
Hickory can only pick up 5 yards on its opening drive and will punt it away. N-C starting from the Hickory 43 after a hold on the return.
Red Devils drive the length of the field, but can't convert on 4th and goal from the 5 and turn it over on downs.
Newton-Conover will receive the opening kick. Teams are running onto field now, and we're ready to get some Monday night football underway.
