Huge win for the Bears! They knocked off No. 21 Limestone with a late OT goal to win their season opener. https:// twitter.com/bearssports/st atus/903467822264631296 …
My recap from tonight's game: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/townnews/sport /lenoir-rhyne-drops-season-opener-to-west-alabama/article_48c8f5e0-8ebe-11e7-b3c9-9bafd7387797.html …
The Bears totaled 184 yards of offense and turned the ball over 5 times, while the defense allowed the Tigers to rack up 481 yards tonight.
Final: West Alabama 46, Lenoir-Rhyne 7. Not the start to the season the Bears were looking for.
West Alabama capitalizes on the turnover. Robert Myers runs in from a yard out for a 46-7 lead with 3:08 to play.
And then Lenoir-Rhyne loses a fumble on the kickoff. Tigers recover at the LR 36.
The Tigers follow with a 15-play drive that results in a Douglas 33-yard field goal, stretching their lead to 39-7 with 6:54 to play.
Bears march inside the Tigers 10, but an incompletion on 4th and goal leads to another turnover on downs. That was 13 plays, no points.
End of the third: Lenoir-Rhyne trails 36-7. Bears have a 3rd and 7 from the WA 25 to start the 4th.
West Alabama fumbles on the next play! Landon Scott falls on the loose ball and the Bears suddenly have some momentum!
Touchdown Bears! Willingham finds Sam Camargo open in the corner for an 11-yard score. Tigers still lead 36-7, 2:17 3rd.
First break for the Bears: Ivan Milliken blocks a punt and Riley McGee scoops it up to the Tigers 10!
The Bears again move the ball inside Tigers territory and again fail to convert a 4th-down attempt.
West Alabama makes it 36-0 with a 29-yard field goal from Douglas. 8:56 to play in the third.
They go for it on 4th and 12 from the WA 33, but the pass falls incomplete and the Bears turn it over on downs.
Bears start the second half with the ball. Backup QB Grayson Willingham is getting the nod to begin the 3rd.
West Alabama, meanwhile, gained 268 yards and was a perfect 6-6 in red zone scoring. Satterwhite was 14-21 for 127 yards and a TD passing.
LR gained just 76 yards and turned the ball over 3 times in the half. Nelson Brown led the Bears with 58 rushing yards.
Halftime: West Alabama leads 33-0 after Douglas splits the uprights on a 21-yard field goal to end the half.
Bears follow that up with a three-and-out. Still 1:14 left in the half.
From bad to worse: Rashaad Lee runs in from 1 yard to give the Tigers a 30-0 after a blocked PAT. 2:59 left in the half.
West Alabama scores again, this time on a 13-play drive as Harry Satterwhite scramble in from 3 yards. 24-0 Tigers, 9:15 2nd.
End of the first quarter: Lenoir-Rhyne trails 17-0. Three turnovers proved costly for the Bears.
Another Bears fumble, this time on a handoff exchange, leads to a short field and seven more points for West Alabama. 17-0, 0:13 1st.
After Kellar throws a pick on the next drive, West Alabama finds the end zone in two plays. 10-0 Tigers, 5:01 1st.
West Alabama takes the first lead of the game on a 33-yard field goal from Colin Douglas. 3-0 Tigers, 6:45 1st.
Nelson Brown loses a fumble just past midfield on the Bears' first possession of the year.
West Alabama starts at its own 21 and gets a first down, but has to punt after Bears LB Anthony Brown gets a third-down sack.
Fans are still streaming in on this overcast night. Chance of rain the rest of the evening, but holding off for now. Let's play football!
The Bears won the toss and have deferred to the second half. West Alabama will receive the kickoff to start.
LRU team captains Kyle Dugger, Marcus Kincaid, Jarrod Kellar and Paul Sloan have made their way to midfield for the coin toss.
Tigers have 6 former players in the NFL, including Super Bowl champ Malcolm Butler and KC's Tyreek Hill (who played at my alma mater!).

Bandys calls its final timeout with 55 seconds left. Foard has 1st and goal from the 5.
Howard fumbles on the first play of the Bandys drive and Tate Beaver recovers for Foard at the Bandys 31. 1:57 left in the game.
Colosimo airs it out on the first play and finds Siemer wide open! 71-yard TD to take the lead! 2:09 left, 23-17 Tigers. #prepblitz
Bandys has to punt. Now Foard starts from its 29, 2:20 left. Shaping up to be a hell of a finish.
Siemer drops back to pass but the defense reads it perfectly and Jacob Ellis comes up with the pick. 17-16 Bandys, 3:28 4th, ball at own 24.
Foard converts on a 4th and 7 to keep the drive alive. Ball at the Bandys 31 with 4:30 to play.
Bandys retakes the lead! Culliver finds DaShawn Gibbs on a 71-yard go route. 17-16 Trojans, 7:39 4th. #prepblitz
Culliver breaks a 51-yard TD run!...but holding will erase that. Second time tonight Bandys has a TD called back.
Trojans will get it back at their own 27 after Foard goes three and out. Under 10 minutes left to play.
Pinned deep and trying to punt, the Bandys snap goes over punter and out of the end zone for a safety. 16-10 Foard, 11:34 4th. #prepblitz
End of the 3rd: Foard leads Bandys 14-10. #prepblitz
Foard can't take advantage, though, and will have to punt. Bandys starting from its own 13.
And now the Tigers recover the kickoff! Looked to be a pooch kick that Bandys didn't get to. Gavin Shoemaker comes up with it at the BHS 40.
Tigers lead 14-10 after that flurry. Under four minutes left in the third. #prepblitz
Bandys fumbles at its own 41, and Foard's Tate Beaver returns it to the 5. Corey Siemer runs it in the next play to put Foard in front.
Foard drives inside the 20 but turns it over on downs to open the 3rd. That was a 6-minute drive.
Bandys outgained Foard 97-80 in the opening half. Both teams lost a fumble as well.
Bandys had 3rd and goal, but Howard fumbled inside the 5 and Foard recovered. Halftime: Bandys leads 10-7. #prepblitz
Facing 4th and 5 from its own 35, Foard tries a fake punt but the pass is incomplete. Bandys takes over with about 4 minutes to halftime.
Bandys can only manage a 16-yard field goal, but take a 10-7 lead. 6:12 left before halftime. #prepblitz
A low snap on a punt leads to another special teams fumble for Foard. Bandys takes over inside the Foard 10.
Bandys ties the game on a 3-yard run from Howard, who took a pitch and carried a Foard defender into the end zone. 7-7, 9:31 2nd. #prepblitz
Bandys is forced to punt at the end of the 1st, but the catch is muffed and the Trojans take over at Foard 15. Still 7-0 Foard. #prepblitz
Touchdown Tigers! Tate Beaver powers through a pair of would-be tacklers to score from 6 yards out. 7-0 Foard, 2:16 1st. #prepblitz
And the Tigers will be working with a short field, as the Bandys punt went out of bounds at the 34. Under 4 minutes to play in the 1st.
Foard defense comes up big on this drive, stopping Bandys QB JaTay Culliver in the backfield on third down.
Foard gets just past midfield, but has a false start on 4th and 2 and will punt.
Bandys' Ethan Howard broke a 53-yard run on the first play, but a TD was erased from a hold and Bandys turned it over on 4th and goal.
Bandys receives the opening kickoff and will start from its own 38.
Speaking of stripes, here's my story from today's paper about the Tigers earning those stripes: https://t.co/6pXmQr1THk?amp=1
The teams have taken the field, Bandys in black with gold helmets, Foard in white with their blue and white stripes.
The 34-18 win last year was the first at Foard for @CoachMinor , now in his second season leading the Tigers.
The Trojans hold a 9-4 series advantage since 2004, but the Tigers have won the past two meetings.
Meanwhile, Bandys caught a Hail Mary at the end of regulation against St. Stephens to tie the game, and wound up winning 42-40 in double OT.
Foard is coming off a 37-14 loss to Maiden last week. QB Jack Colosimo ran for a team-high 82 yards and a TD in that game.
Tonight I'm at Randy Lowman Stadium as the visiting @FoardTigersFB (0-1) take on the Bandys Trojans (1-0). #prepblitz pic.twitter.com/fPpKltjS6P

Here's my recap from tonight's match: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/with-tire d-legs-foard-draws-third-match-of-season-remains/article_7e680ec0-87a2-11e7-b827-37ed363094c9.html …
Final: @FTFMensSoccer 1, West Lincoln 1. Tigers couldn't crack the Rebels defense in the second half and have to settle for a draw.
Under seven minutes left in this match. Foard is pressing forward but can't find the right pass to get that last goal.
West Lincoln's Logan Garcia ties the match with a low drive past the Foard keeper from the top of the box. 17 minutes left to find a winner.
Tigers continue to pour the pressure on, but can't find a second goal yet. West Lincoln keeper has gotten a workout so far this half.
Much livelier start to the second half for Foard. Tigers have forced two good saves in first five minutes.
Halftime: Foard 1, West Lincoln 0. Matt Knisley curled in a beauty from 25 yards into the top left corner just before the halftime whistle.
First shot on goal goes to West Lincoln on a 30-yard free kick in the 20th, but Foard GK Christian Del Pilar dives to smother the ball.
Now West Lincoln has a corner. The cross is eventually played out for another corner, and Foard clears the danger the second time.
12 minutes in and we have our first corner of the match. Foard plays a short corner but can't get a cross into the box.
Coach Scottie Goforth will look to keep the unbeaten streak going for the Tigers, who have scored five goals from five players this year.

Here's all of our coverage tonight in one place, along with scores from other teams in the region. http://www. hickoryrecord.com/news/prep-blit z-week-roundup-of-hickory-area-football-games/article_20d1aa90-84a6-11e7-a6f4-4b9b838936e9.html …
Here's my recap from a heartbreaking loss in the Red Tornadoes' season opener. https:// twitter.com/Hickoryrecord/ status/898790761789083648 …
Final: Statesville 27, Hickory 26. Seems like the only good kick of the game wins it for the Greyhounds. #prepblitz
Statesville scores on the first play. It's a screen from Young to Davis, who scoots in easily. PAT for the win coming up...
PAT is blocked though. Hickory leads 26-20. Can the defense come up with four stops here? #prepblitz
Hickory will start with the ball. Byrd is stopped for no gain, and then Phillips scrambles in and dives for the pylon for the TD!
OT rules: the offense will start with 1st and goal at the 10. Each team will get a chance to score, and we'll play until we have a winner.
End of regulation: after a crazy final few minutes, Hickory and Statesville are tied at 20. Free football! #prepblitz
And it's blocked again!!! Flag came out and looked like Hickory didn't get guys off the field in time, but it's waived off!
So it comes down to this: Statesville with a 23-yard FG with 9.5 seconds left to win the game.
And after a completion, Phillips is hit as he throws and it's picked off. Statesville has it inside its own 35.
A 2-yard loss followed by another 4 on an almost-fumble, and an incomplete pass brings up a huge FG... and IT'S WIDE LEFT!!
That's a tough break for Hickory. No chance to go to the booth and check the replay. Defense really has to hold here. Under 2 minutes to go.
Wow. After an offensive pass interference penalty, Phillips is hit and fumbles at the 1. Really looked like an incomplete pass...
Touchback, so Hickory will start from its own 20.
We're tied 20-20 at Frank Barger Stadium. Statesville's Caylon Imes runs in from 7 yards and the PAT is good. 2:27 left to play. #prepblitz
Staten reels in a 23-yard screen pass, but that's it for Hickory. Statesville starts from its own 34, 5:46 to play.
Hickory will start this drive from its own 21 with 7:22 left in the game. Red Tornadoes really need to put points on the board this drive.
Statesville pulls one back. Young throws a 14-yard screen pass to Brandon Joyner. PAT is wide, so Hickory leads 20-13. #prepblitz
Correction: 20-6 Hickory at the end of the 3rd.
End of the 3rd: Hickory leads Statesville 21-7. Red Tornadoes 12 minutes away from a statement win to start the season. #prepblitz
Crazy swing: Statesville punts inside own 5, recovers after Hickory deflection. Next play Antwan Shuford gets second INT of game!
Interception! Statesville QB Bryant Young throws it deep, but Elijah Milsaps picks him off just past midfield. Second INT for Hickory D.
Hickory TD! Red Tornadoes go for it on 4th and goal from the 1, and Jaelin Byrd rewards the decision. PAT blocked, 20-7 5:22 3rd. #prepblitz
Statesville starts the second half with the ball, but the Greyhounds wind up turning it over on downs in Hickory territory.
Hickory outgained Statesville 217-114 in the first half. Each team lost a fumble and had a FG blocked.
Halftime: Hickory still holds a 14-7 lead. Red Tornadoes had just 27 yards of offense that quarter. #prepblitz
Encroachment moves the ball up 5 yards, but the FG is blocked. Boston's kick didn't get up over the line. Still 14-7 Hickory. #prepblitz
A high snap on 3rd and 4 at the 9 results in Phillips falling on the ball at the 30. Harrison Boston is out for a 46-yarder.
After a Hickory punt, the D forces a fumble! Looks like Izaak Milsaps with the recovery, and inside the SHS 20!
Statesville attempts a 38-yd FG and it's blocked! Tajhme Leinberger breaks through the line to get to the holder, Richie Benoit recovers.
Now Statesville goes for it on 4th and 12 from the Hickory 45 and it's picked off! Antwan Shuford comes up with it inside the red zone.
Hickory goes for it on 4th and 11 at the Statesville 35, but the incomplete pass results in a turnover on downs.
There it is! Phillips starts the quarter with a 24-yd screen pass to Staten, and the Hickory QB has surpassed 4,000 career passing yards.
End of the 1st: Hickory 14, Statesville 7. Greyhounds struggling to stop the Red Tornadoes rushing attack. #prepblitz
Hickory retakes the lead! Jaelin Byrd busted a 40-yd run, and Phillips capped the drive with a 3-yd TD run. 14-7, 2:38 1st. #prepblitz
A low snap on a Hickory punt leads to a fumble and a 22-yd TD return for Statesville. Game is tied at 7, 4:45 1st. #prepblitz
Hickory gives up a first down but then forces a punt. Red Tornadoes will start from their own 23.
Touchdown Red Tornadoes! Quintavious Saddler punches in from a yard out for the first score of the season. 7-0 Hickory, 8:41 1st. #prepblitz
Hickory receives the kickoff to start this game. The Red Tornadoes will begin the drive at their own 14.
Kickoff is about 25 minutes away, so plenty of time to make it out if you aren't here yet! Looking forward to a great game tonight!
Last year, the Red Tornadoes dropped a 40-20 decision in Statesville to open the season. They'll look to avenge that loss tonight.
Additionally, WR Jaekwon Staten is 149 yds away from 1,500 career receiving yards. Both of these guys could hit these milestones tonight.
According to school stats, Hickory QB Derrien Phillips is 83 yds and two passing TDs away from 4,000 yds/50 TDs in his high school career.
Hickory holds a 27-26-1 series advantage against Statesville, but has lost three straight to the Greyhounds.
Some game notes coming at you: First, if you haven't seen it yet, Russell Stone is making his Red Tornadoes coaching debut.
It's finally time for Friday Night Lights! I'll have your updates tonight for the @hickory_high game against Statesville. #prepblitz

Final: @HickoryCrawdads 7, @GreenvilleDrive 3. 'Dads break a 4-game slide in emphatic fashion as Cordoba gets his first hit here.
Perez gets a two-out single but that's it for the 'Dads. Mendez is gonna try to finish this one.
Mendez retires the side in the 8th. Greenville will be down to its final three outs.
Hickory goes 1-2-3 in the home half of the 7th. Mendez comes out for his 4th inning of work.
A string of singles brings home a run for Greenville, but we enter the 7th inning stretch with Hickory leading 7-3.
Franklin Rollin leads off the 6th w/a Texas leaguer, and Prescott gets those 2 runs back with a homer to LF, his 8th of the year. 7-2 'Dads.
Cleanup hitter Roldani Baldwin hits hit own solo homer, this one a no-doubter to left. Hickory still leads 5-2.
Cedrola hits a solo homer to end the no-no and the shutout.
Hickory strands a runner at 3rd, but still lead 5-0 after 5. Mendez is back out to pitch the 6th. #nonoalert
Mendez gets a strikeout and then starts a 1-6-3 DP to end the top of the 5th. Combined no-hitter still possible. #nonoalert
Perez draws a BB but that's all in the 4th. And it looks like Evans' day is done as well. Four hitless innings, 2 BBs, 6 Ks. Sal Mendez in.
A walk and a Perez error put two runners on, but Evans induces a 6-4 force out to end the top of the 4th. No hitter still intact. #nonoalert
Rollin grounds out to short to end the 3rd, but what a 3rd it was. This is how you snap a four-game losing streak.
Robby Sexton (3-6, 4.41 ERA in 18 appearances) is on to get the final out, but Anderson Tejeda keeps the line moving with a single.
GRAND SLAM CORDERO!! He drives one just over the Galaxy Food Centers sign in left-center and that's it for Groome. 5-0 'Dads.
Leblanc takes 2nd freely and Valencia has a chance to bust this game open... but he takes ball 4. Bases loaded for Cordero.
Hickory still threatening with two outs. Kowalczyk on 3rd, Leblanc draws a BB and Ricky Valencia - who homered last night - at the plate.
Alex Kowalczyk hits one to the SS's right, but the 1B can't scoop the throw. Prescott scores from 2nd and the 'Dads lead 1-0!
Weird play, redux: Brallan Perez tries to put down a sac bunt but it goes foul. 1B catches it but falls into dugout. Runner advances to 2nd.
Cedrola flies out to left to end the inning. And because I don't believe in jinxes: Evans has a no-hitter (and 5 Ks) through 3. #nonoalert
Cedrola takes a fastball in the back, but the umpire had just called time before Evans pitched. Talk about getting away with a free one.
No. 9 hitter Carlos Tovar draws a two-out walk, and I can stop writing my perfect game story. Maybe one day...
Granger Studdard drives a ball to deep center, but Leody Taveras runs it down at the warning track. That one gave the crowd a scare.
Groome strikes out Franklin Rollin with a runner at 3rd to end the inning. 0-0 after two.
Odd play in the 2nd: Cordero hits a dribbler that he thought bounced off his shoulder. He didn't leave the box; ump ruled it fair. One out.
Evans adds two more strikeouts and 3B Chuck Leblanc makes a charging, bare-handed play on a dribbler. Scoreless through 1.5 innings.
Hickory gets two runners on, but Chuck Leblanc flies out to right to end a scoreless 1st. Groome matched Evans' 2 Ks as well.
Evans starts off with a 1-2-3 inning, including strikeouts of Cedrola and Boston's No. 4 prospect Bobby Dalbec.
'Dads are in snazzy blue Rangers jerseys tonight. Evans delivers a ball to Lorenzo Cedrola (Boston's No. 14 prospect) and we're underway.
Here are tonight's starting lineups. Andretty Cordero is playing in his third game for the Crawdads tonight. pic.twitter.com/eaTTxfghiR
Hickory, meanwhile, is averaging 2.6 runs/game over the past 5 (1-4). Crawdads really need a strong game tonight to kick off this series.
He pitched against Hickory on Sunday, going 5 innings with 2 ER and 7 Ks in a 3-1 loss. We'll have to see if the 'Dads can get to him again.
To make matters worse for the 'Dads: They face Drive SP Jay Groome, the No. 2 prospect in Boston's system. He's been called the next Rocket.
These teams are heading in opposite directions right now. Hickory has lost four straight, while Greenville is 8-2 in its past 10 games.
I'm giving @CrawdadsBeat the night off, so I'll have your updates from @HickoryCrawdads vs. @GreenvilleDrive tonight. Game starts at 7!

My recap from last night's game: http://www. hickoryrecord.com/townnews/baseb all/home-runs-doom-hickory-crawdads-in-series-opener-against-asheville/article_e92584ee-6d0e-11e7-860b-f364040a0e9d.html …
Final: @GoTourists 7, @HickoryCrawdads 3. Asheville gets three 2-run HRs to win. Game 2 of the series starts at 7 pm tomorrow.
Leblanc lines out to the shortstop and the Crawdads are down to their final out.
Tejeda grounds out to second for the first out. Looks like he'll remain a HR short of the cycle tonight.
Jairo Beras came in to pitch the 9th, by the way. He gets a K to end the inning. Can Hickory find 4 runs to avoid the loss?
And Herrera hits his second two-run homer of the game (third HR this season) to push Asheville's lead to 7-3.
Asheville adds an insurance run in the top of the 9th with a Joel Diaz RBI double. 'Dads now trail 5-3.
But Yohel Pozo grounds right back to the pitcher for the last out of the 8th. Asheville still leads 4-3.
With two outs, Alex Kowalczyk takes ball 4, which scoots past the catcher to allow Jenkins to advance to 3rd. Tying run now 90 feet away.
Eric Jenkins leads off with a bunt single and then takes second on a passed ball.
Evans gets a 1-2-3 inning and the 'Dads are down to their final six outs. Julian Fernandez takes the mound for Asheville in the 8th.
Arredondo's night is done. His line: 7 IP, 4 ER, 3 H, 6 K, 0 BB and in line for the loss right now. Demarcus Evans is on to pitch.
Ricky Valencia grounds into a 6-4-3 DP but scores Tejeda. 'Dads now trail 4-3 after 7 innings.
Now pitching for Asheville is Matt Dennis. He's 4-1 this year with a 3.04 ERA and 51 Ks in 30 appearances.
Leblanc follows with a single to move Tejeda to 3rd, and that's it for Requena. His line: 6+ IP, 7 H, 5 K, 2 R (responsible for 2 runners).
Tejeda leads off the 7th with a double off the RF wall. He's 3-3 tonight and is now a HR short of a cycle. Should get a chance in the 9th.
And just like the 1st inning, a HBP leads to a 2-run HR. This one comes from Carlos Herrera, who came into the game hitting .210 with 1 HR.
Arredondo hits his second batter of the night, ending a streak of 12 straight retired.
Tejeda takes his turn to flash the leather. The shortstop dives to his left on a hard-hit ball to rob an Asheville hitter of a sure single.
Six complete and we're back to where we started. Arredondo comes back out for the 7th.
Leody Taveras wakes up the crowd with a solo homer that clears the Lenoir-Rhyne ad in right. His 6th HR of the year ties this game at 2.
Crawdads go quietly in the 5th. Asheville starter Alejandro Requena has allowed just two singles since the 2nd.
Two more strikeouts - that's five for Arredondo - and a fantastic stop from Leblanc at third sends Asheville back to the field in the 5th.
And that's all for the Crawdads in the 4th. This game is starting to settle into a pitcher's duel.
Tejeda beats out an infield 1B for his 2nd hit of the game. But a few pitches later he's thrown out stealing 2nd - his fifth CS of the year.
Arredondo retires the side in order. He's settled in nicely after the 1st-inning HR, retiring 12 of the past 13 hitters he's faced.
Great diving catch from Franklin Rollin to rob Asheville of a double! The right-fielder sprinted to his left and timed his dive perfectly.
Hickory can only manage a Taveras single in the home half. After 3 innings, 'Dads still trail 2-1.
Fernandez gets a single for his second hit of the game, but Arredondo's third strikeout of the night ends the inning.
Jose Gomez - who got hit on the hand to start the game - is done tonight. Tyler Nevin will take his place for Asheville.
'Dads will strand a runner at 2nd to end the inning. @GoTourists lead 2-1 after two.
And Charles Leblanc follows with an RBI double to left-center to cut Asheville's lead to 2-1.
With one out, Anderson Tejeda hits his 5th triple of the year. The CF had shifted left but not left enough as the ball bounced off the wall.
Great bounce-back inning for Arredondo, who strikes out two Tourists. To the bottom of the second we go.
Leody Taveras lifts a fly ball to the warning track in left, but that's as close as Hickory gets to an answer. 'Dads trail 2-0 after 1.
A groundout and two fly balls end the inning. Two runs might be enough for Requena, who has been the ace for Asheville this season.
Leadoff hitter Jose Gomez gets hit on the hand, and Vince Fernandez follows with a homer to center. 'Dads down 2-0 before they get an out.
Arredondo fires a first-pitch strike and we're underway!
These teams should be quite familiar with each other. 'Dads lost 2 of 3 in Asheville last week as part of a 2-4 road trip.
Crawdads (41-54, 14-11) are tied for 1st in SAL Northern standings, while the Tourists (44-49, 15-10) are 2nd in SAL Southern division.
Alejandro Requena (7-3, 2.74 ERA, 86 Ks) takes the mound for Asheville, and Hickory's starter is Edgar Arredondo (5-4, 4.25 ERA, 64 Ks).
I'm at L.P. Frans Stadium tonight filling in for @CrawdadsBeat as the @HickoryCrawdads begin a 3-game series against the @GoTourists .

Union County, top seed from Area IV East, awaits the Taylorsville/Shelby series winner. #nclegion https:// twitter.com/nedyates26/sta tus/883886137244348417 …
Starnes paints the corner for strike 3 and that's the ballgame. Final score: Taylorsville 5, Shelby 3. Game 4 tomorrow at Shelby. #nclegion
Brandon Irvin can't check his swing on a third strike, and Shelby is down to its final out. #nclegion
A wild pitch moves the runner to 2nd, and Logan McNeely doubles to cut the lead to 5-3. Tying run at the plate for Shelby. #nclegion
Campbell gets a strikeout and hits a batter, but that will be all for him. Trae Starnes is on to get the final two outs. #nclegion
Fireworks are going off in left field. Apparently the town planned its July 4 celebration for tonight. #nclegion
Tyler Campbell is on to get the save for Taylorsville. #nclegion
Plummer labors through a 23-pitch inning but gets out unscathed. Shelby has 3 outs to find 3 runs to tie this game. #nclegion
It's a 1-2-3 inning for Waddell, who gets his fourth K of the game. Shelby will bring Caleb Plummer in to pitch the 8th. #nclegion
Waddell is at 108 pitches but back out to start the 8th. Let's see how much he has left in the tank. #nclegion
Carter needs just 10 pitches to retire the side in that half-inning. Taylorsville is six outs away from forcing Game 4. #nclegion
Waddell gives up a two-out BB and 1B but nothing else. We'll stretch at Bob Gryder Stadium with Post 170 leading 5-2. #nclegion
Rhyne Johnson adds an insurance run for Post 170 on a 1B to left, scoring Daniel Dessecker. It's Taylorsville 5, Shelby 2 after 6. #nclegion
Post 82 brings the go-ahead run to the plate, but the score remains 4-2 after 5.5 innings. #nclegion
Shelby P Carter K's 2 and almost loses his head on a hard liner, but knocks it down to get 3rd out. Post 170 leads 4-2 after 5. #nclegion
Shelby leaves two runners on base to end the inning. Could have been a different inning had Shull not tried to score. #nclegion
But Ben Ledbetter follows with an RBI single to center to cut Taylorsville's lead to 4-2. #nclegion
Shelby mistake in 5th: Austin Shull tries to score from 2nd on a 1B to left, but Tyler Campbell nails him at the plate by 5 steps. #nclegion
Matt Wilkinson's RBI single is bookended by a pop out and 5-3 DP to end the threat. Taylorsville now leads 4-1 after four innings. #nclegion
Shelby goes quietly in the 4th, and now Taylorsville has bases loaded with no outs and a chance to bust this game open. #nclegion
Grayson Chapman hits a two-out line drive over the first baseman's head to give Post 170 a 3-1 lead after three innings. #nclegion
In the 3rd, Waddell works into trouble with an E5 and HBP, but gets an F8 and 6-4-3 DP to preserve Taylorsville's 2-1 lead. #nclegion
Taylorsville takes the lead with a fielder's choice from Josh Hubbard and RJ Conner single. After 2 complete, Post 170 leads 2-1. #nclegion
Shelby starter strikes out two and works around a one-out walk to keep Taylorsville scoreless after one inning. #nclegion
With bases loaded and no outs, Shelby can only manage a run on Carson Gettys' 4-6-3 DP. Post 170 comes to the plate trailing 1-0. #nclegion
Waddell walks the first two Shelby batters and he gets a visit from Taylorsville coach Pete Hardee - with some field dry. #nclegion
Taylorsville starter Tanner Waddell delivers a first-pitch ball to Lawson Harrill and we are underway at Bob Gryder. #nclegion
Tonight's starting lineups. #nclegion pic.twitter.com/jB1XbJUQ2T
Just announced this game will start at 7:20. Field is thankfully in pretty good shape, just needed some minor work. #nclegion
I'm at Bob Gryder Stadium for Game 3 between Taylorsville and Shelby. Currently in a rain delay but trying to get this in tonight. #nclegion pic.twitter.com/F4Jeowuuob
That means Cherryville, Union County and Shelby all have a chance to sweep tomorrow to make the Area IV semifinals. #nclegion
Other #nclegion scores tonight: Cherryville 6, Gastonia 2; Union County 12, Asheville 6; Gaston 15, Mint Hill 4 (7 innings).
Taylorsville comes home tomorrow facing elimination. That game starts at 7 pm at @AlexCentralHS . https:// twitter.com/dwp90/status/8 83509087228616707 …

Here's my recap from last night's thrilling matchup between Taylorsville and Shelby. #nclegion https:// twitter.com/hickoryrecord/ status/883294535886950400 …
Other #nclegion Area IV results: Cherryville 10-5 over Gastonia, Union County beats Asheville 9-3 and Mint Hill w/ the 5-3 upset vs. Gaston.
Forgot to mention this game will be at Shelby. The two teams return to Taylorsville on Saturday for game 3.
Thank you for the kind words! Game 2 is tomorrow at 7 pm at Shelby.
Final: Shelby Post 82 beats Taylorsville Post 170, 8-5 in 11 innings. Game 2 is tomorrow at 7 p.m. #nclegion
Wilkinson, the Post 170 starting pitcher, flies out to right for the second out. Runners on the corners now. #nclegion
Rhyne Johnson's fifth hit of the night is a single to center. Runners on first and second with one out. #nclegion
RJ Conner stares at a called third strike on the outside corner for out No. 1. #nclegion
Derek Dyson leads off the bottom of the 11th with a single to left for Taylorsville. #nclegion
That's all for Shelby in the top of the 11th, but the damage has been done. Can Post 170 find more magic tonight? #nclegion
McNeely's first hit of the night is a 3-run homer to dead center to put Shelby ahead 8-5 in the 11th. #nclegion
Nothing doing for either team in the 10th, so we'll head to the 11th with Shelby and Taylorsville still tied at 5. #nclegion
Taylorsville will make a pitching change to start 10th. Dessecker, who tied the game with a bunt single in 8th, takes the mound. #nclegion
But alas, we are heading to extras tied at 5. Does either team have any magic left after a wild 9th inning? #nclegion
So to reset: It's 5-5 with one out in the bottom of the 9th and the bases clear. Taylorsville can still win it here. #nclegion
I've never seen anything like that in my life. Stoppage in play as they tend to the left fielder and the fence.
WOW! Rhyne Johnson with the craziest inside-the-park 2-run HR to tie. LF got foot caught under the fence, couldn't get free to get the ball.
Taylorsville faces its final three outs, needing two runs to tie and three to win via walkoff. #nclegion
Shelby gets 2 on with 2 outs in the 9th, and Post 170 escapes the jam... until Starnes loses a fly ball in center. Shelby takes a 5-3 lead.
Tied again! Starnes flies out to center to move Fairchild to third, and Daniel Dessecker bunts him home! Now it's 3-3 after 8. #nclegion
Fairchild leads off with a single to left. Then he gets too good a jump on Wallace, but the pickoff throw goes to left field. #nclegion
Campbell gives up a 1B and sac bunt to start the 8th, but 2 fly outs end the threat. Taylorsville has six outs left to find a run. #nclegion
Wallace retires all three hitters via fly out. After 7 innings, Post 82 has a 3-2 lead over Post 170. #nclegion
Gettys' day is done for Shelby: 6 IP, 2 R (1 ER), 6 H and in line for the win. Cameron Wallace is on to pitch. #nclegion
McNeely flies out to right, but it's deep enough to score the run. Shelby retakes the lead, 3-2, after 6.5 innings. #nclegion
We have our first pitching change, as Post 170 brings in the lefty Campbell with a runner on 3rd and a 2-1 count to Logan McNeely. #nclegion
Conner and Campbell collide in the outfield on a fly ball to start the 7th. Both appear OK, but Shelby has a runner on second. #nclegion
A pitcher's duel has broken out at Bob Gryder Stadium. Gettys retires the side in the home half, so it's 2-2 after six complete. #nclegion
It's another three-up, three-down inning in the sixth for Wilkinson, who has retired six straight after a shaky start. #nclegion
After 5 innings, Taylorsville and Shelby are knotted at 2-2. #nclegion
We are tied in the 5th! RJ Conner reached on an E6, moved to 2nd on a 1B, and then scored on Kyler Fairchild's hit-and-run 1B. #nclegion
Wilkinson gets two pop outs and a strikeout for his first clean inning. Taylorsville trails 2-1 after 4.5 innings. #nclegion
Post 170 with a huge chance in the 4th, but Derek Dyson grounds into fielder's choice with 2 outs, bases loaded. Still 2-1 Shelby. #nclegion
A Shelby single and sac bunt gets a runner in scoring position, but Wilkinson gets 2 flyouts to center to keep the score the same. #nclegion
After three innings, Shelby leads this Area IV quarterfinal game 2-1. #nclegion
Rhyne Johnson's second hit of the game is an RBI 2B that cuts the Shelby lead to 2-1. LF Shull badly misplayed it and got burned. #nclegion
Wilkinson works around a walk and his third HBP in three innings to keep Shelby off the board. Post 82 leads 2-0 after 2.5. #nclegion
Shelby starter Carson Gettys needed just six pitches to retire the side in the 2nd. It's still 2-0 Shelby heading to the 3rd. #nclegion
Just like the 1st, Shelby gets runners on via walk and HBP, but can't capitalize on the opportunity. Still 2-0 after 1.5 innings. #nclegion
Nothing doing for Taylorsville in the home half. After one complete, Shelby leads 2-0. #nclegion
Following a hit batter, Ben Ledbetter drives a liner into the left-field corner to give Shelby an early 2-0 lead. #nclegion
Lawson Harrill draws a leadoff walk for Shelby Post 82 and we are underway. #nclegion
Here are starting lineups for tonight's game. The sun is shining so we should start on time. #nclegion pic.twitter.com/p9tAEBd7Cv

Final: Hickory loses 5-4. Next hitter walked, coach brought in a pinch runner, who is immediately picked off. Tough way to lose.
B9: We should be tied. Hickory hits a two-run homer with two outs, but that second out was a runner picked off second. 5-4 now.
8th: For the second straight inning, Hickory gets two runners on but can't get either of them in. We head to the 9th, still 5-2.
7th: Rutherford loads the bases but can only score 1 on a groundout. Hickory gets two runners on but can't capitalize. Post 48 trailing 5-2.
But don't you know that Rock and Roll Ain't Noise Pollution? pic.twitter.com/FJMrHD2Ukm
5th: Hickory gets 2 runs back on 3 hits (two infield singles bookending a double to LCF wall). Post 48 now trails 4-2 with five complete.
4th: Rutherford scores 3 more on back to back doubles, aided by two Hickory errors. Post 48 remains hitless, now trail 4-0.
3rd: With two outs, Rutherford gets a 2B and 1B to score game's first run. Post 48 has yet to get a hit, trail 1-0 after 3.
Back at it tonight at Henkel-Alley Field for an American Legion game between @hickorypost48 and Rutherford County Post 423. pic.twitter.com/3ETEhJw4fI

Final: Dallas Jesuit 0, La Joya Juarez-Lincoln 0 (4-2 PK). The Rangers advance to the 6A boys final! #UILState
End OT: A penalty shootout will decide who joins Arlington Houston in tomorrow's 6A boys final. #UILState
OT12': La Joya rattles the post! The keeper was frozen as he gratefully watched the ball ricochet back into play. #UILState
The first OT period is over. Still no goals. Ten more minutes before this heads for a PK shootout. #UILState
La Joya outshot Dallas Jesuit 19-4 in regulation. Jesuit keeper Luke Ostrander has made seven saves so far. #UILState
End of regulation: this scoreless draw between La Joya and Dallas Jesuit is heading to overtime. #UILState
Under 10 minutes to play now. Can either team find the back of the net before this heads to overtime (please)? #UILState
An hour gone and still no score. La Joya has been the aggressor this half as Dallas Jesuit has sat back and welcomed the pressure. #UILState
La Joya had 10 shots in the first half, but only three on target. Both of Dallas Jesuit's shots forced saves. #UILState
Halftime: The La Joya fans have been the most exciting part of this goalless half. #UILState
35': Dallas Jesuit's Andrew Gilchrist picks up a yellow card for a bad tackle. #UILState
Twenty minutes gone in this first half and it's still scoreless. #UILState
Final game from Birkelbach: La Joya Juarez-Lincoln (30-3-1) vs Dallas Jesuit (20-3-1) for a spot in tomorrow's 6A boys #UILState final.
Sophomore midfielder Nate Kopetsky netted the winning goal for Houston in what was one of the most exciting finishes I've seen at #UILState .
Final: Arlington Houston 2, Pasadena Dobie 1. The Texans are on to the 6A state title game! #UILState
77': GOAL! Houston takes a 2-1 lead with just minutes to play! #UILState
72': Houston's Eduardo Santos is shown yellow. Time running out in regulation... #UILState
60': Dobie's Israel Perez is the next to be booked. Twenty minutes for either side to find a winner here. #UILState
56': PK GOAL! Houston ties it up. Jason Ramirez earned the PK with a quick burst into the box, and Sergio Martinez fooled the GK. #UILState
53': Luis Vargas picks up a yellow card for Houston after he collides with a Dobie defender. #UILState
51': Close! Texans w/a good look, but the header from Sergio Martinez hits the post. It bounces back to him, but the next shot is saved.
Halftime: Salvidar's PK goal is the difference as Dobie leads 1-0. #UILState
32': PK GOAL! Raul Hernandez earns the penalty, and Edwin Saldivar blasts it past the keeper for a 1-0 Dobie lead. #UILState
A half hour is gone and there's been a lot of dribbling and passing, little shooting and no scoring. #UILState
16': Sebastian Leal picks up a yellow card for Dobie. #UILState
And on the other side is the Arlington (Sam) Houston Texans. That won't be confusing at all. #UILState
Each player for the Dobie Longhorns (dressed in all UT orange) has dyed his hair blonde. Superstition makes you do weird things... #UILState
Just about ready for the next #UILState game, a 6A boys semifinal clash between Pasadena Dobie (20-2-4) and Arlington Houston (21-2-2).
Final: Kilgore 2, Bridgeport 2 (4-2 PK). Kilgore is your 4A boys state champion! #UILState
Save Kilgore! Kaleb Jett dives to his left and stops a weak PK. #UILState
Kilgore answers back! Torres beats the keeper to the right and we are tied at 2. #UILState
Bridgeport makes it 2 for 2! Iniguez goes straight up the middle. #UILState
Now Kilgore... same result! Contreras goes upper right, and the Bridgeport GK can't get enough on the save. 1-1 after one. #UILState
Bridgeport will take the first PK... Amador scores! Keeper guessed correctly but could only get a hand to it. #UILState
And the second OT period comes to an end. Penalty kicks will decide this 4A boys state final. #UILState
OT17': Massive save!! Bridgeport GK came off his line inexplicably, but Eric Aguilar makes the goal-line clearance to preserve the tie!
That ends OT1. There will be a quick water break and then 10 more minutes for one of these teams to find a winner before PKs. #UILState
OT7': Off the post!! Wanya McIntyre - a freshman - almost put Kilgore ahead. Bridgeport GK has to be feeling lucky. #UILState
The teams combined for 12 shots (Kilgore 9, Bridgeport 3) and two disallowed goals in the second half, but no change to the scoreboard.
There will be a pair of 10-minute OT periods, and then PKs if the match is still tied. #UILState
Bridgeport has a late free kick from 30 yards, but the ball lands safely in the keeper's hands. We're headed to OT! #UILState
76': Close! Bridgeport's Amador is played in over the top and Kilgore's GK comes out late, but the shot goes wide of the open net. #UILState
73': Now it's Bridgeport's turn for a disallowed goal. Juan Amador seemingly had the match-winner, but he was a foot offsides on the pass.
Less than nine minutes remaining in the 4A boys final. Can either team find a late winner in regulation? #UILState
65': Yellow card issued to Bridgeport's Jonathan Juarez for a late slide tackle. #UILState
60': Kilgore's Yonaton Contreras finds the back of the net, but the assistant ref had already ruled him offsides. #UILState
I'm convinced nothing connects Austin people more than sharing traffic horror stories.
Ten minutes gone in this second half. Neither team has had a good look at goal so far, but I expect that won't last long. #UILState
Both teams are back on the field and ready to start the second half. #UILState
Halftime at the 4A boys final: Kilgore 2, Bridgeport 2. Both teams scored four-minute braces in an eventful first half. #UILState
29': GOAL! Juan Amador ties the match for Bridgeport with a powerful shot from the top of the box, back across the goal. Thrilling 4A final!
26': PK GOAL! Bridgeport pulls one back. Efrain DeLuna w/a fantastic 50-yard run to draw PK, Miguel Olmos calmly slotted home. 2-1 Kilgore
20': Close again! This time it's the Bulls forcing a fine save from the Kilgore GK. End-to-end action in this first half. #UILState
19': Close! Kilgore with a corner, but the header from Torres forces a good save from the Bridgeport GK. Still 2-0 Kilgore. #UILState
12': GOAL! It's Kilgore again, this time w/an impressive finish from Elian Torres. He beat his defender and powered home from a tight angle.
9': GOAL! Early pressure pays off for Kilgore, who gets a headed goal from Wanya McIntyre. Assisted by Jovany Gonzalez. #UILState
This should be an exciting match, but there's also a fun mascot matchup here: the Kilgore Bulldogs vs the Bridgeport Bulls. #UILState
I'm back at Birkelbach to cover #UILState for @varsity_news . Next up: Kilgore (20-5-2) vs. Bridgeport (19-3-5) for the 4A boys title.
One of the first athletes I covered is getting a shot at the top level. Pretty cool feeling (for him as well, I'm sure). https:// twitter.com/osubaseball/st atus/852908006677389312 …

I left Georgetown 70 minutes ago. Still not to my apartment in south Austin yet. Bang-up work on I-35, @TxDOT . Great stuff. Really.
FINALLY https:// twitter.com/kendricklamar/ status/852721063863529472 …
Final: Waller 4, Brownsville Lopez 0. The Bulldogs win a feisty one and earn a trip to Saturday's 5A boys final against Wakeland. #UILState
57': GOAL! Waller's Ricardo Lopez with his second of the match, a low drive from 25 yards that the keeper saw late. 4-0 Waller #UILState
Waller GK Raul Rodriguez makes a great diving save to his right to preserve the shutout.
55': Lopez is fouled on the edge of the box, and there's a stoppage in play as Echavarria is helped off the field. #UILState
Yet he's still on the field. So either the stats guys missed something, or the ref has no idea.
Stats guys in the next booth are saying one of those yellow cards went to Lopez's Jose Echavarria, who was also booked at the end of 1H.
49': And there's another yellow card for Lopez. Referee is definitely losing control of this one. Waller still leads 3-0. #UILState
47': Yellow cards for each team as this match gets more chippy. Referee might be losing control of this one... #UILState
44': PK miss! Waller got a questionable call and Simon Salgado shanked the kick. And Lopez off the post just a minute later! #UILState
And the whistle blows to start the second half. Can Lopez find some goals or is Waller headed for the 5A boys title game? #UILState
Some halftime stats... Shots: Waller 9, Lopez 5... Corners: Waller 7, Lopez 2... Saves: Waller 1, Lopez 0... Fouls: Waller 5, Lopez 10
HT: Chippy end to the half as Jose Echavarria picks up a yellow for Lopez. Waller with a commanding 3-0 lead. #UILState
38': GOAL! It's Waller again, this time off the head of Ricardo Lopez. Bulldogs now lead 3-0 as halftime approaches. #UILState
36': GOAL! Ricardo Castillo doubles Waller's lead with a headed goal from Eric Oregon's cross. 2-0 Bulldogs #UILState
34': Lopez gets a great look at goal, but the shot sails over the crossbar. That's about the third or fourth shot to do that tonight.
27': Miguel Chavez limps off for Lopez. He appears to be favoring his left ankle. #UILState
25': Lopez forward Sebastian Benavides picks up a yellow card. Waller still leads 1-0. #UILState
10': GOAL! Waller strikes first behind a beautiful 20-yard free kick from David Jara. The Lopez GK got a hand to it but couldn't stop it.
The referee blows his whistle and this match is underway! Who will join Wakeland in Saturday's 5A boys final? #UILState
Almost ready for our final game tonight, which pits Brownsville Lopez (16-3-1) against Waller (21-5-3) for a spot in the 5A title game.
Final: Wakeland 6, Wichita Falls 0. This one is mercifully over. The Wolverines are onto the 5A state championship game Saturday. #UILState
75': Richy Acosta picks up a yellow card for Wichita Falls. Let's just say he was displeased with the referee calling a foul on him.
68': Close! Ramirez hits the post for Wichita Falls, who is looking to salvage something, anything, from this match. #UILState
64': GOAL! Not sure if there's a run rule, but we're on our way to finding out. Theo Martey makes it 6-0 Wakeland. #UILState
52': GOAL! Jacob Miller grabs his second today with a rocket from the corner of the 18. This is a full-blown rout now. 5-0 Wake #UILState
51': GOAL! Cody Sedatole adds his name to the scoresheet, and breaks out the Ronaldo celebration. 4-0 Wakefield now. #UILState
Wakeland w/the lion's share of possession and shots in the opening 10 minutes of 2nd half. Not much has changed for Wichita Falls. #UILState
Just seconds later, WFHS GK Jesus Ortiz makes a fantastic save to prevent another Wakeland goal. #UILState
44': Great chance for Wakeland to add to its lead, but the shot from point-blank range is blocked by a Wichita Falls defender. #UILState
The two teams have switched sides and we are underway for the second half of this 5A boys semifinal. #UILState
Some halftime stats... Shots: Wake 8, WF 4... Corners: Wake 3, WF 2... Saves: Wake 2, WF 3... Fouls: Wake 4, WF 3... YC: Wake 1, WF 1
Halftime at Birkelbach: Wakeland leads Wichita Falls 3-0. Wolverines appear to have their ticket to the final booked. #UILState
38': Now Ramirez is down after a tough collision with the Wakeland GK. He's holding his head but gets up before the trainer gets to him.
33': Acosta subs back into the game and appears to be fine. Alex Ramirez picks up a yellow card for the Coyotes. #UILState
31': Wichita Falls is struggling to string together consecutive passes. Halftime can't get here soon enough for the Coyotes. #UILState
30': WFHS forward Richy Acosta is down, causing a stop in play. He's able to walk off the field under his own power. #UILState
26': GOAL! A Wichita Falls defender flubs a clearance and heads into his own net. Wakeland leads 3-0, 13 minutes to halftime. #UILState
23': GOAL! Wakeland doubles its lead through Alex Wing, who finds the back of the net with his knee after the WFHS GK made a save. #UILState
11': WFHS forward Alex Ramirez is offsides, but it wouldn't have mattered. His shot sailed 30 yards beyond the goal and into an empty field.
7': Wakeland with the heavy pressure to start the match. One shot rattled the post and two others have gone just wide. #UILState
3': GOAL! Wakeland capitalizes on the first corner of the game. Jacob Miller heads home a Simeon Salazar cross for the 1-0 lead. #UILState
The first 5A boys semifinal has kicked off at a gusty Birkelbach Field. Wichita Falls in black, Wakeland in white. #UILState
Now on to the 5A boys semifinals. First up: Frisco Wakeland (20-4-1) vs Wichita Falls (16-2-6). Winner advances to 5A final Saturday.
Final: Stephenville earns its first 4A girls soccer title with a 2-1 win over Boerne. Freshman Madison Carter w/the 50th-minute game-winner.
77': Alford with a great piece of defending to prevent the Boerne equalizer. The senior scored the opening goal in the first half. #UILState
73': Boerne is sending numbers forward, but Stephenville has dropped back to defend its lead. #UILState
Greyhounds have been pressing forward, but can't seem to find the final pass. Fifteen minutes to play in the 4A girls final. #UILState
58': Boerne's Taylor Hoke draws a yellow card and will sub out. Greyhounds have 20 minutes to find the tying goal. #UILState
52': The Bees almost doubled their lead, but the shot deflects off the post and into the Boerne GK's hands. #UILState
50': GOAL! SHS retakes the lead thanks to Madison Carter, who calmly taps in from 8 yards just seconds after subbing on. #UILState
They play Saturday at 11 am in Georgetown fyi
43': Boerne with a free kick from 30 yards that forces a good save. The ensuing corner kick yields nothing. #UILState
The teams have switched sides and the second half is underway. Boerne has the wind at its back this half. #UILState
Some halftime stats... Shots: SHS 7, BHS 2... Corners: SHS 2, BHS 1... Fouls: SHS 4, BHS 9... Saves: SHS 0, BHS 2 #UILState
Halftime in the 4A girls final: Stephenville 1, Boerne 1. Alford's opening goal was cancelled out by Marcell six minutes later. #UILState
...the Boerne GK drops a 40-yard SHS free kick on goal, but two SHS attackers can't convert from 6 yards. Still 1-1, five minutes to half.
Within three minutes, chances for both teams go for naught. Boerne striker was in on goal, but a poor first touch prevented a shot. Then...
29': A crucial deflection prevents a second SHS goal. Gracie Bales got behind the defense, but the Boerne GK was quick off her line.
23': GOAL! Boerne's Paige Marcell ties the match. From top of the box, she chipped the SHS GK, who inexplicably came off her line. #UILState
20': Boerne with a free kick 20 yards out, near the sideline. Cassie Naiser goes for goal but the SHS GK is unchallenged. #UILState

For a second straight game, Texas had just two hits in a loss to its rival. My #RedRiverShowdown recap: https:// twitter.com/bevobeat/statu s/850836129272266753 …
B7: A 4-6-3 double play ends this one. OU takes the game and the #RedRiverShowdown series with a 3-1 win. @bevobeat
B7: Slack grounds to third, but the 3B tries to tag DerMargosian and everyone is safe! First and third now as Washington steps to the plate.
B7: DerMargosian advances to third on a wild pitch. Slack is at the plate with one out.
B7: DerMargosian grounds to third, but the throw skips past the first baseman and she advances to second. Tying run at the plate.
B7: Close play at first but Leahy is out by a half-step. Texas down to its final two outs.
T7: Kristen Clark allows two runners on but gets two strikeouts to end the inning. Texas comes to the plate needing two runs to tie.
B6: Again the Longhorns go three up, three down. We head to the final inning at McCombs Field with OU leading 3-1. #RedRiverShowdown
T6: Sooners leave a runner stranded at 3rd, but still lead 3-1. Texas has the 2-3-4 hitters coming up this half-inning. #RedRiverShowdown
Davis's line today: 5 IP, 3 R (1 ER), 6 H, 3 K, 4 BB in 120 pitches. She's currently on the hook for the loss unless UT can rally.
Kristen Clark will take the circle to start the 6th. She's 2-0 this season with a 4.32 ERA in 12 appearances.
Texas strands a runner at 2nd, but the crowd is back in this one. Sooners lead #RedRiverShowdown 3-1 after five innings.
B5: That will end Lopez's day. She was dominant for 4.2 innings, allowing just the run on two hits. She's responsible for runner on 2nd.
B5: The Horns are on the board! No. 9 hitter Kelli Hanzel rips a two-out liner up the middle and Washington beats the throw to the plate.
B5: Kaitlyn Washington finally breaks up the no-hitter with a double to the left-center gap. Lopez had retired 10 straight UT hitters.
Sooners take a 3-0 lead into the bottom of the 5th. Tuesday DerMargosian will lead off, looking for the first UT hit of the day.
T5: Davis's 120th pitch is a popup to shallow left, and Tunning makes the diving catch! OU leaves bases loaded but not before scoring twice.
T5: Davis starts OU PH Taukeiaho with two balls, and Connie Clark is out to the circle to talk to her pitcher.
T5: After a liner off Davis's glove and a walk, the Sooners have the bases loaded with two outs. OU with a huge chance to blow this open.
T5: OU's Knighten, yesterday's hero, rips a double that falls before Washington can reach it. Two runs score for the Sooners, both unearned.
T5: OU's Aviu flies out to right, but it's not deep enough to advance the runners. Two outs now as Horns try to keep the one-run difference.
T5: Connie Clark huddles the team for a meeting, but Davis will stay in the game. First and third for OU with one out and a 1-0 lead.
T5: Tough play for UT. A grounder to third sets up the double play attempt, but the throw deflects off Slack's glove and into the outfield.
T5: Davis starts the inning with a walk. Brooke Bolinger is warming up in the bullpen as Davis approaches 100 pitches.
B4: Another 1-2-3 inning for OU's Lopez. She's retired the past 8 UT hitters, throwing 36 of her 52 pitches for strikes so far today.
B4: Ellsworth rips a line drive, but directly at the right fielder. One away.
Freshman Taylor Ellsworth, who leads the team with a .475 batting average, will lead off the bottom of the fourth. OU still leads 1-0.
T4: Davis finally gets a 1-2-3 inning, but she's at 85 pitches through 4 IP. UT still looking for its first #RedRiverShowdown hit today.
B3: OU's Lopez gets the top of the UT order out in just eight pitches. Horns are still looking for their first hit today. 1-0 OU after three
OU had runners on 2nd and 3rd with no outs, but comes away scoreless. Might that be the momentum swing Texas needs?
T3: Davis gets two strikeouts to get out of the jam. Sooners might regret leaving two runners in scoring position. #RedRiverShowdown
T3: Big play for UT! With runners on 2nd & 3rd, sharp grounder to 1B Hanzel throws home, and C Leahy catches runner in rundown for first out
The Longhorns strand two runners in their half of the inning. OU still leads #RedRiverShowdown 1-0 after two.
B2: Kaitlyn Slack drives a liner down the right-field line, but OU's Mendez makes a great diving catch into foul territory. SC Top 10 play.
B2: After Tuesday DerMargosian fights off five foul balls, she takes the next pitch off the helmet. She's fine though.
B2: Felix flies out to the shortstop, but catcher interference will put her on first base.
B2: After dirt is added and the circle repainted, we are ready to start again. Celina Felix will lead off the inning.
B2: A bit of a delay here as the Sooners have yet to take the field. Looks like the field crew is coming out to work on the pitching circle.
T2: Sooners draw a walk but nothing else. 4-5-6 hitters coming up for Texas this inning. #RedRiverShowdown
B1: OU's Lopez needs just 11 pitches to retire the side in order. After one, Sooners lead #RedRiverShowdown 1-0.
T1: Davis needs 29 pitches, but strands two OU runners to limit any more damage. Horns come to the plate trailing 1-0. #RedRiverShowdown
T1: Oklahoma strikes first again today. Fale Aviu skies a fly ball to right but Kaitlyn Washington loses it in the sun. 1-0 Sooners
Davis delivers a first-pitch ball and this #RedRiverShowdown is underway in front of a packed McCombs Field crowd.
In the most Texas thing possible, a three-piece bluegrass band played the national anthem. And honestly, it was pretty good.
Here's today's starting lineups for #RedRiverShowdown game two: pic.twitter.com/KpJXKl2Tun
Today's #RedRiverShowdown starters: OU - Mariah Lopez (11-1, 1.59 ERA, 69 K in 66 IP) UT - Tiarra Davis (4-7, 2.23 ERA, 51 K in 66 IP)
Horns looking to end these active OU streaks today: 10 straight wins 16 straight road wins 19 straight Big 12 wins 8 straight #RRS wins
CF Reagan Hathaway will miss rest of the series after her collision in yesterday's game. The sophomore is second on the team in HRs, RBIs.

Sooners take the first game of the series, 3-2. Longhorns fall to 20-16, 0-4 in Big 12 play and 4-9 in one-run games. @bevobeat
B7: Faster than I can type this tweet, Paige von Sprecken pinch hits and flies out for the second out.
B7: Taylor Ellsworth strikes out swinging for the first out.
T7: OU gets the leadoff runner on but can't get the insurance run. Texas has one last chance to prevent an 8th straight defeat to its rival.
Nothing doing in the bottom half of the sixth for Texas. New Longhorn pitcher in the circle is Brooke Bolinger.
After 5 1/2 innings, OU leads 3-2 in the #RedRiverShowdown . Top of the order coming up for the Horns.
T6: Knighten smacks a liner into CF, scoring the go-ahead run. But Wong makes a perfect throw to the plate to nail the runner from 2nd.
T6: Tough spot for UT here. Sooners have runners on 2nd and 3rd, one out and Shay Knighten steppin to the plate. She homered in previous AB.
It's still 2-2 after five innings. Both pitchers are settling in after a couple rough innings. OU's 2-3-4 coming to the plate in T6.
I just saw a 2-year-old girl twerking to Rihanna's Work," and it's not anything I want to see again."
T5: Wright makes quick work of the Sooners. She's retired 12 of the previous 13 OU hitters, the lone hit coming on Knighten's HR.
B4: OU's Paige Parker retires the side, including two strikeouts. This game is still knotted at 2 as we head to the fifth.
T4: Wright recovers nicely to retire the side, but not before Knighten's second home run of the year ties the game at two.
T4: The Sooners have tied the game with a solo shot from Shay Knighten that plunks the left-field foul pole.
Alcozer strikes out to end the inning. Horns now lead 2-1 after three innings.
Looks like Hathaway is done. Bekah Alcozer will hit in her place with a runner on third and two outs.
B3: Now the Longhorns lead! The pitch gets away from the catcher and Kelli Hanzel scampers in from third. 2-1 Horns and still threatening.
B3: And we're tied! With runners on first and second, Dylan Tunning hits a sharp grounder past the second baseman, scoring DerMargosian.
B3: RF Tuesday DerMargosian slaps a single over the third baseman's head for the first Longhorn hit of the day.
Slack and Hathaway charged after a shallow popup to right-center; Slack made the catch but didn't hear Hathaway calling her off.
T3: Wright retires the side, but CF Reagan Hathaway is down after colliding with 2B Kaitlyn Slack. Hathaway is helped off the field.
B2: After Ellsworth's 13-pitch flyout, OU's Paige Parker needs just eight more pitches to escape unscathed. 1-0 OU after two.
UT's Taylor Ellsworth, on the 13th pitch of the at-bat, flies out to the right-field fence to start bottom 2. Valiant effort.
T2: Now the Sooners go three up, three down. Dylan Tunning made a smooth play at shortstop to recover a bobble and get the third out.
Special shoutout to the UT fan yelling nice pitch! after every pitch, and then disagreeing with the umpire when he calls a ball."
Also, it's still very strange to me to call it Showdown and not Shootout. Some things should never change.
B1: Longhorns go three up, three down. After one inning, the Sooners lead #RedRiverShowdown 1-0.
T1: OU takes a 1-0 lead on Fale Aviu's hard-hit grounder to right field. Sooners had three hits but leave two runners in scoring position.
Amid chants of Boomer Sooner, Erica Wright delivers a first-pitch strike and we're underway at McCombs Field.
Taking the circle for UT is Erica Wright, who is 4-3 w/a 2.10 ERA in 56.2 IP. Her contemporary? OU's Paige Parker (12-5, 1.74 ERA, 104.2 IP)

Final: The Woodlands 36, Allen 28. The Highlanders will play for the 6A title next week! @statesman #txhsfbplayoffs
The Woodlands recovers the onside and two kneeldowns should do it!
0:51 4th - Jonke throws a 2-yd TD pass and gets the conversion, but Allen still trails 36-28. Big onside kick coming... #txhsfbplayoffs
Today's announced attendance: 7,704. Not bad for teams from Houston and Dallas areas.
3:02 4th - The FG is good for a 36-20 Highlanders lead. #txhsfbplayoffs
Allen calls its last timeout with 3:07 left. The Woodlands is lining up for a 30-yd FG and what should be the final dagger.
This got the biggest Highlanders cheer of the game. It's starting to sink in that they are headed to the 'ship," as the kids say."
Allen goes for fourth down deep in its own territory but the pass is batted down. That will probably do it. #txhsfbplayoffs
A magnificent punt from The Woodlands' punter is downed at the 1. Allen will need to go 99 yards in a hurry, down 13 with 5:22 left.
Allen attempts the onside kick, but it rolls out of bounds before anyone can get to it. The Woodlands will start from its own 45.
7:03 4th - Might be too little, too late for Allen, but Jonke runs in from 2 yards to cut the lead to 33-20. #txhsfbplayoffs
Allen runs the QB sneak on 4th and 1 and will pick up the first down to keep the drive alive. First and goal now with 7 minutes to play.
9:46 4th - Schmid fakes the handoff and finds Grant Murphy open in the flat for the TD! It's now 33-13 Highlanders. #txhsfbplayoffs
Kesean Carter goes up for the jump ball and catches it at the 10-yard line! First and goal for the Highlanders.
Schmid is over 350 passing yards as The Woodlands moves into Allen territory.
We've finished 3 quarters at DKR, with The Woodlands leading 26-13. Highlanders are 12 minutes from the state title game. #txhsfbplayoffs
The Woodlands gets a big stop on 3rd down, and now it's Allen's turn to punt again. Highlanders will start at their own 21.
He's able to walk off under his own power, so it looks like he will be ok.
There's an Allen receiver down on the field. The pass was well overthrown, and he took a shot from one of the safeties anyway. No flag.
Allen's defense has really stepped up after halftime. The Woodlands will punt for the third time this quarter.
3:10 3rd - Another FG for Allen, this one from 37 yards. The Eagles have scored the last 10 points to pull within 26-13. #txhsfbplayoffs
Nearly intercepted! Jonke lofts a pass into the end zone, overthrowing his receiver and (just barely) the defensive back.
The Eagles are starting to find a groove, picking up three first downs through the air.
The Woodlands picked up a first down, but will get nothing more on this drive. Allen's offense will start this drive from its own 27.
7:19 3rd - Allen isn't going down without a fight. A 30-yd TD pass from QB Mitchell Jonke cuts The Woodlands' lead to 26-10. #txhsfbplayoffs
Allen dials up its own pressure on 3rd down, hitting Schmid with a big blindside sack. The Woodlands punts for the first time today.
Highlanders bring the blitz on 3rd and 10 from midfield and it pays off. An incomplete pass brings out Allen's punt team.
10:33 3rd - Schmid finds Kesean Carter behind the safeties for a 72-yd TD! The Woodlands now leads 26-3 after a blocked PAT. #txhsfbplayoffs
Allen's kickoff to start the second half sails into the end zone. The Woodlands will start the drive at its own 25.
Allen has a lot of work to do in the 2nd half before we reach this point. The Woodlands' defense has been dominant so far. #txhsfbplayoffs https:// twitter.com/derekraydj/sta tus/807681539114934272 …
I know it's been 14 years, but I'm with @tyschnautz on this one: #BeatNavy

The Woodlands' Eric Schmid was 13/19 for 187 yards, with 68 of those coming on the TD strike to Dylan Casey. Schmid also had 38 rush yards.
HT stats: The Woodlands had 299 yds in the half, while limiting Allen to just 124. Allen struggled on the ground (66 yds on 19 carries).
Halftime at DKR: A 24-yard FG just before the half gives The Woodlands a 20-3 lead over Allen in the 6A-1 semifinal. #txhsfbplayoffs
It's a reverse! The runner is shoved out at the 7 though, so the FG team will make its way onto the field.
The Woodlands has executed this two-minute drive very well. It's 3rd and goal from the 11 w/23 seconds in the half. What will they draw up?
The Woodlands starts this drive at its own 37, with 2:10 left in the half.
Allen follows the TD with another three-and-out. Chants of over-rated!" coming from the Highlanders student section."
3:17 2nd - Whoa! A huge 68-yard TD pass puts The Woodlands up 17-3! #txhsfbplayoffs
4:35 2nd - The third-down pass is batted away and Allen settles for a 27-yard FG. The Woodlands still leads 10-3 #txhsfbplayoffs
Allen moves the ball quickly, and it will be first and goal from the 7 with about 5 minutes before halftime.
The Woodlands gains 16 yards on 3rd and 17, but the 4th down run looks short! Chain gang comes into the field... call confirmed, Allen ball!
Allen goes three-and-out following the FG. The Woodlands has the ball back at its own 42.
The 39-yard FG is good, pushing the Highlanders lead to 10-0. #txhsfbplayoffs
End of the opening quarter, with The Woodlands up 7-0 and facing 4th and 8 from the Allen 22. #txhsfbplayoffs
Quarterback Eric Schmid, son of TW coach Mark, scrambles to pick up a first down at midfield. Highlanders are driving as the 1st winds down.
The Woodlands with an interception and their sideline is ecstatic! Highlanders take over near their own 30. #txhsfbplayoffs
Though according to a couple kids on The Woodlands sideline, it's over, it's already over!""
4:26 1st - The Woodlands takes a 7-0 lead on a short Carlos Ramos run. Lots of game left to be played. #txhsfbplayoffs
Allen's drive stalls at the 15, and the FG attempt is no good! Not sure if it was blocked or poorly kicked, but it landed in the end zone.
Allen starts on offense. A pair of first downs has already moved the Eagles past midfield.
DKR with a not-so-subtle reminder of who won Bedlam... pic.twitter.com/P9HmzK1t4H
Can Allen extend its dynasty and play for a 5th championship in 8 years? Or will The Woodlands advance to its first title game since 2003?
Kickoff is about 5 minutes away, with a bid to the title game at AT&T Stadium next week on the line.

Final: @GoFaithLions 30, @RSA_Athletics 29. Knights decided to win instead of go to 3OT, and it backfires. #txhsfbplayoffs
Regents runs the swinging gate, but Franklin's pass is just beyond Hine's fingers. Grapevine wins its first TAPPS title. #txhsfbplayoffs
And now Regents coach Beck Brydon calls a timeout. Icing his own kicker? So much pressure on this PAT.
Regents scores! Allen punches in from two yards. PAT pending... and Grapevine burns a TO to ice the kicker. #txhsfbplayoffs
And right on cue, the rain starts coming down again. Regents needs seven points to keep the dream season alive.
Wyatt finds the end zone for the first time tonight, and now Grapevine leads 30-23. #txhsfbplayoffs
Steele takes the sweep pitch for 16 and Grapevine has 1st and goal.
The Grapevine offense will stay on the field to start the second OT period.
TOUCHDOWN GRAPEVINE! My goodness! Hogan redeems himself with a 32-yard pass to keep the Lions' season alive! On to double OT #txhsfbplayoffs
Regents brings the pressure and Hogan is sacked! 4th and 17, this is the game! #txhsfbplayoffs
Hogan pump-fakes and has a man in the end zone, but it's dropped! 3rd and 10 for Grapevine, and they call TO to draw up a play.
Touchdown Regents! Franklin finds Hine for 34, he fumbles before the goal line, but it's recovered by TE Cooper Christian! Regents 23-16!
College overtime rules apply: each team will get a possession from the 25. Regents holds on its first play, backing up to the 35.
Grapevine wins the OT toss and will start on defense. All the pressure is on Regents now. #txhsfbplayoffs
So instead of a game-winning 39-yard FG attempt for a state title, we are going to overtime.
How about some bonus football? We are heading to overtime to decide the TAPPS DII state championship! #txhsfbplayoffs
Wow. 4th and 1 with the clock bleeding down, and Regents decides to snap the ball. Allen is stuffed in the backfield.
Regents calls a TO. So here's what we've got: Regents ball at the Grapevine 26. 3rd and 6. 43 seconds to play. #txhsfbplayoffs
Another huge 3rd down as the clock runs under a minute. Regents playing for the FG?
John Nelson picks up 14 on a rush, moving to the Grapevine 30 with two minutes to play! #txhsfbplayoffs
Allen picks up 3 on 3rd and 3 to keep the drive alive!
This game is nuts. Grapevine looked to be about to score, but Steele fumbled at the 8-yard line! Can Regents get the winner with 5 min left?
4th and 4 from the Regents 21, and Grapevine chooses to go for it instead of try the FG. Hogan skies the pass; TOD.
Keyshawn Wyatt is back in the game for the Lions.
Interception!! Regents' Danny Phillips picks off the freshman Grapevine QB at the 2 yard line. And then Conner Allen throws a pick! Wow!
End of the 3rd quarter: Regents 16, Grapevine Faith 16. Everything to play for in these last 12 minutes. #txhsfbplayoffs
Steele is having himself a day with Wyatt out. He busts a 71-yard run to move Grapevine Faith into the red zone.
The snap is bobbled, and Regents winds up throwing an interception on the busted play.
Regents is lining up for the 41-yard FG attempt...
Franklin takes a sack on 3rd and 10 at the 17, and Regents calls timeout. 4th and 17 from the 24 - attempt the long FG? Or go for it?
Allen takes a snap at wildcat (which worked well last drive) and Franklin is back in on the next play.
Franklin keeps it on first down, picking up 9 yards. He takes a big hit though, and will need to be helped off the field.
Onside kick! Regents recovers!
4:33 3rd - We're tied again! Regents marches down field, scoring on a 19-yard pass from Franklin to Hine. 16-all. #txhsfbplayoffs
6:54 - On 4th and 2 from the 30, Steele breaks through the line and all the way to paydirt! Regents trailing for first time tonight, 16-9.
On 3rd and 5th, Steele picks up 7 yards on a pitch to get the first down. Grapevine has the ball at the Regents 38.
Preston Steele is the running back for Grapevine. Wyatt is trying to walk off his injury on the sideline, looks like it might be an ankle.
Wyatt stays down after a tough tackle, but after a few minutes he hobbles off under his own power.
Wyatt with a nice return to open the second half. Grapevine Faith starts this drive from its 32.
So at halftime, this state championship game is tied at 9. #txhsfbplayoffs
The penalty backed the ball up to the 17, and Grapevine misses a 34-yard FG attempt to end the first half.
Wyatt finally breaks one, sprinting 62 yards to the end zone with just 5 second left in the half! But there's a block in the back at the 7!
Franklin punts 48 yards (yes, he punts too) and Grapevine takes over at its own 41.
Franklin gains six yards, which won't get the 1st but does give the punter more room. Grapevine calls its second TO, 1:55 left in the half.
The Knights will call a TO, facing third and 9 from their own 5. If they punt, Grapevine will have two TOs and about two minutes to score.
Grapevine's third punt tonight rolls all the way down to the Regents 4. About three and a half minutes to halftime.
Russell Hine with a huge sack! Grapevine now has 3rd and 16 back at midfield.
Grapevine throws incomplete on 3rd down, but gets bailed out by a roughing the passer call to move the ball past midfield.
Regents defense really stepping up, not letting Wyatt get any downhill momentum.
Wyatt with his 10th carry tonight to start the Grapevine drive. He's got 18 yards total, with no run longer than five yards.
7:27 2nd - Zach Robert kicks a 26-yard field goal to tie this game at 9. #txhsfbplayoffs
Fisher jumps above the DB to catch the ball in the end zone, but the ref says he landed out of bounds! Regents calls timeout; going for it?
An incomplete pass and a five-yard loss puts Regents with 3rd and goal at the 10.
Franklin with a big spin move to get the ball down to the 4! This is Conner Allen territory...
Regents has been building a good drive, picking up first downs from Russell Hine and Conner Allen runs.
End of the 1st: Grapevine scores on a 9-yd TD pass to end the quarter, taking a 9-6 lead. #txhsfbplayoffs
Lions just committed their fifth penalty of the quarter. Already have 45 penalty yards,
Grapevine is in the end zone, but a holding penalty brings it back to the Regents 25.
Franklin throws another interception, setting up the Lions with great field position at the Regents 35.
Two false starts kills the Grapevine drive, and the Lions will punt for the second time tonight Regents starts from its own 30.
It was one of those no way he returns that... wait... he's gonna do it!" plays."
Craziest play I've seen in a while. Ball bounced into end zone, was lateraled once, and Regents missed about 5 tackles to give up 2 points.
3:51 1st - Conner Allen punches it in for a score! But whoa! The PAT is blocked, and Grapevine returns it 109 yards! Regents leads 6-2 now.
Franklin pump-fakes on third down and hits Will Fisher, who's down at the 1!
Franklin with a big run to pick up the first! He was so hyped he tried to hurdle a Grapevine defender!
Wyatt gets blown up in the backfield! Now it's Regents' turn to take over at midfield.
It's a steady diet of Wyatt carries. He picks up 9 yards on the first 3 carries, and Grapevine will go for it on 4th and 1.
A Grapevine DB jumps the route and picks off Franklin, his third INT in two games. Lions take over near midfield, halfway through the 1st.
Wyatt loses two yards on his first two carries, and Grapevine punts it back to Regents.
QB Jace Franklin finds Zach Robert on a 34-yard catch to move past midfield, but the Knights turn the ball over on downs.
The kickoff sails into the end zone, so the Knights will start at the 25.
Grapevine wins the toss and elects to defer. Regents will receive to get this state championship underway! #txhsfbplayoffs
Grapevine's player to watch is senior RB Keyshawn Wyatt, who has 2,768 yards and 38 TDs on 260 carries. Cold, windy weather could favor him.
Regents has beaten opponents by an average of 34.5 ppg this season. Knights have beaten their three playoff opponents by a combined 132-35.
Small crowds on both sides minutes before kickoff. Regents fans drove 100 miles north, while Grapevine Faith had a 120-mile drive south.

3:28 4th - Blake Phipps nails his second FG today, this one from 29 yards. Dripping Springs leads 69-35. #txhsfbplayoffs
9:17 4th - A lengthy return sets up another Hernandez to Guerrero TD, cutting the lead to 66-35. Patriots refusing to quit. #txhsfbplayoffs
9:42 4th - Zach Murray gets in on the action, scoring from four yards out to extend Dripping Springs' lead to 66-27. #txhsfbplayoffs
End of the third: Dripping Springs 59, Veterans Memorial 27. Patriots won that quarter 14-3, so at least that's something. #txhsfbplayoffs
0:48 3rd - Hernandez finds Guerrero again, first on a 13-yd TD and then on the 2pt conversion, to pull Veterans Memorial within 59-27.
Patriots recover the onside kick, but illegal formation forces a rekick. They get the next one though!
3:42 3rd - Dripping Springs fumbles the ball, and a play later Hernandez finds Guerrero for six. Tigers lead 59-19 after 2pt is incomplete.
Veterans Memorial goes for it on 4th and 1 at the Tigers' 28, but the QB fumbles. It's recovered by the offense but not enough for the 1st.
7:05 3rd - Blake Phipps makes a 20-yard FG to extend the Dripping Springs lead to 59-13. #txhsfbplayoffs
And per UIL, we will have no running clock here today. Not sure what good that does for the kids.
Looks like all second-stringers for Dripping Springs.
Veterans Memorial attempts an onside kick to start the second half, but it's recovered by Dripping Springs' Curtis Raymond.
Dripping Springs RB Teo Brinckmann had 90 yards and 2 TDs on just seven carries. Jake Cox added 64 yards and 2 TDs on five carries.
Westlake-Lake Travis next week should be fantastic. It's a shame they have to meet so early in the playoffs.
Dripping Springs QB Reese Johnson at the half: 7/9 for 211 yards and 3 TDs. Backup QB Collin Berzsenyi was 5/6 for 78 yards and a TD.
Total yards: Dripping Springs 474, Veterans Memorial 165. Patriots held to -5 rushing yards at the half. #txhsfbplayoffs
Some halftime stats coming your way...
HT at Alamo Stadium: @DSFBTPD 56, @MissionCISD 13. Dripping Springs should be heading for the Region 4 final next week. #txhsfbplayoffs
0:22 2nd - Backup QB Collin Berzsenyi throws a 35-yd TD to push the Tigers' lead to 56-13. #txhsfbplayoffs
5:29 2nd - A great Patriots KO return sets up Hernandez's 5-yard TD run. The 2pt conversion is no good. Tigers lead 49-13. #txhsfbplayoffs
5:51 2nd - Jake Cox powers through a few tackles for a 13-yd TD run, his second today. Dripping Springs leads 49-7. #txhsfbplayoffs
9:17 2nd - Johnson to Raymond for 42 yards gives Dripping Springs a 42-7 lead. #txhsfbplayoffs

you would be correct.
End of the first quarter: Dripping Springs leads 35-7. I think I can go ahead and start writing my game story. #txhsfbplayoffs
No joke, Dripping Springs has brought in the backups. With a minute remaining in the first quarter.
Two incomplete passes and a sack will have Veterans Memorial punting again.
Patriots pulling out all the stops already. A cross-field lateral on the kickoff nets a return past midfield.
3:19 1st - Short answer, yes. Brinckmann runs 42 yards untouched to give Dripping Springs a 35-7 lead. #txhsfbplayoffs
Tigers take over on the VM 42. Can they score again before the end of the quarter?
Patriots are struggling to move the ball against the Dripping Springs defense. They go for it on 4th down but the pass falls incomplete.
4:43 1st - Jake Cox gets in on the scoring, breaking a tackle on a 31-yd TD run. Dripping Springs up 28-7 now. #txhsfbplayoffs
Hey some defense! Veterans Memorial punts for the second time today. Tigers take over from their own 26.
6:41 1st - Fireworks! Johnson finds Hoyle in the end zone for another touchdown, putting Dripping Springs up 21-7. #txhsfbplayoffs
8:36 1st - Here we go. Patriots answer back with a 39-yard TD pass. Tigers still lead 14-7. #txhsfbplayoffs
9:19 1st - Beverly catches the ball in the flat, stiff arms a defender and sprints 79 yards for a TD! Tigers up 14-0 early. #txhsfbplayoffs
A good Patriots punt pins Dripping Springs inside its own 5 to start this drive.
Veterans Memorial goes three and out. Tigers defenders dropped two INTs on that drive. Patriots look shellshocked.
11:25 1st - Running back Teo Brinckmann scampers 19 yards for the early score! Dripping Springs leads 7-0. #txhsfbplayoffs
What a start! Tigers recover the 40-yard pooch kickoff, and two plays later are in the end zone!
Veterans Memorial wins the toss and elects to receive.
Tigers run onto the field to a large ovation from their fans. Kickoff is about seven minutes away.
Here's a first for me: Patriots walk - not run - onto the field. Very calm just minutes from a huge playoff game.
Tigers got a last-second TD last week to stay in the hunt for a state title. Can they keep it going today? https:// twitter.com/varsity_news/s tatus/800136117844512768 …
Decent crowd for the Veterans Memorial Patriots, who had a 250-mile drive to get here. Mission is just minutes from the Mexico border.
Dripping Springs is having its best season ever, setting a program record with 11 wins. A 12th today puts the Tigers in the Regional final.
Dripping Springs is rocking the all-maroon jerseys, while Veterans Memorial has on its Colts-style home whites.
