Regents fans surround the championship-bound Knights as coach Beck Bryson speaks to his players after the 41-22 win. #txhsfbplayoffs pic.twitter.com/44pF567mc6
Final from Matador Stadium: @RSA_Athletics 41, @holycross_sa 22. Regents is going to the state championship! #txhsfbplayoffs @varsity_news
From bad to worse for Holy Cross, who fumbles the kickoff. Regents takes over at the HC 33, just needing to milk the clock.
4:36 4th - Compian throws another INT, which Regents returns to the HC 2. Allen scores his 4th TD a play later to put Regents up 41-22.
Holy Cross has 5 minutes to score 13 points and keep its season alive. Knights start this drive at their own 15.
5:11 4th - Facing 4th down, Franklin finds Allen in the flat, and he scampers 41 yards for the score! Regents lead 35-22! #txhsfbplayoffs
Holy Cross throws an interception! Alex Hartman returns it 24 yards past midfield with under 7 minutes to play.
9:29 4th - Holy Cross's lead is shortlived. Allen with a 9-yd TD run - his third of the night - gives Regents a 28-22 lead. #txhsfbplayoffs
11:39 4th - Jay Nava runs it in from the 1, and Adame runs in the conversion to give Holy Cross a 22-21 lead. #txhsfbplayoffs
End of the 3rd: Regents leads 21-14. Holy Cross has 1st and goal on the 4 when the 4th quarter begins. #txhsfbplayoffs
The Regents defense forces a three and out, but someone was offsides on the punt. Holy Cross is gifted a first down.
4:35 3rd - Regents needs just two plays to answer back! Franklin to Fisher for 15-yd TD. Regents back on top 21-14. #txhsfbplayoffs
5:00 3rd - Touchdown HC! It's Compian to Perez again, this time for a 38-yard score. They hook up again on the 2pt conv. to tie game at 14.
Holy Cross goes for it again on fourth down, and this time the Knights convert to keep the drive alive.
It's three and out for Regents. Holy Cross will start the drive near midfield.
Franklin and Fisher almost hook up again but the pass is just overthrown. Franklin took a shot on that play too, but he bounces right up.
Holy Cross had 4th and 11 from the Regents 30, but the pass skips off the ground incomplete. Regents will look to add to its lead.
The ball is seeing a lot of the ground tonight. Holy Cross spills a handoff but is able to fall on the loose ball.
Franklin fumbles the ball for his third turnover of the game. Looked like his arm was moving forward but the refs give it to Holy Cross.
The stadium goes silent as a Holy Cross defensive lineman is down on the first play of the half. He's able to walk off with assistance.
Both teams are back on the field and we're ready to start the second half. This is the last 24 minutes of the season for one of these teams.
Despite his two interceptions, Franklin is 11/17 for 172 yards at the half. His three big completions to Fisher set up Allen's two TDs.
Neither team has had much success running tonight: Regents has 14 carries for 40 yards and Holy Cross has 21 for 34 yards and two fumbles.
HT at Matador Stadium: @RSA_Athletics 14, @holycross_sa 6. Regents is a half away from playing for its sixth state title. #txhsfbplayoffs
0:34 2nd - Allen punches it in two plays later to give Regents a 14-6 lead just before halftime. #txhsfbplayoffs
Fisher with a huge 62-yard catch and he's shoved out at the 1! He has 107 receiving yards this quarter.
Compian takes a huge 19-yard sack and Holy Cross will punt it back to Regents. About 1:20 left before halftime.
A big second effort gets the first down! But holding will wipe that out. 4th and 11 now and Regents will punt.
Regents facing a big 4th and 1 from its own 46. Looks like the Knights are going for it.
5:12 2nd - A 14-yard pass from Compian to Perez pulls Holy Cross within one. The missed PAT makes it 7-6 Regents. #txhsfbplayoffs
Holy Cross has responded well after the score. Knights have moved the ball to the Regents 14, forcing Regents to call a timeout.
8:16 2nd - Franklin finds Will Fisher on two big completions, and Conner Allen scores from a yard out to give Regents a 7-0 lead.
Not to be outdone, Holy Cross puts it on the ground again for the second fumble of the game. Regents takes over near midfield.
An exciting flurry of turnovers to end the first quarter, but Regents and Holy Cross are still scoreless. #txhsfbplayoffs
And it's another interception! Franklin underthrows a wide open receiver in the end zone for his second INT this quarter. HC at its own 8.
And Holy Cross gives it right back with a fumble! Now Regents is back in control, ball at the HC 34.
Interception! Franklin's pass bounces off a receiver's hands and into the outstretched arms of a Holy Cross defender.
Holy Cross had 4th and 1 from the 7 and elected to go for it, but the running back is stuffed at the line! Regents will take over on downs.
A 33-yard pass from the Holy Cross QB moves the Knights into the red zone for the first time tonight.
Regents goes for it on 4th and 5 from the 34, but the sweep play is stopped in the backfield. Holy Cross takes over.
Regents has picked up a couple first downs on the ground to move into Holy Cross territory.
Holy Cross starts three and out as the Knights line up to punt.
Holy Cross will receive to start the game. We're just a few minutes away from kickoff at Matador Stadium. #txhsfbplayoffs
Regents averages 44.8 points per game, and has won its two playoff games by a combined 91-13. Defense is allowing just 9 ppg this season.
Holy Cross (11-1) looks to avenge its only loss this season, a 31-20 defeat against Regents on Oct. 15. It's Regents' closest game all year.
Regents (12-0) is having its best season since going 14-1 en route to a state championship in 2010. Knights have won 5 titles (3 at 6-man).
This one should be exciting, and not just because both teams are nicknamed the Knights. The winner plays for a title next week in Waco.
My view in Seguin tonight for a TAPPS DII state semifinal between @RSA_Athletics and @holycross_sa . #txhsfbplayoffs #pressboxviews pic.twitter.com/QkVUQRP9pf

Final from Gregory Gym: @TexasVolleyball beats @KStateVB 25-10, 25-15, 20-25, 25-17. Horns host WVU next Saturday. #hookem
The serve is into the net and that's the match! Longhorns win! #hookem
KState has rallied to 24-17...
Chloe Collins serving for the match... and the Wildcats survive one more point. 24-15 now. #hookem
Victory feels imminent. The Horns lead is 20-12 in the fourth. #hookem
and that's why I love you.
Timeout on the court, with UT up 14-9. I don't wanna jinx it but it feels like the Longhorns are starting to pull away. #hookem
Coming out of a timeout, UT leads 10-7 in the fourth set. #hookem
Because a sweep would have been too easy to write about, KState takes the third set 25-20. #hookem
Now it's Texas' time to call a timeout. The Longhorns trail 20-16, their biggest deficit of the night. #hookem
Texas earns another point and the Wildcats call timeout. The crowd here at Gregory is eager to see another sweep. #hookem
Texas has a call overturned to win a point, but still trails KSU 16-13 here in the third set. #hookem
This third set is a bit more competitive. KState holds a 10-9 lead. #hookem
Texas takes the second set, 25-15. Horns are playing with some urgency tonight. #hookem
The Wildcats just look listless. They call another time out, down 17-8 in the second set. #hookem
Texas off to another strong start in the second set. KState calls timeout trailing 7-2. #hookem
First set goes to Texas, 25-10. Horns looking like following up a midweek sweep of Tech with another sweep tonight. #hookem
The Longhorns have stretched their lead to 20-10 in the first set. Everything coming easy for Texas so far. #hookem
Kansas State calls a timeout, trailing 11-5. #hookem
At least one Texas team is off to a strong start today. @TexasVolleyball up 8-4 early in the first set. #hookem
Crowd is still filing in as we are just a few minutes from first serve.
I was about to ask why you weren't here yet haha
With a win, Jerritt Elliott would notch his 400th career victory at UT. He's in his 16th season in charge of the Longhorns. #hookem
No. 7 Texas needs a win tonight to remain a game behind Kansas in the Big 12 standings. Regular season ends next Saturday. #hookem
Longhorns lead the all-time series 36-7, winning the past 26 meetings. KState hasn't beat UT since 2003, and not in Austin since 2001.
Who wants to forget that football game? I'm at Gregory Gym tonight for a Big 12 tilt between @TexasVolleyball and @KStateVB . 7 pm, LHN.

Final from Bulldog Stadium: @bbpbisd 33, @ThrallSecondary 16. Tigers end the season 10-2, their best record since 2006. #txhsfbplayoffs
Thrall tries the onside but it's easily recovered by Ben Bolt. This should be victory formation.
0:44 4th - Small consolation for Thrall as Salazar finds Joe Sandifer for a 7-yard TD. Ben Bolt still leads 33-16. #txhsfbplayoffs
Some Thrall fans are making their way to the exits. That will be a long two-hour drive home.
2:04 4th - Adams with the dagger. His 4th rushing TD tonight goes for 7 yards and gives Ben Bolt a 33-9 lead. #txhsfbplayoffs
Tigers are 0-5 on 4th down tonight. That's not going to win you many ballgames.
Thrall goes for it on 4th and short, and again the Tigers come up empty. Ben Bolt takes over with 5:21 left. #txhsfbplayoffs
Thrall gets the ball back with just under 7 minutes left, still trailing 26-9. #txhsfbplayoffs
That's another turnover on downs for Thrall, the fourth one tonight. Ben Bolt takes over at its own 24 with 8 minutes left. #txhsfbplayoffs
Thrall's red zone woes continue. Consecutive holding penalties make it 1st and 30 at the Ben Bolt 33.
End of the third quarter: Ben Bolt leads Thrall 26-9. #txhsfbplayoffs
0:36 3rd - Adams takes the pitch and throws to the end zone for a TD! This kid is doing it all tonight. Ben Bolt leads 26-9 (missed PAT).
Thrall goes for it on 4th down inside its own 20 and the pass is incomplete. Looked like offsides but the refs don't call it.
Fumble! Thrall's Hunter Dill picks up the loose ball at his own 10. That's a big break for the defense.
3:42 3rd - On 4th and 5 from the Ben Bolt 6, Salazar throws a fade to Richard Reed for a TD! Thrall now trails 20-9. #txhsfbplayoffs
Thrall is back in the red zone for the fourth time tonight. Let's see if the Tigers can put some points on the board.
8:22 3rd - Adams scores his third TD, this one from 6 yards. The PAT is wide left, so Ben Bolt leads 20-2. #txhsfbplayoffs
Adams is now over 150 rushing yards and we are three minutes into the third quarter.
Ben Bolt fakes a punt inside its own 15 and picks up the first down! Adams then busts a 30-yard run to move the ball across midfield.
Dylan Ging* is on the sideline with his jersey off. His night as done as well. He's the second player Thrall has lost tonight.
Pep talks have been given and both teams are back on the field. Thrall will kick off to start the second half.
Tonight's winner will face Refugio next week (barring a miraculous Junction comeback). #txhsfbplayoffs https:// twitter.com/mikeforman21/s tatus/799795877636345856 …
Thrall's band is giving us their best rendition of Katy Perry's Firework for our halftime entertainment. Haven't heard this one in a while.
HT at Bulldog Stadium: @bbpbisd 14, @ThrallSecondary 2. Adams' 2 rush TDs are the difference in an otherwise defensive game. #txhsfbplayoffs
They indeed go for 2, but the pass is dropped. Ben Bolt leads 14-2 with 30 seconds left in the first half. #txhsfbplayoffs
Brandon Adams scores his second TD tonight, this time from 5 yards. Looks like the Badgers will go for 2, but they call TO to discuss it.
Jarosek is on crutches with his knee wrapped in ice. Looks like his night may be done.
Adams picks up 35 yards on a screen, and then gains 19 on the ground on the next play. Timeout Thrall, 39 seconds left, ball at the 5.
Ben Bolt has the ball at its own 41 with a minute to play here in the first half.
Refs aren't making friends with the Thrall crowd. There was no penalty on the blindside, and they just waived off another flag on Ben Bolt.
Another player down for Thrall, looks to be Dylan Going. He was blindsided chasing down a punt, but he walks off under his own power.
Tigers RB Matthew Jarosek is slow to get up after taking a hard hit to the left knee. Trainers are looking at him on the sideline.
3:35 2nd - The Badgers score our first TD tonight, courtesy of RB Brandon Adams. They get the conversion and lead 8-2. #txhsfbplayoffs
Thrall goes for it on 4th and 8 from the Ben Bolt 12, but again the Tigers turn it over on downs. Second time in the red zone now.
Ben Bolt turns it over again! Bradley Cantrell picks off the QB inside the red zone. Defense is the name of the game so far tonight.
At the end of the first quarter, Thrall leads 2-0. Not the shootout I was expecting. #txhsfbplayoffs
Thrall gives it back a few plays later when QB Nick Salazar throws an interception.
The Ben Bolt center snaps the ball over the QB's head and Thrall recovers! The Badgers QB never had a chance on that one.
7:18 1st - Two plays later, the Ben Bolt QB is sacked in the end zone for a safety! Thrall takes a 2-0 lead. #txhsfbplayoffs
Thrall drives down inside the Badgers' 5, but is stopped on fourth down.
Ben Bolt won the toss and deferred to the second half. Thrall will receive to get this second-round playoff game underway. #txhsfbplayoffs
Good crowd on hand tonight for how far these fans had to come. Thrall is about 100 miles from here; Ben Bolt fans drove closer to 160 miles.
The Badgers, District 16-2A champions, come into tonight averaging 43.7 ppg while allowing 17. Thrall is averaging 38.5/18.5.
Ben Bolt (8-3) will provide a stiff test tonight. The Badgers have won six straight, beating Weimer 49-36 in their opening playoff game.
The Thrall Tigers (10-1) are on a four-game winning streak. Last week they had more than 600 yards of offense in a 61-28 win against Harper.
Fun fact: this is my first time in Seguin. Not fun fact: this cold, windy weather reminds me that winter is coming.
I'm in Seguin tonight for an area-round playoff game between @ThrallSecondary and @bbpbisd at @txlutheran 's Bulldog Stadium. #txhsfbplayoffs

Here's the Hail Mary pass that kept Connally's season alive last night. @statesman #txhsfbplayoffs https:// twitter.com/emilyyy016/sta tus/797320072943599620 …
Trailing by 5 with just seconds left and the season on the line, Robert Patterson threw a pass from midfield and into @ConnallyFB lore: https:// twitter.com/varsity_news/s tatus/797471028838563840 …
My recap from Connally's thrilling bi-district win against Magnolia West tonight: https:// twitter.com/varsity_news/s tatus/797348156543565824 …
Coach Cecil confirmed it was Cameron Stewart, a linebacker with outstanding hops, who snagged that game-winning TD.
Folks it doesn't get much better than that. At least for the home team. Big congrats to @ConnallyFB for the best game I've seen all year.
that you did. That's the best finish I've seen all year.
The party is on in Pflugerville! @ConnallyFB moves on to next week. #txhsfbplayoffs pic.twitter.com/pyiqiGeq8Q
Final from Connally Stadium: @ConnallyFB 34, @MagWestFootball 33. Cougars advance to area round for first time since 2012. #txhsfbplayoffs
And that's the ballgame! The home crowd is elated, the visitors just stunned. My goodness!
PAT is blocked, so it's Connally 34, Magnolia West 33 with just three seconds left. Not sure who caught the TD, it was in the far corner.
HAIL MARY TOUCHDOWN!! Connally takes the lead with three seconds left!!
A false start and a sack pushes Connally to the Mustang 46. Just 12 seconds left...
Five wide for Patterson, and he finds Martin for 24 yards! First down Connally!
Connally breaks out a double reverse flea flicker (what a time for that!) but it's incomplete. Fourth and 10 upcoming...
Two quick incompletions brings up 3rd and 10 for Connally.
A strong return to the Connally 37. Cougars have 77 seconds to drive 67 yards. Here we go...
The field goal is good, so Connally will get the ball back with no timeouts, trailing 33-28. This drive decides the season. #txhsfbplayoffs
Mustangs play it safe, keeping the ball on the ground. They don't get the first, but they do force Connally to use its last timeout.
There's the second timeout of the half for Connally. Magnolia West is facing 3rd and 5 from the Cougars 10. Huge play coming...
Mustangs take over at the Connally 15 with just over two minutes left. Connally has two timeouts remaining, down by 2.
That's Connor Phillips on the recovery, who has to be helped off the field. Looks like his right ankle.
The punt is almost blocked... and then it's muffed! The Connally returner can't get to it in time and it slips through his fingers!
It's inches short! From their own 32, what will Magnolia West do?
McGrew is stuffed at the line! Officials bringing out the chains to measure this...
Cougars call a timeout with 2:53 left. Mustangs are facing 3rd and a long 1.
3:57 4th - Do we have a game or what?! Patterson scrambles out of the pocket and finds Walton for a 23-yd TD! Cougars still trail 30-28.
Huge interception for Connally! Dereon Kizzee takes it 64 yards into Mustang territory!
Connally comes out throwing, but Patterson underthrows a receiver and it's picked off. Pressure shifts to the defense to get a stop.
9:00 4th - Connally finally gets a third down stop, but the Mustangs make a 27-yard FG to push their lead to 30-21. #txhsfbplayoffs
End of the third: Magnolia West still leads Connally 27-21. Huge 12 minutes coming up for both teams. #txhsfbplayoffs
Connally goes for a 4th and 1 at the Mustang 11, but Patterson is stuffed at the line! Magnolia West takes over on downs.
Magnolia West's punter muffs the snap and haces to dive on it, giving Connally the ball at the MWHS 31. Great chance to retake the lead.
9:04 3rd - It's the Trey McGrew show, as the senior scores his third rush TD of the night to put the Mustangs on top 27-21. #txhsfbplayoffs
The second half is underway as Magnolia West starts from its own 41, trailing by a point.
Customary halftime shot from on top of the press box (seriously). #txhsfbplayoffs pic.twitter.com/8VRnZQCMzz
Cougars RB Ryan Walton had 107 yards on 5 carries in the second quarter. The senior isn't ready for his high school career to end tonight.
It was a tale of two quarters for the Cougars, who had 46 total yards in the first before breaking out for 200 in the second.
Magnolia West takes a knee to take us to halftime at Connally Stadium. The hosts lead 21-20 after a thrilling first half. #txhsfbplayoffs
0:20 2nd - Cougars QB Robert Patterson finds Kordell Mathis wide open for a 45-yd TD! Connally back on top 21-20 just before halftime.
1:08 2nd - Not to be outdone, Mustangs RB Trey McGrew breaks a 30-yard TD to put Magnolia West back on top, 20-14. #txhsfbplayoffs
3:07 2nd - Connally takes the lead! RB Ryan Walton breaks a tackle at the line and scampers 60 yards for the score! 14-13 Cougars now.
10:16 2nd - Connally is on the board! After recovering a muffed punt, Cougars run 60 yards in four plays, cutting the deficit to 13-7.
End of the 1st at Connally Stadium, with the hosts trailing Magnolia West 13-0. #txhsfbplayoffs
3:23 1st - Magnolia West scores again. RB Trey McGrew punches in from a yard out. PAT is blocked, so it's 13-0 Mustangs. #txhsfbplayoffs
10:35 1st - On 4th down, Magnolia West blocks a punt and scoops it up for a score! Perfect start for the Mustangs. #txhsfbplayoffs
The players are on the sidelines, the anthem has been performed, and the coin has been flipped. Playoff football here we go!
On the other hand, the Magnolia West stands are packed. Pretty impressive for the school an hour northwest of Houston.
We're 15 minutes from Pfriday Night Lights in Pflugerville, but there's not a large home crowd right now. #txhsfbplayoffs pic.twitter.com/0dhQY8sYNe
Patterson loves to spread the ball around. Three receivers share the team lead with 5 TDs, led by senior Kordell Mathis (25 rec, 316 yds).
Leading the charge for the Cougars is senior QB Robert Patterson, who has thrown for 1,611 yds and 21 TDs while adding 13 TDs on the ground.
The senior class has overseen a renaissance for the Connally program: the 8 wins this season match the total from the past 3 years combined.
For the Cougars to make history tonight, they have to go through Magnolia West (7-3, 4-3 20-5A), who hasn't missed the playoffs since 2009.
This is the first playoff game for Connally (8-2, 6-2 19-5A) since 2012. The Cougars won their first 7 games before dropping 2 of final 3.
Who's ready for #Txhsfbplayoffs ? I'll have updates from the bi-district game between @magwestmustangs and @ConnallyFB at 7:30 tonight. pic.twitter.com/P54UieiwR3

A recap of all of last night's games, including Austin High's 56-28 win against Travis to claim a 5A playoff berth: http://www. mystatesman.com/news/sports/hi gh-school-football/hendrickson-tops-pflugerville-34-31-keeps-postseas/ns4Qm/?ecmp=statesman_social_twitter_2014_varsitynews_sfp …
Can confirm that the unnamed QB is Evan Dadey, who was brought up from the JV squad for this game. https:// twitter.com/apschnau/statu s/794744172901236736 …
Final from House Park: @goaustinhigh 56, @WBTAthletics 28. Maroons face Dripping Springs in the bi-district round next week. #centexpreps
3:19 4th - That didn't take long. Unnamed QB 25 breaks free for a 26-yard score, pushing Austin High's lead to 56-28. #centexpreps
3:32 4th - Ortiz scores his third TD of the night, this time from a yard out. The 2-point conversion is good. Austin High leads 49-28.
6:26 4th - Maroons backup QB Brandon Ramos finds Kerby Dale for a 10-yard TD. The PAT is blocked, so Austin High leads 49-20. #centexpreps
9:35 4th - Watson turns a sure sack into a 77-yard completion, and a play later Ortiz scores his 2nd 5-yard TD to pull Travis within 43-20.
11:44 4th - Jack Collins hits his second FG of the night, this time from 37 yards, to push Austin High's lead to 43-13. #centexpreps
The 3rd quarter draws to a close (finally), with the Maroons leading 40-13. They start the 4th with a 2nd and 13 from the Travis 20.
Travis goes for it on 4th and 8, but Watson can't pick up the 1st. Austin High takes over at its own 16.
The Austin High band just played a nice rendition of All of the Lights. #respect
Austin High fumbles on the first play of the drive, and Travis will take over just past midfield.

Austin High has brought in the backup QB (who isn't on the roster).

...the FG kicker is halfway to the sideline still. Ball is snapped anyway, and the holder winds up throwing an interception to end the half.
Wild scene to end the half: with no timeouts, Travis attempts to rush the FG team on the field. They get the snap off in time, but...
A big return from Michael Murray sets up the Rebels on the Maroon 28 with just 41 seconds.
0:58 2nd - Austin High needs just 29 seconds to score, this time a 13-yard Muhammad pass to Ben Koch. Maroons up 28-7 now. #centexpreps
Travis can't pick up the first down and will punt. Austin High takes over from the Travis 43 with 87 seconds before half.
Austin High is forced to punt for the first time tonight. Travis will take over inside its own 10 yard line with 2 minutes before halftime.
Of note in 25-5A... as it stands now, Austin High and Reagan would claim the final two playoff spots in the district. https:// twitter.com/FanstandATX/st atus/794714784184856576 …
3:52 2nd - Travis is on the board! DeVonte Ortiz takes the pitch five yards to paydirt. Austin High now leads 21-7. #centexpreps
10:12 2nd - J.J. Jacobs takes an end around 24 yards for another Austin High TD! Maroons push their lead to 21-0. #centexpreps
End of the 1st quarter at House Park, with Austin High leading Travis 14-0. #centexpreps
1:50 1st - The Maroons convert the turnover into 7 more points on a Chris Mateja 11-yard draw. Austin High leads 14-0 now. #centexpreps
Another Travis fumble! Michael Murray coughs it up on the reverse and Austin High recovers! Second fumble lost for the Rebels this quarter.
4:06 1st - Muhammad throws a screen to Jacobs, who turns the corner and scampers 32 yards down the sideline for a TD! Maroons lead 7-0!
Three straight completions for Austin moves the ball into Travis territory.
On the first play, Muhammad goes deep to a wide open J.J. Jacobs but the ball slips through his hands! Would have been a TD for sure.
Fumble! Travis QB Breonn Watson loses his grip as he attempts to throw, and the Maroons recover at their own 30!
And on the ensuing 4th and 19, Maroons QB Khalyl Muhammad is sacked. Travis will take over on downs at its own 29.
On 4th and 14 from the Travis 20, Austin High throws a strike into the end zone! But the TD is negated by an illegal receiver downfield.
Two and a half minutes into the first quarter, Travis burns a timeout to prevent a penalty. A defender was late getting off the field.
A dropped pass on 3rd and long will bring out the Travis punt team. So much for that early statement.
The Rebels have won the toss and want the ball first. Looks like they want to make an early statement.
Austin High has honored its seniors, both teams are on the field and we are just a few minutes away from kicking off this 25-5A matchup.

Travis hasn't won a playoff game since 1992, while Austin High's drought dates back to 1957! Think either team watched the World Series?
Austin High had two weeks to prepare for tonight's game. The Maroons had a bye last week after losing 57-12 to LBJ the week before.
Travis is coming off a 63-0 loss to district champion LBJ last week. The Rebels trailed 35-0 at halftime, and finished with 66 total yards.
Got all that? Don't worry, it took me a while to figure it out too. I'll keep an eye on the Reagan score throughout the night.
But again, the Reagan-McCallum result only matters with a one-point Travis win. The Maroons and Rebels still control their own playoff fate.
A Reagan loss forces a three-way tie for the final two spots. Based on district tiebreaker rules, Austin and Reagan would make the playoffs.
If Reagan (3-6, 3-2) beats McCallum (8-1, 4-1), Travis would earn the fourth spot in 25-5A and Austin High would watch the playoffs at home.
Travis (4-5, 2-3) advances to the playoffs by beating Austin High by two or more points. A one-point Rebels win makes things interesting...
For Austin High (3-6, 3-2) the mission is simple: win and you're in. The Maroons can also qualify with a Reagan loss to McCallum tonight.
There is so much to play for tonight, as both teams can still claim a District 25-5A playoff spot. Let me walk you through the scenarios...

Final from Nelson Field: @SMRattlers 48, @TrojanAnderson 47. San Marcos overcomes a 21-point deficit to remain undefeated in District 14-6A.
Tempers flare as Moreno runs back about 10 yards to take a knee and draws some contact from an Anderson defender.
San Marcos picks up a 1st down with 1:49 left, and Anderson has just one timeout left. Looks like the Rattlers should hang on to this one.
Our first FG attempt is a 31-yarder for Anderson, but it's wide right! Rattlers take over from its own 15 with a 48-47 lead and 4:45 left.
So to recap: San Marcos holds a 48-47 lead with 9:18 to play. I have a feeling we haven't seen the last points tonight.
The third attempt is incomplete (they ran the swinging gate!) and offsetting unsportsmanlike conduct penalties means the try is no good.
About this 2-point conversion... San Marcos gets a 15-yard personal foul on the 1st attempt, but Anderson commits PI on the next attempt.
Whoa! A San Marcos player strips the Anderson kickoff returner, sprinting 31 yards to score! Ratters with their first lead of the night!
San Marcos isn't quitting yet. Johnson's fourth TD of the night cuts the Anderson lead to 47-42 with 9:31 left in the game. #centexpreps
End of the third: the Trojans still lead San Marcos 47-35. #centexpreps
but it's a homecoming tradition!
Fullmer breaks a few tackles at the line and runs in from 26 yards for the score! Anderson leads 47-35 and we haven't finished the 3rd yet.
What a response from San Marcos! The kickoff goes 96 yards to the house, and now it's 40-35 Anderson. This game is keeping me on my toes.
Anderson is back in the end zone 2 plays later on Riley McCarty's 3-yard run! But the 2-point conversion fails. 40-28 AHS, 3:26 left in 3rd.
Anderson forces a punt and gets a great return from James Baran, setting up the Trojans at the San Marcos 31.
Coy Fullmer puts Anderson back on top with a two-yard run! The PAT snap is botched (again), so the Trojans lead 34-28 with 5:35 left in 3rd.
San Marcos capitalizes on the turnover, with Johnson scoring his third rushing TD of the night to tie the game! 28-all, 9:51 left in third.
Tip drill leads to an INT! San Marcos will take over at the Anderson 26 with all of the momentum.
Dean Dixon is slow to get up and will be helped off the field. The Anderson receiver isn't putting any weight on his left foot.
San Marcos kicks off to get the second half underway.
high school football at its finest.
And as great as that is, this second half isn't going to start on time.
Quite the senior night celebration for Anderson, including recognition of some Yellow Jackets alumni. pic.twitter.com/V2IUEoGKJI
His counterpart, San Marcos QB Tyler Moreno, was 11/18 for 115 yards and a rushing touchdown.
Anderson's QB Trey Lundquist was 15-21 for 162 yards and 3 TDs in the first half, though he did throw an interception as well.
Halftime at Nelson Field: @TrojanAnderson 28, @SMRattlers 21. We're in for a good second half. #centexpreps
Jamon Johnson's 16th (!!!) carry of the quarter finds paydirt, cutting Anderson's lead to 28-21 with 35 seconds before half. #centexpreps
Rattlers call their second timeout with 1:13 remaining, ball at the Anderson 44-yard line.
San Marcos takes over from its own 32, with 2:25 to score before halftime.
Anderson has a 4th and 9 from the San Marcos 25 and they are going for it... and it's intercepted!
Jamon Johnson's 11th carry of the quarter finds the end zone for the Rattlers! With 4:45 before halftime, Anderson leads 28-14. #centexpreps
A quick response from Anderson! Lundquist throws his 3rd TD of the night, this one a 10-yarder to Dean Dixon. 28-7 Trojans, 7:05 until half.
San Marcos is on the board. Quarterback Tyler Moreno keeps the read option and races in from 10 yards. 21-7 Anderson, 8:42 before halftime.
On the first play of the second quarter, Lundquist connects with James Baran for a 10-yard TD. Trojans now lead 21-0. #centexpreps
End of the first quarter: Anderson leads San Marcos 14-0. #centexpreps
Anderson finds the end zone again, but it's wiped away by the Trojans' fifth penalty of the quarter.
The double-reverse flea flicker! And it's incomplete. Crowd got really excited for that one.
It goes from bad to worse for San Marcos: Moreno's fumble sets up Anderson at the San Marcos 32.
Anderson scores again, this time a 13-yard pass from Lundquist to Buckman. The two-point conversion is good. Trojans 14-0, 3:51 left in 1st.
On 4th and 2 from Anderson's 39, San Marcos snaps to the up back who gets close to the marker and it's short! Anderson takes over on downs.
Anderson strikes first! Coy Fullmer punches in from three yards, but the ensuing PAT hold is botched. 6-0 Trojans, 7:29 in the first.
Trojans pick up two first downs but are forced to punt... and it's muffed and recovered by Anderson at the San Marcos 2-yard line!
Rattlers pick up a first down on their opening drive but are forced to punt. Anderson takes over from its own 22.
San Marcos has won the coin toss and chosen to receive to start this game.
pic.twitter.com/od8Zdl9i0l
Tunnel runout game is strong tonight. @SMRattlers @TrojanAnderson #centexpreps pic.twitter.com/3mWZxp1mnz
Families are on the field as Anderson's seniors are honored tonight. We're about 20 minutes from kickoff on a pleasantly warm Friday night.
These two schools have split four head-to-head games in the past decade. Most recently, Anderson beat San Marcos 31-6 in 2011.
It will be a tough test for Anderson: San Marcos has won its past four games, outscoring opponents 123-70 over that span.
Anderson can clinch its first playoff berth since 2010 with a win tonight. Trojans travel to Del Valle (1-2) to close season next week.
San Marcos has qualified for the playoffs, but need a win tonight to keep up with Bowie, also 3-0 in the district. Those two meet next week.
That being said, I'm covering tonight's 14-6A matchup between @SMRattlers (5-3, 3-0) and @TrojanAnderson (3-5, 2-1). #centexpreps

An incomplete pass on 4th and 20 will bring out Boerne's punter for the first time tonight, with 11 minutes remaining in the game.
That kickoff return is the only score of the third quarter. Boerne still leads 49-0. #centexpreps
The best drive of the night for Eastside ends on a turnover on downs at the Boerne 22.
Boerne takes the opening kickoff of the second half 71 yards to the end zone to stretch its lead to 49-0.
Both teams are back on the sidelines and we're ready to start the second half.
Eastside ran 22 plays in the half, amassing 20 total yards. But their band has someone playing electric guitar, so there's that.
Halftime at Nelson Field: Boerne leads Eastside Memorial 42-0.
McClure fakes out the defense - and the PA guy - for a 30-yard score. Boerne now up 42-0 with three minutes left before the half.
And with that, we'll have a running clock.
A 42-yard rushing touchdown from Colton Pool pushes Boerne's lead to 35-0 early in the second quarter. #centexpreps
End of the 1st: Boerne leads Eastside Memorial 28-0. #centexpreps
It's now 28-0 as Boerne backup QB Will McClure fakes a handoff and rushes seven yards into the end zone. Two minutes left in the 1st.
Boerne takes a 21-0 lead on a 17-yard pass from Brooks Klutts to Carter Snelling. Still 4:47 left in the first. #centexpreps

Eastside goes three-and-out again, and Boerne's first play from scrimmage is a 51-yard Colton Pool rushing TD. Eastside trails 14-0 early.

The kickoff lands in the end zone and we are underway at Nelson Field. #centexpreps
Eastside wins the toss and defers, but Boerne will kick off anyway.
Players, cheerleaders and band members are being honored now for Eastside's senior night. We're about 15 minutes away from kickoff.
Eastside struggled against Canyon Lake (63-0) and Taylor (61-0) and hasn't won at home this season. They'll look to change that tonight.
Eastside, formerly Johnston High, has just 25 varsity players. For more on the still recovering school: https://www. texasobserver.org/how-austin-eas tside-memorial-high-school-was-saved/ …
The Panthers can't clinch a berth tonight, but will greatly increase their playoff chances before next week's matchup at Fredericksburg.
The Greyhounds can clinch a playoff berth with a win tonight. Their four losses this season have been by a combined 16 points.
Boerne (5-4, 1-2 14-4A) and Eastside Memorial (2-6, 0-2 14-4A) can still qualify for playoffs in this five-team division (top 4 advance).

Final from Bible Stadium: @haysathletics 31, @Leander_Lions 24. @statesman #centexpreps
Pass incomplete and this is the game. Lions need to make the 48 yard line for a first... and Mitchell is sacked! #centexpreps
Down to 36 seconds and Leander is facing 3rd and 16. #centexpreps
Here we go. Lions take over from their own 26. Need to go 74 yards in 64 seconds. #centexpreps
Leander calls its last timeout after getting a stop on 3rd down. Hays about to punt with 1:15 remaining and a 7-point lead. #centexpreps
Mitchell throws his second pick of the game, and Hays takes over near midfield, leading 31-24 with 2:30 remaining. #centexpreps
The wheels are falling off for Leander. Two consecutive offsides penalties move Hays up to the Lion 24. #centexpreps
Cameron Johnson picks off Coltin Mitchell and returns it 20 yards to midfield, and a Leander unsportsmanlike penalty tacks on another 15.
Leander picks up 20 yards on a fake punt to keep the drive alive!
Leander ran 34 (!!!) plays in the 3rd quarter, 30 of them rushing plays. Hays ran just 7 plays. The beauty of the no-huddle offense.
Cade Powell scores his third rushing TD of the night - this one for 25 yards - to give Hays a 31-24 lead. 9:49 left in the 4th. #centexpreps
End of the 3rd: Hays 24, Leander 24. Looking like another exciting finish in this 25-6A matchup. #centexpreps
1:00 3rd - Tied again! Leander keeps the ball on the ground, and Spires runs in on 4th and goal from the 1 for his second TD of the night.
And on the next play, Cade Powell runs into the end zone to put Hays back on top 24-17. 4:49 remaining in the third. #centexpreps
Hays gets a 22-yard reception, and a late hit on the QB moves the ball to the Leander 8. Lions coach very unhappy with the call.
We are tied at 17! Lions run a no-huddle offense and march downfield, capping the drive with a 3-yard Spires TD run. 6:12 left in the 3rd.
Leander and Hays have combined for 50 yards of penalties in the first three minutes of the second half.
Lions were facing 4th and a mile and ready to punt, but an unsportsmanlike conduct penalty on Hays gives Leander a first down. #centexpreps
Leander's Coltin Mitchell starts the second half at QB for the Lions. #centexpreps
Leander QB Rashad Carter has just 43 yards passing but has added 102 on the ground, including the only Lions TD so far. #centexpreps
Hays is outgaining Leander 221-211 at halftime. Tyler Conley has completed just 5 of 17 passes but has 134 passing yards for the Rebels.
Halftime from Leander: @haysathletics 17, @Leander_Lions 10. #centexpreps
Hays nails a 35-yard FG with 10 seconds remaining in the half to push its lead to 17-10. #centexpreps
Hays DB Damion Fiscal picks of Rashad Carter in the red zone! Rebels take over from their own 8, 3:56 before halftime. #centexpreps
Lions open the second quarter with a 42-yard FG to cut the Hays lead to 14-10. #centexpreps
2:08 1st - Hays with another big play! Conley finds Musick open downfield for a 71-yard TD to give the Rebels a 14-7 lead. #centexpreps
Leander tries a 45-yard FG that bounces off the upright. Still tied at 7 with 3:06 left in the first. #centexpreps
Leander's Rashad Carter keeps on the option and sprints 61 yards for the TD! 7-7, 7:47 in the first. #centexpreps
That didn't take long. Cade Powell takes the 4th play of the game 57 yards to the house. 7-0 Hays, 10:10 in the first. #centexpreps

We'll play a fourth set, as Iowa State takes the third 25-22. #HookEm
Iowa State has taken a 24-22 lead and will serve for the third set. #HookEm

The Longhorns have opened a 14-9 lead in the third set. #HookEm

Longhorns on the cusp of a second set victory, leading 23-21. Cyclones have called another timeout. #HookEm
After trailing most of the second set, UT takes a 20-19 lead and ISU will call a timeout. #HookEm
Timeout here at Gregory Gym, where the Cyclones lead the second set 15-11. #HookEm
This second set has been much closer. ISU has an 11-9 lead after losing the first set. #HookEm

That being said, this place still gets louder than a lot of basketball arenas I've been to. Would be cool to see @TexasMBB play a game here.
A good amount of empty seats here tonight as Iowa State jumps out to an early 7-5 lead in the first set. #HookEm
The anthem has been sang, the starting lineups have been introduced, and we are ready for some Big 12 volleyball. #HookEm
. @TexasVolleyball leads the all-time series vs @CycloneVB 38-4, and is undefeated in 22 home matches. #HookEm
Iowa State (8-7, 1-3) lost midweek to No. 6 Kansas in four sets. Cyclones also have conference losses vs. TCU (5 sets) and at K-State (4).
The only other defeat for Texas (12-2, 4-0 Big 12) was an early-season loss to No. 3 Nebraska. Horns beat K-State in five sets a week ago.
Freshman Micaya White won her fifth Big 12 Freshman of the Week award last week, and leads the Longhorns with 230 kills this season. #HookEm
Texas has won four straight since that loss, and hasn't dropped a home conference match since October 2014. #HookEm

Final from Monroe Stadium: @VHSFootball 34, @Leander_Lions 7. Vipers force 5 turnovers to win their homecoming game. @statesman #centexpreps
It only gets worse for Leander. Another snap flies over the punter's head and it's recovered in the endzone for a Viper TD. 34-6, 5:16 left.
Vandegrift forces another turnover! Cole Walther returns the fumble 84 yards for the TD. This is surely over. Vipers lead 27-6, 6:14 left.
Both punters are getting a good workout tonight. End of the third, Vandegrift still leads 20-6. #centexpreps
Leander gets on the board first in the second half, as Kyle Murdock hits his second FG of the night. Vipers lead 20-6, 6:07 left in the 3rd.
We're ready to start the second half here at Monroe Stadium, with Leander kicking off to Vandegrift. Vipers lead 20-3. #centexpreps
The two Leander turnovers led to 14 Vandegrift points. That's been the big difference tonight.
How about some halftime stats? Leander has just 90 yards on 31 plays; Vandegrift has 135 on 27. Very defensive game so far. #centexpreps
The Vipers led 42-3 at halftime in this matchup last year; tonight they lead Leander 20-3 at the half. #centexpreps
Vandegrift only ran 12 offensive plays in the first quarter. Defense making big plays early. #centexpreps
Vandegrift's Aranda returns an INT to the 5, and Isaiah Smallwood punches it in 2 plays later. Vipers now lead 20-0, 1:48 in the 1st.
Vandegrift strikes again. Fernandes to Florence for 20 yards. Vipers lead 13-0. 4:04 left in the 1st. #centexpreps
Lions can't move the ball at all. Their third punt of the night - a 15-yarder - puts the Vipers at the Leander 26. #centexpreps
Leander's Carter can't corral the high snap, and Vandegrift recovers in the end zone for a TD! 7-0 Vipers, 6:23 left in the first.
Vandegrift finds the end zone on 4th down but has it called back for an illegal motion. The ensuing 27-yard FG clanks off the upright.
Vandegrift will kick off to get this District 25-6A game underway. #centexpreps
Already a big crowd here as the Vandegrift band performs. About 20 minutes from kickoff here. #centexpreps pic.twitter.com/FMErb93lns
Lastly, Vandegrift's defense has allowed just 14.5 points per game this season, so the Leander offense will face a hefty challenge tonight.
The Vipers have a trio of receivers with 20+ catches and 200+ yards: juniors Justin Florence and Peyton Ausley and senior Will Bruner.
This season he's completed 78 of 153 attempts for 951 yds and 8 TD to 4 INT. He's also added a rushing TD and a receiving TD for the Vipers.
Of course Westlake and Lake Travis QBs get all the attention, but VHS senior Alex Fernandes is another interesting QB in District 25-6A...
Junior receiver Dalton Flowers is the favorite target for Lions QBs, catching 19 passes for 397 yards and 3 touchdowns so far this year.
Sophomore QB Rashad Carter has also seen action for the Lions this season. His numbers: 17/26, 263 yds, TD, INT; 46 car, 197 yds, 3 TD
Senior QB Kyle Irlbeck leads the Lions tonight, completing 31 of 70 passes for 428 yds and 5 TDs to 4 INTs. He's also added 410 yds rushing.
Both teams are coming off district wins: Leander won 44-28 at home against Vista Ridge, while Vandegrift stomped Lehman 55-0 on the road.
In last year's matchup, the Vipers raced out to a 28-3 first quarter lead, and led 42-3 at the half. VHS is 3-1 all-time versus the Lions.
Vandegrift's four losses - its most since 2012 - have been by a combined 22 points, including a 17-10 home loss to Texas AP No. 5 Westlake.
Vandegrift (2-4, 1-1), which opened in 2010, lost in the 5A quarterfinals last year. Vipers have won a playoff game three years running.
Leander (2-3, 1-0) has lost three straight to VHS, being outscored 140-33 since '12. Lions trying to make playoffs for 1st time since '13.
Leander and Vandegrift both jumped from 25-5A to 25-6A this year, now paired in a district with perennial powers Westlake and Lake Travis.

Final from Hyde Park Field: Hyde Park 49, St. Michael's 48 in overtime. What a comeback from the Panthers! #centexpreps
They'll go for 2... the option pitch for the win! Hyde Park completes the comeback and gets the overtime win!! @statesman #centexpreps
First play for Hyde Park is a 25-yard jet sweep to Gerrie for the touchdown! Panthers looking like they might go for 2... #centexpreps
On 3rd and 10, Vondrak goes 25 yards to Brown to give the Crusaders a 48-41 lead in OT. #centexpreps
St. Michael's starts overtime with the ball. #centexpreps
How about some free football?! We're going to overtime, with St. Michael's and Hyde Park tied at 41. @statesman #centexpreps
Six seconds left, ball at the SMCA 39. Here comes the Hail Mary... #centexpreps
Nearly picked off! Down to 26 seconds left, ball at the SMCA 48. #centexpreps
The situation: Hyde Park ball, its own 35, 46 seconds left, no timeouts. Tied at 41. #centexpreps
Pass incomplete! Hyde Park is gonna get the ball back with a chance to win. #centexpreps
A big sack on second down and the Panthers will stop the clock with 60 seconds left! Crusaders facing 3rd and 17 here. #centexpreps
Crusaders with the ball at the Hyde Park 45 with 74 seconds left. #centexpreps
My goodness, we are tied at 41 at Hyde Park. Panthers have scored 21 points in the past 69 seconds. 3:04 to play. #centexpreps
Hyde Park with the onside kick, and again the Panthers recover it! The crowd is on its feet as Hyde Park takes over from its own 43.
That didn't take long! Bolger completes two passes, the second a 4-yard TD to Cantu. Hyde Park trails 41-34 with 3:39 remaining.
Hyde Park recovers the onside kick! Still need two touchdowns to tie this game though...
Panthers not ready to quit yet. Bolger to Aldridge for a 65-yard TD, cuts the lead to 41-27 SMCA. 4:18 left in the game. #centexpreps
Bolger throws his second pick of the night with 6:55 left in the game, and that is likely the dagger. St. Michael's still leads 41-20.
Bolger with his second turnover of the night, as he throws a pick on 4th and 3. St. Michael's is 9:36 away from its second win of the year.
End of the 3rd with St. Michael's leading Hyde Park 41-20. #centexpreps
Vondrak continues to pick apart the Panthers defense. A 25-yard pass to Brown gives the Crusaders a 41-20 lead with 3:07 left in the 3rd.
Hyde Park answers right back! First play of the drive, Bolger goes 60 yards to Aldridge for the score. 34-20 SMCA, 5:54 left in the 3rd.
St. Michael's takes advantage of a Bolger fumble, as Vondrak runs in from 2 yards (his 4th TD tonight). SMCA 34-13, 6:11 left in the 3rd.
St. Michael's opens the second half with a four-minute drive capped off by a 1-yard Carlton TD. Crusaders now lead 27-13. #centexpreps
Halftime at Hyde Park Field: St. Michael's 20, Hyde Park 13. #centexpreps
DJ Bolger throws his second TD of the night, a 10-yarder to Gerrie to cut St. Michael's lead to 20-13. 52 seconds before halftime.
Upset brewing? Vondrak throws his 3rd TD of the night, a 46-yarder to Brown that gives St. Michael's a 20-7 lead. 3:44 left before halftime.
Vondrak's second TD pass of the night goes 61 yards to Gifford. 14-7 SMCA, 9:26 left in the 2nd. #centexpreps
End of the first, with St. Michael's and Hyde Park tied at 7. #centexpreps
Hyde Park answers back. Bolger with a 10-yard pass to Daniels, who catches the deflected pass. 7-7, 3:02 left in the 1st.
St. Michael's strikes first on a 12-yard pass to Gabriel Cascarano. 7-0, 8:30 left in the 1st. #centexpreps
St. Michael's wins the coin toss and defers to the second half. Game is about to get underway here at Hyde Park Field. #centexpreps
This is a first for me. Talk about a multipurpose stadium! pic.twitter.com/gMyxhwhWqQ
Senior receivers Blake Aldridge (7 rec, 213 yds, 3 TD) and Thomas Orr (10 rec, 98 yds, TD) give Bolger and Hyde Park big threats downfield.
Senior RB Kyle Granger leads the Panthers' rushing attack. He has 400 yds and 6 TDs on 58 carries, while adding 118 yds and a TD in the air.
Hyde Park is quarterbacked by junior dual-threat Westlake transfer DJ Bolger. His year: 46/82, 820 yds, 7 TD, 3 INT; 31 car, 287 yds, 4 TD
Should also see a lot of SMCA senior receiver Will Brown, who leads team in receptions (17), receiving yards (269) and receiving TDs (4).
I'm excited to see SMCA junior jack-of-all-trades Smith Carlton. His season so far: 12/20, 86 yards 32 car, 134 yards, 3 TD 6 rec, 30 yards
Senior QB Gabriel Vondrak leads the charge for the Crusaders, completing 71 of his 133 passes for 818 yards and 6 TDs against 3 INTs.
Last year, Hyde Park won 26-23 in double OT for its first win against St. Michael's in more than a decade. SMCA is 6-1 in series since '05.
Meanwhile, the Panthers held district opponent St. Mary's Hall to 22 total yards last week on their way to a 56-7 thrashing.
Last week the Crusaders led 10-0 in the second quarter before conceding 28 unanswered points to fall to San Antonio Christian.
Hyde Park's (4-1, 1-0 TAPPS-II, District 3) only loss came to 4A Salado. The Panthers haven't missed the playoffs in more than a decade.
St. Michael's (1-5, 0-2 TAPPS-II, District 3) travels to Hyde Park Field looking for its first win since September 16 against Sacred Heart.

congrats on a huge game for both you and your team! That was the most exciting game I've seen all year.
As a sports reporter, I would certainly take a little less excitement. But that's what makes deadline writing so much fun.
That'll do it for my Hutto coverage tonight. As a fan it doesn't get any better than a last-second, homecoming-clinching interception.
Final from Hutto Memorial Stadium: Hutto 37, Elgin 34. Hippos get first district win on Homecoming night. What a thriller! #centexpreps
And it's an interception!! Antonio Luna picks it off at the goal line and that's the game! Hutto wins a thriller!!
A 35 yard pass gives Elgin first and goal!
Defense collapses the pocket and Strong has to throw it away. 3rd and 16, 24 seconds. #centexpreps
Sack! Elgin uses its second timeout. 2nd and 16 now, ball on the Hutto 40. 31 seconds left. #centexpreps
And it's incomplete! But pass interference on the defense gives Elgin a first down.
3rd and 3 and the Hippo defense stops Cook! 4th and 2, 41 seconds remaining, ball on Hutto 39. Timeout Elgin. #centexpreps
The press box is shaking from the fans stomping their feet on the bleachers.
Now 3rd and 10 from the Elgin 43, 1:15 remaining... and a generous spot gives the Wildcats the first down!
Elgin starts from its own 21 yard line, needing a field goal to send this game to overtime. 1:30 left. #centexpreps
A stop-and-go from Chase Griffin to DJ Baptist goes 23 yards to give Hutto the lead! The PAT is blocked so Hutto leads 37-34 with 1:36 left.
A false start makes it 4th and 7, but Hutto converts for the first down!
Big 4th and 2 from the Elgin 27, and Hutto will call timeout to draw up a plan. Season-defining play coming up for the Hippos. #centexpreps
The situation: Hutto has the ball at its own 38 yard line with 2:53 remaining, down 34-31. #centexpreps
And it's incomplete! Hutto is gonna get the ball back with a good chance to win its Homecoming game. Exciting finish here. #centexpreps
Elgin facing a big 3rd and 12 from its own 28, 3:05 left in the fourth. #centexpreps
Hutto not done yet. Milligan with his 3rd TD of the night, this time from 5 yards, pulls the Hippos within three. Elgin 34-31, 3:55 in 4th.
On the next play, Elgin's QB Strong runs it in from 13 yards for a TD. Wildcats go for 2 and convert. Hutto down 34-24 with 5:01 remaining.
Hutto gets an interception in the red zone, but a roughing the passer penalty will erase that.
On 4th and 1, Hutto commits consecutive false start penalties, and the ensuing 4th and 11 is incomplete. Elgin ball on it's own 27.
Jacob Cook runs it in from a yard to take back the lead for Elgin, but the two-point conversion is no good. 26-24 Wildcats, 8:16 left in 4th
After three quarters, it's Hutto 24, Elgin 20. Wildcats will start the fourth from the Hutto 20. #centexpreps
Elgin goes for it on fourth down for the second time in this quarter, and for the second time comes up empty. Hippos defense coming up big.
Jakobe Davidson with an incredible one-handed catch on an 18-yard pass to give Hutto its first lead of the night. 24-20, 6:37 left in 3rd.
Elgin turns it over on downs. Hutto will take over from its own 11. #centexpreps
Elgin receives the kickoff to start the second half, up 20-17. #centexpreps
Stat of the first half: Hutto sophomore QB Chase Griffin was 15/22 for 314 yards (!!!) #centexpreps
Halftime from Hutto Memorial Stadium: Elgin 20, Hutto 17 #centexpreps
Now Elgin faces 4th and goal from the 1, but the Hutto defense stonewalls Buchanan at the line. Hutto takes over with 3:23 left in the half.
Facing 4th and goal, Milligan punches it in from the 1. Elgin lead cut to 20-17, 6:10 left in the first half. #centexpreps
Word came up to the press box that Magana called his own number on this play. Wasn't drawn up by the coach.
Facing 4th and 12, Hutto punter Magana takes the snap and sprints to the first down line to keep the drive alive. #centexpreps
Elgin opens the second quarter with a 7-yard pass from Strong to Simmons to take a 20-10 lead (2 pt conversion no good). #centexpreps
Hutto continues to close the deficit. A 31-yard field goal from Bradley Magana is good. 14-10 Elgin, 1:47 left in the first. #centexpreps
We're in for a good one here. Hutto's Deary'on Milligan answers back with a 6-yard TD run. 14-7 Elgin, 8:20 in the 1st. #centexpreps
Hutto in a big hole early. Elgin's JaJuan Curtis returns an interception 57 yards for a TD (PAT blocked). 14-0 Elgin, 9:54 left in the 1st.
Hutto fumbles the opening kickoff and Buchanan punches it in from 4 yards. A bad snap on the PAT leads to a two point conversion. 8-0 Elgin
Fans starting to fill in as we're a half hour from kickoff in Hutto. #centexpreps pic.twitter.com/TYPZKgzcvm
...WR Tariq Buchanan (16 rec, 183 yds, TD; 10 rush, 87 yds, TD). Strong's favorite WR target is senior Kris Wyche (25 rec, 384 yds, 3 TD).
Elgin will look to a pair of senior dual-threat playmakers: QB DeAmonte Strong (64/114, 745 yards, 4 TD, 3 INT; 35 rush, 109 yds, TD) and...
But don't forget Hutto senior Deary'on Milligan (76 rush, 428 yds, 9 TD in '16), who had 145 total yards and 3 TD against Elgin last season.
Hutto has 7 new offensive starters from last year, including sophomore QB Chase Griffin. His season so far: 99/157, 1,245 yds, 13 TD, 5 INT
Both teams look to keep pace in a competitive 19-5A that features three undefeated schools, including reigning 5A DII champions Cedar Park.
Hutto (2-2, 0-2) had close losses to Georgetown (in OT) and Connally, and will look to get a first district win in its Homecoming game.
It's a big district matchup for both teams. Elgin (1-4, 1-2 19-5A) has won three of the past four in this matchup, but lost 42-8 last year.

Texas leads 10-8 as a lot of fans remaining on their feet between points. Definitely set for an exciting finish here. #HookEm
Texas grabs an 8-6 lead as the teams switch sides one final time. #HookEm
Wisconsin and Texas have split the first 10 points of the fifth and deciding set. #HookEm
The crowd gives a hearty boo after each time a Wisconsin player asks for a wet spot to wiped up.
A full house is on their feet as Wisconsin serves to start the fifth set. #HookEm
The Horns will play their first five-set match of the season. #HookEm
Texas needs a rally to avoid a fifth set. Down 21-24 with Chloe Collins serving. #HookEm
Now Wisconsin takes a timeout (there's a lot of timeouts I'm learning) with a 23-19 lead in the fourth. #HookEm
Wisconsin has opened a 21-16 lead in the fourth set. Is Texas gonna be pushed to a fifth set for the first time this season? #HookEm
Badgers take a 13-9 lead in the fourth set and the crowd is starting to feel a bit restless. #HookEm
Wisconsin takes a 10-8 lead in the fourth set, prompting Texas to call timeout. #HookEm
Can you ice a server in volleyball like a kicker in football? If so, it worked. Wisconsin serves into the net out of the timeout. #HookEm
Texas took an early 4-1 lead in the fourth set, but trail 5-4 now as they call timeout. #HookEm
That's the second time the ball has hit one of the championship banners, and each time Texas took the point. #HookEm
Friends in Low Places played over the PA and for a moment, I thought we were about to start the fourth quarter of an #okstate football game.
Wisconsin avoids the sweep as we head to a fourth set at Gregory Gym. #HookEm
Timeout Horns as they find themselves trailing 24-23 in the third set. Wisconsin will serve to win the set. #HookEm
Now 23-22 Texas as the student section is on their feet. #HookEm
A Palina Prieto Cerame ace gives the Horns an 18-17 lead and causes Wisconsin to call a timeout. #HookEm
We've reached the media timeout in the third set with UT up 15-14. Badgers not going down without a fight. #HookEm
We're back to trading points. Horns lead 11-9 in the third set. #HookEm
Wisconsin takes the first two points of the third set, but UT has taken five of the next six. 5-3 early UT lead. #HookEm
Through two sets, senior Chloe Collins leads the Horns in assists (19) and digs (7). Micaya White still leading in kills (8). #HookEm
Texas wins the second set! This Gregory Gym crowd can sense another big sweep. #HookEm
25-24 Horns as they will serve to win this second set. #HookEm
Wisconsin ties it at 23 but the following serve is too long. Horns serving to win the second set.
Freshman Micaya White is leading the Horns with eight kills so far in this match. #HookEm
Wisconsin gets a couple points after the timeout and UT will take one of their own. 18-16 Horns in the second set. #HookEm
Badgers have come close to tying this set a few times, but a raucous crowd has helped UT shut down each momentum swing. 18-14 UT #HookEm
Badgers look to be more composed after the timeout. UT lead cut to 10-8 in the second. #HookEm
Wisconsin looks rattled to start the second set, takes another timeout. UT out to an 8-3 lead. #HookEm
Opening point of the second set goes to the Horns. #HookEm pic.twitter.com/4NfGuckGvG
Crowd on their feet as UT serves for the set... and the Horns take it! #HookEm
Now Wisconsin with another timeout (how many of these do they get?) down 22-19 in the first set. #HookEm
Now Texas will take a timeout. 20-17 UT, still in the first set. #HookEm
Wisconsin will take a timeout down 18-14 in the first set. Exciting match so far. #HookEm
First media timeout has @TexasVolleyball with a 15-12 lead over @BadgerVB in the first set. #HookEm
Texas on a three-point run to retake the lead. 11-10 in the first set. #HookEm
Mostly packed house here as @BadgerVB wins the first point to get this match underway. #HookEm
I'm filling in for @aasdanny at Gregory Gym for #2 @TexasVolleyball vs #6 @BadgerVB . Game gets started in about 15 minutes @LonghornNetwork .
